customer_say: Customers find these running shoes to be well-made, comfortable, and easy for children to put on, with good durability and value for money. They appreciate the style, particularly the colors, and one customer mentions the nice wide toe box. The size receives mixed feedback - while some say they fit true to size, others find them too short. The velcro closure is problematic, with customers reporting that it doesn't stay in place.

Hurt my feet within an hour of wearing', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I ordered a 9. I‚Äôbe been 9 since high school. After 3 pregnancies my feet are slightly larger so on occasion I do size up. I decided to stick with 9.  Only problem is they sent me a 8 1/2.  At first I was devastated because these are the cutest most comfortable shoes I‚Äôve ever had. (Not exaggerating.)However they do run big, lengthwise, so they fit.  They were too tight at the opening and since there‚Äôs no tongue, I thought they‚Äôd never fit.  However after breaking them in by walking around the house and manually stretching that spot, they do fit.  I‚Äôm afraid to exchange for a 9, because they would be too long.  My feet already have a little wiggle room in the 8 1/2 and the mesh is ever so slightly stretchy.  I‚Äôd recommend getting your usual size, unless your feet are very wide, in that case size up. I would size down if you have VERY narrow feet.  I hope this helps. They‚Äôre adorable and I can‚Äôt wait to wear them teaching all day!', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes good-looking, comfortable, and lightweight, with one customer noting they're particularly suitable for kids with wide feet. However, the durability is concerning, with multiple customers reporting that the top/toe area comes apart after a month of wear. Moreover, the velcro quality is problematic, with customers noting it fails quickly and doesn't stay closed. The quality and value for money receive mixed feedback, with some customers praising them while others find them low quality and not worth the money.

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes to be a great American-made product with good support, particularly for weak ankles, and appreciate their comfort, with one customer noting they can run for 2 miles comfortably. The shoes offer plenty of space for toes and are suitable for wide feet, though some find the toe box too small. Durability is a concern as the toe webbing comes apart, and while some consider them worth the price, others feel the quality doesn't match the cost. The cushioning receives mixed feedback, with some finding it feels great while others say it's not too cushiony.
review: {'review': "Why did you pick this product vs others?:Excellent quality shoe from a company New Balance that has an excellent reputation. This replaced an earlier version of this model and it fit perfectly as expected. It's very stylish and I live the grey color with blue accents. The rollbar feature helps with my supination issue as it helps to prevent my foot from rolling out. It also helps my plantar fasciitis. This shoe is also very comfortable and provides excellent support.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'They fit and are extremely comfortable', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Husband has very wide feet and New Balance does a great service offering such wide sports shoes. They hold up real well and he finds them very comfortable.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'First time I have ever ordered shoes online. They fit perfect and exactly what I ordered in a very short time.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I had major foot reconstructive surgery, and my physician specifically told me to purchase these shoes.  I've owned plenty of New Balances before. These are bulkier than I expected, but don't look like an orthotic shoe (which is a win!).  They're comfortable, and the stiff sole is just what I need. I was able to put in my custom arch insoles.  The stiff sole and arch support reduce stress on my ankle, which is the goal for me.  I took off one star because a hole formed in the toe area after 1 month of light wear.  I suspect this was a defect, and not normal for this shoe.  Either way, Amazon customer service was awesome and let me return even a little outside of the return window.  I bought it again, and hopefully I'll have better luck.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I‚Äôve own these shoes for over 2 years. Running shoes? These things weigh about a pound a piece. Would never wear these to run in. These are stability shoes, if you need stability while running, to the point that a 1 pound shoe will help, then by all means by them.I use them to work in. My ankles tend to roll, and have never had a more durable shoe!! These shoes are tanks! It‚Äôs like having the armor around your feet. I‚Äôve worked in them for 2 years at a job 10 hours a day, 4 x‚Äôs a week and they look like they‚Äôre new. They‚Äôre hard as all get out, look like something Herman Munster would use, but no ankle movement and you are stable like you‚Äôve never been. Don‚Äôt get them to run. Get them if you‚Äôre not that stable walking around.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I have been wearing the 1540 and its predecessors for nearly 20 years. I have gone through at least 30 pairs. Before this one there was the 1122 and the 1121, both in various v versions. Once before, a new version was bad. The product got bad reviews and sales tanked. They then quickly fixed the problems and came out with a v2 version. This shoe series, along with Brooks "The Beast", are the 2 best shoes for people who may have planter fasciitis, use orthotics, are overweight and/or over pronate. It is built on the New Balance S2 last which produces a straight lasted shoe with extra room in the toe box. The extra room in the toe box is a big deal for people with diabetes, neuropathy, bunions, etc.I wear these shoes every day. I keep 3 pairs in service, wearing each pair every 3 days. This allows the foam in the soles to re-expand between wearings and keeps the foam soft and cushiony much longer. I put a new pair of shoes into service every 18 months, replacing the oldest pair with new ones.I could see immediately that the 1540v3 is a whole new design from the v2. I put on the shoes and wore them around the house all evening. I immediately noticed that the shoes do not have that wonderful, soft cushiony feel that I am accustomed too with a new pair of this series of shoes. The soles are much harder and have less cushioning. The main reason I replace these shoes is when they no longer have enough cushion in them. I can tell, because my feet will to hurt badly at the end of the day. So to start out with new shoes that already have hard soles is a non-starter for me.The second thing I noticed with the v3 is that I am feeling hard pressure points through the arch support area and also along the outside edges of the shoes. I think this is caused by the combination of my orthotic inserts and the harder soles of the shoes. The pressure points were bad enough to make my feet sore after wearing them around the house for a few hours. This is also a non-starter for me.The shoes also have completely re-designed outer soles and the shoes have a more solid feel when you plant your foot and walk forward. The shoes resist rolling to the inside or outside more than the v2s. I like this more solid feel, but time will tell whether this increases or decreases foot comfort.The length of this shoe is exactly the same as the v2 model. The toe box of the v3 has a little more room in it and feels less tight on the toes. The front of the v3 toe box now points inward a little unlike the v2 model which pointed straight ahead. This crowds the outside of the toes a little and could be a problem for people who have bunions. Bunions shift the toes towards the outside of the shoes and crowd the toes against the outside of the shoes. I do have small bunions, but with the wider toe box on the v3 model, I don\'t think it would be a problem for me. I think this change was made to make the shoes look more stylish, but could decrease comfort for some wearers.The shoes have more padding along the sides and rear of the ankles which makes them more comfortable in those areas.  I really like the new styling and colors of the gray and blue shoes. The uppers seem to be made of stronger, more durable materials that would resist staining.  These are all nice improvements. The main thing I have disliked about the previous models is that they seem to wear out to quickly for a shoe in this price range. The soles lose their cushioning and the outer soles seem to be made of a soft rubber that wears away too quickly, especially in the heels. Time will tell whether the v3\'s will last any longer.Because of the lack of cushioning in the soles, these shoes no longer work for me. I am going to try out a pair of the Brooks Addiction 14 which worked out pretty well for me when New Balance ruined the 1122 model some years ago. I  may also try out a New Balance 840v4 model. If others also find the soles too hard on the v3 model, we may be seeing a v4 coming out soon. In the mean time, I will be keeping my eye out for v2 shoes in my size and color.Update on July 2, 2021: I just saw an announcement that the 1540v4 shoes will be released in Oct. 2021. This, the V3 version, will start to show limited size availability and, shortly before the V4 is released, will be offered at big discounts. I hope the V4 goes back to a softer sole like the V2 version has. If so, I will likely start wearing them again. In other aspects, it is a very good shoe.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Based on the sizes shoe companies now market, I must have rare narrow feet. So most of the shoes I've bought for the past few years have been way too wide for me.  Finally found these New Balance shoes in narrow width!  First shoes in years that are comfortable and stable!  Beyond that, they're well-made and look pretty good.  The relatively low stack height and minimal drop also contribute to their stability. If you prefer the super cushy type where you have no feel for where the ground is, you should probably try something else. But if you want fit and stability, try these.a", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

I wouldn't recommend for daily wearing, which is what I needed when I purchased these shoes, they're just not comfortable for me, but I will say, I'm a bigger guy, so that may be some of the reason. I will say though, I've had Nike shoes for years and daily wore them with absolutely no issues. I was actually replacing a pair of New Balance shoes with this pair, and after receiving this pair, I noticed immediately several differences, including the previously mentioned stitching, the weight was different, which I attributed to the different shoe model, but the logo was also different and looked as though it was screenprinted on and not a stitched on logo, which looked and felt cheap, almost like a counterfeit. I will say, the shoes have good grip, but I definitely feel it after wearing them all day. My feet stay tired most of the day while wearing these, but can't afford to replace them after only wearing for a few months. The problems with tired feet started day 1, so it's not a recent issue. I probably wouldn't buy them again, but I'm a unique situation, wearing them daily, all day, they might be better for working out or running, but for walking I wouldn't recommend. Very little support when it comes to foot sole support. I should say I purchased these on sale and I was able to receive them in 2 days, which was the main reason for my purchase.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great fitting shoes & so comfortable & last!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

I wear them to work and they are wide enough to make my feet very comfortable. They provide support for being on my feet all day.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Historically New Balance only makes certain shoe models with their extra wide sizing.  The retro/fashionable models haven\'t usually been included in that bucket.  So when I saw these new 515\'s on my BIL\'s also wide feet and saw them being offered with this many colorways, on Amazon, for less than $100, it seemed too good to be true.I know I\'m writing this like I\'m about to bring up a big "but" with these shoes...  But I\'m actually not.  They\'re actually extremely well made, breathable in the summer heat and surprisingly comfortable, even with just an EVA midsole and thin hard rubber outsole.  I\'m also one of those weird goth kids from the 90\'s who proved it wasn\'t just a phase, so the minimalist blacked-out colorway also gave me a bit of the fizz.  The wider 4E fit and footprint is also identical to what I\'m used to with my other New Balance faves (the 410v5 dark Trail Runners) but the materials feel even more substantial and quality.  Though I will admit that the sole response of the 515\'s is less springy and athletic-feeling than those kicks.That said, I\'ve been wearing these shoes a LOT this summer and they haven\'t disappointed yet.  The leather has held up and stayed clean with no fraying at the seams or obvious signs of wear inside or out.  The midsole has well broken into the shape of my foot and toes, providing a decent amount of support and grip without looking agressively athletic.  Which seems to leave the 515\'s striding a happy line between looks and functionality that have made them my go-to running around town shoes going forward.If you have wide feet, you could do a lot worse.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'After YEARS of wearing all sorts of shoes, and ALWAYS ending up with the outer sides of the shoes basically folded over the souls (so it looks like I\'m walking on 2 broken feet), I had an epiphany of sorts. "Maybe, just maybe, I have a \'WIDE\' foot?" I said this out loud in front of my wife who looked at me with that look and replied "I\'ve literally been saying this for 2 decades."  So, I ordered these. Surprise, surprise, they fit perfectly, my feet hurt way less, and I don\'t look like Quasimodo Frankenstein after having broken them in. No blown out sides and I might just try the "extra wide" option next buy. Thanks for offering "Wide" options and sizing options higher than 12, and at an affordable price New Balance and Amazon!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': "A Fantastic Everyday Trainer and Great Value!I've been extremely happy with the New Balance Men's 520 V8 Running Shoe! This has become my go-to shoe, not just for running but for all-day wear, and it delivers exactly what you need at a great price point.Here‚Äôs what makes this shoe a winner:‚Ä¢ Excellent Comfort for Daily Use: The EVA midsole cushioning hits a sweet spot, providing a soft and comfortable ride without feeling mushy. Whether I'm on a short run, walking the dog, or just on my feet all day, they feel supportive and light.‚Ä¢ Lightweight and Breathable: The engineered mesh upper is fantastic. It keeps my feet cool and comfortable, which is essential, especially on warmer days or during an intense workout. The shoe feels light on my foot, not bulky at all.‚Ä¢ Great Versatility and Value: For the price, the durability and quality are top-notch. It‚Äôs a great, all-around shoe perfect for beginners, gym work, and casual daily running. It holds up well and still looks sharp.If you‚Äôre looking for a dependable, comfortable, and stylish shoe that offers fantastic performance without breaking the bank, the New Balance 520 V8 is an absolute must-buy! Highly recommended for anyone needing a solid everyday athletic shoe.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very nice and comfortable. Would buy again.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This is my first pair of New Balance running shoes. I\'ve been running for over 15 years and have mainly stuck with Asics and Brooks as my primary trainers. Obviously the 520\'s are a budget pair of running shoes and are not going to be as nice or as durable as a more expensive flagship pair, but I\'ve purchased many $40-60 Asics and these are fairly comparable. The 520 v8\'s are very light shoes with a neutral fit and a smooth tread. They make excellent racing shoes, but aren\'t a great option for longer distances. These shoes feel very stiff to me, more so than any of my Asics within this price range ($54). But take that with a grain of salt as my other pair of shoes right now are the Hoka Mach 5\'s ($160) that are by far the most comfortable, cushy shoes I\'ve ever had. These are a great light shoe for runs under 5-6 miles at a time. I\'ve found they start to lose cushion and get pretty hard after that. I tried a half marathon in these and wished I would have brought a second pair for the second half. They started to feel hard around mile 6 and by mile 8-9 they\'d lost all cushion.In terms of longevity, I don\'t see these shoes making it much past 250miles. But again as a budget pair, that stacks up to the competition. I\'ve been able to average around 300 miles in my "cheaper" Asics. They now have 100 miles on them, and so far they\'ve visibly held up well, but already have a permanent crease in the mid-sole. The tread is holding up great with slight wear on the toe. The mesh, laces, and even the interior are all holding up well with no wear holes in the heel. (Like every pair of Asics get) I do have some light staining on the mesh / outside of the shoe, but of course being such a light color that\'s going to happen with outdoor running in the winter. I actually prefer these shoes for outdoor running over the treadmill. They\'re light and feel great as a fast shoe, but they\'re just lacking cushion for long runs or treadmill running. I also second the review talking about long laces. These shoes have the longest laces I\'ve ever had on a pair of shoes. I mean annoyingly long; but you could always replace them easily. So far I\'ve enjoyed these shoes enough to own another pair of New Balance running shoes, but my next "budget" pair will be Asics again.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excellent fit really great and excellent for running.i work out slot at a local gym', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Grandson LOVES these‚Ä¶‚Ä¶took them out of the box & has worn them daily', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'One of the first things my PT said to me when I started therapy for my back was "You got good shoes." I\'ll take that as a thumbs up. These may have laces but they go on easy, and they\'re quite comfortable for a relatively inexpensive pair of sneakers. They look good IMHO, and New Balance products always seem to be made well. I\'m not a runner so I can\'t attest to the functionality of the tread pattern, which is a bunch of "bubbly" circles; however I find these very comfortable for exercise-level walking or for daily activities and casual work.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I have worn these shoes only during my daily walk which is about 3.25 miles.  These were delivered on August 27, 2025.  Looking at the calendar, I have only worn them a little over 3 weeks and the sole is already worn down/out.  I walk on black top and concrete but I would expect NB shoes to last more than 4 weeks.  If you are looking for a good walking shoe, these aren't the ones to buy.  They were advertised as a running shoe, so I expected they would be good for walking, that was my mistake.", 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very light weight. Nit much arch support', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'}

They provide good arch support, particularly with inserts, and customers consider them excellent value for money. The size receives mixed feedback - while some say they are true to size and width, others find them too small.
review: {'review': 'I am thoroughly amazed and grateful these are just what I needed. My last pair of NB were walking shoes and was last bought 5 or 6 years ago. I do tons of walking but don\'t drag my feet so the soles don\'t wear fast and I don\'t let them get wet, but it was time to get a new pair. These new ones are perfect in every way, absolute comfort, roominess, but snug enough fit with a good amount of comfort padding inside, and they have the exact size dimensions of the last size 15\'s I had from 5 to 6 years ago, maybe a slight tad wider for even better comfort. I love that they don\'t pronate (tilt to one side from overly spongy soles) and are even more stable for the ankle than the last ones. They also don\'t have excessive heel height which is a huge problem for me in this trend of making heels too high since i have ankle issues and had to have surgery on my feet at age 4, so I was told my my orthopedic doctor my feet could not handle excess sloping, i.e., higher heels. In this regard, it reminds me of barefoot shoes with a flatter more even profile, but still with good arch support and still perfect shock absorbing comfort (not excessive since I can\'t handle excess arches). Glad I came across the perfect fit shoe for me, though there is one thing I hope will last and that is four of the shoelace eyelets in the middle were done differently for stylistic reasons: they are put through some type of fabric loop instead of the leather that the other holes are made to go through. If those loops have stitching that fails at some point then one would have to resort to drilling a hole into the leather where it normally would go through because they had to do this "cool" looking style feature. Who knows, maybe it will last okay. The price is great too, and hope they don\'t read this and raise it!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The fit is perfect. The size is exactly what it says it is they‚Äôre comfortable well-made and perfect for work shoes awesome value. Very good support good quality shoe.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes were recommended to me by a podiatrist friend.  He said they were the best bargain out there for a quality tennis shoe that was actually good for your feet.  I can\'t agree more.  These have become my go to tennis shoe.  I walk about 15 miles a week on a wooded trail and these have held up over a year.  I have ordered several extra pairs for wearing around the house or with shorts in the summer.  They have all performed great and they are so comfortable.They have been called "Dad" shoes...well I am a Dad so no problem here.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'It‚Äôs not the greatest show but i‚Äôm a sucker for an old man show. Comfortable and they fit my feet pretty well. Not to bad if you drive manual and want a shoe you can do that in too. They don‚Äôt look to bad in my opinion ether, solid buy for the price i got it at.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This is not the shoe for shoe afficianados.  Although the style is very basic, it is very comfortable and stable while exercising.  This an ideal "dad shoe" for those looking for a solid daily wear shoe.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I bought this pair (12W) on August 23, 2024 and they have been great to wear on my daily walks. I have walked nearly 2 million steps since then in these shoes and they have great durability. I rotate them with another pair that I bought on Oct. 27, 2024, which has helped reduce the wear and tear. I removed the insoles and replaced them with PowerStep ProTech Control Orthotic Insoles and my feet feel great. The weight feels great on my feet and I don't have any foot fatigue after walking 10,000-20,000 steps in them. The 12W are now too wide for my feet but I still highly recommend this shoe. They are easy to clean and still look good on the outside. On the inside, I've worn the heel area out.I purchased the White/Team Royal version in size 12. I loved these as they fit better as I've been losing weight. The downside, the inside cushioning around the heel and ankle is gone. Worn out. I guess roughly 2,000,000 steps is a bit too much for this pair. Nonetheless, I do recommend these 608s.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Using these as outside work shoes since I walk over 7000 steps a day 6 days a week. The fit is perfect and they are true to size. The weight is about that of a casual hiking shoe; obviously not as light as a runner but not as heavy as my old work shoes. They feel both comfortable and tough at the same time. I‚Äôm hoping this will be the perfect combination for out door work where I don‚Äôt need a steel toe or necessarily strong water resistance.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-designed, and appreciate their quality and value for money. The slides receive positive feedback for their soft cushioning while running. The fit and durability receive mixed reviews - while some customers say they're the correct size and hold up well, others find them too narrow for size D(M) and report durability issues.
review: {'review': "I workout constantly and go through 4 to 5 pairs of athletic shoes every year.  With all the physical demands placed on my footwear, I've come to rely upon a few select brands.  New Balance is one of those brands.  Consistently reliable fit, always comfortable footbed, and made of durable and eye-catching materials.  This 680v3 is no exception.  The cushioning and construction support the foot well despite the workout load.  The toe box is sufficiently roomy.  Cushioning under the heel pocket and the metatarsal is substantial, yet it retains good motion control (lateral) for varied activities.  Removable footbed allows for orthodicts or foot beds with more cushioning.  But I have to say, this sneaker was comfortable right out of the box.  I use this pair for intense elliptical training and have enjoyed their support, construction, and good looks for 2 months now.  Great shoe!  Highly recommend!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "If you're like me and have humongous feet, you know how hard it is to find any kind of footwear. You generally find something that's comfortable and available, and stick with that brand and size. For me, it's been New Balance 14 extra wide for the last 20 years or so (yes, I'm a dad, and old). This has been fine for sneakers, and I even got a pair of NB hikers that have been working pretty great for me.My family and I love the beach, and every time we find ourselves shopping at the beach, I instinctively check the flip flop rack for something in a 14. To this day, I've never seen anything on those racks above a 13. So I went to Amazon, found a nice looking pair of flip flops, and the largest size they had was a 14. Figuring I could return if it didn't fit, I pulled the trigger. When I got them, I couldn't even get my toes past the straps. There is no way they were bigger than a 12!So I continued shopping the Amazon, and lo and behold, these New Balance slides showed up in my search results. Thinking they've never steered me wrong in the past (and I could return them again if they didn't fit), I decided to buy these in 14 X-wide.Like a lot of people said, they definitely need some breaking in. I just wore them around the house with socks on (never with socks in public though) for a few days, and they feel amazing now. I generally don't leave reviews this quickly, because I like to see how they hold up after a few months, but so far, so good. They feel relatively sturdy, and given how quickly I destroy shoes (I'm a big, active guy), I'll be happy to get two summers out of these, and with what I've seen so far, I don't think they'll disappoint.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I love the thicker bottom for added comfort but not too thick. I used these as home slippers. It's tighter than Puma. For Puma it's bigger so I usually go 2 size down for slides but for New Balance their sizes are smaller and more narrow so I went 1 size down. it fits but a little tight. Over time I'm sure it'll loosen up with break in.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'While I think this shoe is fine; I the removable insert that comes with the shoe is very thin and rather hard/stiff. As such, I thought these shoes were rather uncomfortable. I should note that I weigh 195; and as such, prefer a shoe with a little more cushion. (Not that it needs to be like a pillow; but I find thinner/harder insoles uncomfortable).I was going to return these shoes; but I purchased some insoles (around $20) that provide much more cushion. Perhaps a guy who weighs less would find these shoes comfortable as is, with a thinner/hard insole; but I did not.Now that I have the softer insoles instead of the hard/thin insole that came with this shoe; I find this shoe very comfortable.I also like the square/boxy toe box; which gives my toes plenty of room, rather than a more tapered shoe that narrows at the toes.These shoes cost much less than many of the running shoes available. (Which is nice). However, be aware that if you are not a light-weight guy; you may need to spend a little more money to buy some softer insoles to put in these shoes.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great fit, and comfortable materials.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Good slides very comfortable', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I'm not sure if it's in the description but it should be posted that the width is too narrow feels like women sandals but it's seemed comfortable", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Honestly, these are some pretty nice sandals. My old pair had worn out so I was looking for something a little more stylish, and I‚Äôm glad to say these hit the mark. The navy blue color is sharp, and the logo adds a nice contrast while still being understated. They fit true to size and are very comfortable.The ridges under the toes took a little bit of getting used to, but after wearing them for a while I‚Äôve found they actually help keep the sandal in place. I mostly wear these around the house, and they provide a surprising amount of arch support ‚Äî which is rare for sandals ‚Äî so they‚Äôre comfortable for extended wear. The suede-like material wipes clean easily if you spill something on them, and the stitching feels very solid. They are also fairly lightweight, but not to the level of a shower flip flop.Overall, they seem durable and well-made, a great value for a comfortable and stylish sandal from a quality brand.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these tennis shoes excellent for actual play, comfortable, and lightweight, with good arch support and stability during quick lateral movements. The fit and size receive mixed feedback - while some find them a good fit, others report they're too tight in the toe box and one size too small. The slip resistance and durability also get mixed reviews, with some praising the traction on tile while others note the soles wear out quickly.

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-designed, and perfect for trail running and hiking, with excellent traction that provides more grip than boots. review: {'review': 'Old, tired, new knees, like to walk in the woods for exercise - that describes me.Great fit, great comfort, aggravating laces - that describes these shoes.Got a great price on these.  They are trail shoes and provide great traction and generally keep crap out of my socks and the shoes.  I probably have 100 miles on them now and they\'ve held up well.  Only downside is the lace "system", the laces drop through the eyelets to a cord loop that makes adjusting them a bit of a pain.  That said, I\'ll reconfigure the laces and keep on trucking.  very comfortable, have toe bumpers to protect my tootsies off trail and keep my big toes from cutting their way out.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great fitting shoe, with tons of cushion. These are perfect for walking on hiking trails or any outdoor activity. Completely worth the cost for a long lasting, perfect shoe.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Folks,I am 57 years old, and have been buying New Balance sneakers for well over 3 decades..I have always appreciated the company‚Äôs dedication to providing a high quality product that ‚Äòeveryone can wear‚Äô to get good foot support ‚Äì walking, jogging, running, or even hiking ‚Äì instead of just selling out and peddling high priced sneakers with celebrity sports star endorsements..As I get older, I don‚Äôt like ‚Äòwhite sneakers‚Äô as much as I used to.. Too hard to keep clean!! LOL..And, sometimes I would even complain ‚ÄìHey! New Balance! Love your sneakers!! But can you please stop with the new model numbers every few weeks? Good Lord! The 608s became 623s, and on and on!!Hey, New Balance!!! I just want a pair of sneakers, not a Bingo game!! LOL..Anyway, I went shopping on Amazon for a new pair of New Balance sneakers.. No white.. I wanted a pair with some color that would not need to be scrubbed with a ‚ÄòMr. Clean Magic Eraser‚Äô every time I walked on my lawn to fill the birdfeeder..And I saw these sneakers..New Balance Dynasoft Tektrel V1 Trail Running Shoes..And I fell in love!New Balance was offering them in a variety of colors, but the ‚ÄòBlack Phantom Magnet‚Äô color really appealed to me, so I took a chance and ordered a pair..Couple of notes ‚Äì** I ordered these on December 12, and they just came on February 4.. But they were worth the wait!** Fit is -as always from New Balance - as expected!** Superb quality materials and construction, as always!** My pics cannot do these sneakers justice.. They are simply wonderful, and they look great ‚Äì even out of the box before I bothered tying the laces!!** I cannot rate their performance on a hiking trail yet, but the ‚Äòdesign of the soles‚Äô on these sneakers looks to be ‚Äòaggressive‚Äô enough to handle many different surfaces, providing excellent traction while also providing support and comfort to the foot..** The ‚Äòlacing structure‚Äô of these sneakers is really cool!! The laces lace up at both the ‚Äòtongue‚Äô of the sneaker and the sides of the sneaker all the way down to the top of the sole.. The whole thing looks nice and I would imagine also provides extra support..Bottom Line ‚Äì I highly recommend these sneakers! Another great product by the legendary New Balance! 5 Stars!!!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "They look good and are comfortable. They are a little narrow. If you have wide feet, I wouldn't order", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Oh MY GOD! SO.... somehow I made it to age 33 without ever wearing even 1 comfortable shoe in my whole life.....but this shoe lol wow! I usually wear the more stylish vans or adidas those are my go to shoes but I've been hiking lately every weekend and have had blisters on the back of my ankles for months and foot aches- such pain, makes hikes take forever and sometimes i slip and fall..... I wore these on my 8 mile hike  up and down steep and slippery rocks and valleys and all sorts of different terrain, my feet feel great the next day. While wearing them i feel SO PLANTED , i'ts really such an incredible feeling to have a usable hiking shoe lol .... they aren't bad looking for a hiking shoe i actually think they're oddly cute but omg dude, I love these... so necessary.  10000000% recommend.  I ordered my regular size converted to mens but and returned /had to go up a half size for a better feel and so glad I did. Ah!!!! I can't say enough about these amazing shoes lol. Light breathable comfortable grippy planting -perfect shoes!!!!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are great quality and so comfortable to wear the fit is excellent! Love them', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I've only had these a few days but they are very comfortable shoes so far. The breath great with plenty of room for your toes.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I buy 10 wide for a nice roomy shoe. Update: After a few days wearing them, they did stretch a bit, but they are still tighter than you would expect in the toe for a wide.", 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': 'I love these shoes!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I have another pair that have finally worn out since 2017. product: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam Arishi V3

review: {'review': "I love these. They're my fav brand of sneakers. Fit perfectly and are comfortable from day one.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These shoes feel like slippers. Very lightweight and comfortable fit. I bought them with the intention of using them for long walks and they work perfect for that purpose. I have also ended up wearing them to work most days as they are just too comfortable to pass up when I'm grabbing shoes in the morning.**All that said, I do not use these shoes for jogging or hiking. I prefer a shoe with lots of stability when I jog and hike and these have very little of it. I have a fair amount of pronation in my steps and these are not able to account for that. And as far as hiking goes, these shoes not only have no support, but the sole has no traction whatsoever.I would recommend this shoe to anyone looking for a very comfortable walking shoe and/or casual everyday shoe. But I would not recommend these shoes for any use with a higher impact than just walking around.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I was looking for a wide-fit running show that was affordable, as I am just starting to run as part of my efforts to improve my health and activity. I wanted something to try as a test, typically I just run in whatever shoes I have, but I\'ve found that my feet hurt and often form blisters.These met my price criteria and had great reviews at the price point, often taking the "budget" spot on top-lists on various sites. I\'m not disappointed. My feet don\'t hurt and I haven\'t had anymore blisters despite increasing the distance in which I run vs. walking. That said, they aren\'t perfect for my wide feet in particular. I have found that they don\'t have enough in the arch department. This could be specific to my foot shape, but I\'ve found that while it is wide enough to be comfortable, along the center it doesn\'t have  a wide enough base and my foot tends to rock inward as it lands. This leads to at least one of my feet becoming fatigued as that interior muscle along my arch tenses to make up for the lack of support.  If you have wide feet with little to no arch, this could be an issue for you as well. You\'ll want to stick to even terrain to combat this and pay attention to how your stride is landing, my neighborhood doesn\'t offer much perfectly flat road, unfortunately.That said, they are cheap, they are light, they keep my feet feeling fresh after a workout, instead of feeling sore all over. No blisters, no rubbing, no noticeable wear so far. A great holdover shoe for beginners until they can graduate to more expensive contenders in the wide-footed running space.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I had been trying for nearly a year to find a new tennis shoe for my workouts. I love New Balance so I kept trying different ones they offered but to no avail. I didn't like how bulky some of them felt. And it was quite an ordeal, because where I live there are like 3 options for stores to buy shoes. So I was mostly buying online, trying on at home, and then sending back when they didn't work out. Finally, it dawned on me that I should search for the style of New Balance that I already had. Sure enough, this one came up. I was skeptical after placing the order, thinking surely this will be another fail. But no, they fit great just like the previous ones I had of this style. I typically wear a 10, but since they're for exercising, I went up to an 11, because you always want that extra room for your toes. They're light weight, very comfortable and exactly what I wanted. Success!!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Finally a shoe that fits me. I love New Balance. NB designs and comforts are great. I tried another brand to switch out. It felt like I was walking on wood. NB is easy to put on and off. Bottom part is not very soft compared to my previous NB. But I don‚Äôt walk too much as So it‚Äôs ok. If you don‚Äôt walk for many miles, it‚Äôs great sneakers. I got size 81/2. I wear this size. It fits just right. I buy 81/2 in other brands too. So this size fits true. Great price on Amazon too.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Love these shoes, take them with me to the gym, man I'm still using them. review: {'review': 'These shoes are exactly what I wanted. They‚Äôre very comfortable. They do run a little small. Recommend people buy that for work.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Apparently the corporate agenda has taken over New Balance footwear. These shoes are made of cheap material all over, like every piece of them.Let me explain, the top of the toe is flimsy and offers no support. It‚Äôs like wearing a plastic bag on your foot. I‚Äôve actually worn plastic bags on my feet when I was a kid playing in the snow. We used to wear them under our winter boots so our toes didn‚Äôt get soaked after the whole day of winter fun. These shoes feel pretty much the same as just the bag. No support at all, anywhere.If you haven‚Äôt worn bags on your feet like me, maybe you‚Äôve tried on a pair of water shoes. They‚Äôre about as supportive as water shoes. The  toe box doesn‚Äôt exist. Side to side support doesn‚Äôt exist. And the heel box is almost nonexistent. I mean it‚Äôs there, (heel box), but for a company like New Balance to be selling shoes this cheaply made is not what I‚Äôm used to from this brand. This company used to sell shoes that gave you.. well, good balance. Their shoes passed the twist test, were made of leather, and had support every where you wanted it, and even where you didn‚Äôt know you needed it.The tongue is tiny, and bunches up between the lace holes exposing your sock from the top of the shoe. Not good.Laces came untied multiple times the two times I wore these.Nonslip capability‚Ä¶well, they are somewhat nonslip. But I always use nonslip shoes, and out of my last 5 pairs, these are the worst non slip soles I‚Äôve had. You can tell they‚Äôre better than a regular running or hiking shoe sole, but hoka, keen, doc Martin, sieka, and crocks, are all way better and safer.I would say a fair price for these shoes would be about $19.99.I‚Äôm looking back at this review and feeling so bad because it‚Äôs so negative. But really if you get these shoes you will see for yourself. I do plan on getting the upgraded version of these nonslip. They‚Äôre almost twice as expensive, but hopefully they‚Äôre worth it.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice nonslips for restaurant work, a bit more stylish than many other options out there. Very much true to size. If you normally wear size X, buy these in that same size  X to wear with a light to medium thickness sock.Can‚Äôt speak to durability just yet as they are still fairly new.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "They were the most comfortable non slip shoes I could find, but they only lasted 9 months. product: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam Rcvry V1 Slide
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, stylish, and appreciate their cushioning that's neither too soft nor mushy. The shoes provide good support, with one customer noting they're great for those with back or hip pain, and customers report their feet don't slip while wearing them. While some customers say the shoes are great for wide feet, others find them too tight. The sizing receives mixed feedback, with some customers saying they fit well while others report sizing issues.
review: {'review': "I wear these slides for doing work around the house, and they're super supportive and comfortable. The cushioning keeps my legs from becoming fatigued, even after I've completed a morning run, but is not overly squishy. I tried Crocs for the same purpose, but Crocs really made my feet hurt.I normally wear women's size 10.5, medium width, in New Balance running shoes, and ordered these in size 9. The fit is just right. Happy I found them!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These are great recovery slides.  I love New Balance for the arch support and cushion.  Be ware, the cream colored seem to not be true to size vs the black. Seems to be a manufacturing issue, I called New Balance, rep could have cared less!  In the cream I had to order a full size down.  I usually wear a W 9.5 and order a M 8.  In the cream color I had to order a W 8.5, M 7 and they fit perfectly!  I wear them everyday, have a pair in black as well.  Had plantar fasciitis and wear these in the house to support my feet.  Good quality, feet don‚Äôt slip.  I highly recommend.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'First thing I noticed when I put them on is that the hexagon shapes at the heel is very sharp, feels like stepping on needles.  I had to grind away the foam with a dremel. The fit was a little tight, but a few minutes with a hair dryer resulted in a perfect fit.  These do look fantastic and are very comfortable.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': '- Sandals are cushiony, sinking in just a little to a solid-ish bed but without feeling too pillow soft or mushy. Have Fresh Foam shoes and can confirm the feel is similar.- Textured footbed provides grip for soles of feet so the sandal doesn\'t slip around. Also provides a slight relaxing massage feel.- Look is slightly bulky but overall pretty stylish, making more of a fashion statement that an IDGAF flip flop or velcro sandal.- Fit is a hit or miss. Width wise, this sandal fits both narrow and wide (2E) feet. However, the height of the upper (clearance from the footbed to the strap) does not correctly fit the proper foot size. Feet two (2) sizes smaller than the stated size cannot fully slide into it because of how restrictively low the upper is. The strap stretches somewhat, but after a few weeks of use it has not "stretched out" and always gives a too-tight-on-top-of-foot feel as if you were wearing a shoe one size too small and pulled the laces unreasonably tight.If you can dig the look and have not-tall feet (sole to top of foot), this recovery slipper will serve you well. For those of us with normal height feet, look elsewhere unless you like an extra snug feel - three stars ***', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Most comfortable slides all day wear. Great for those with back or hip pain. Walk 8000 steps in one day with no real discomfort and having hip arthritis. Could replace your shoes.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'i purchased these for a week in disney world but i wear them all the time. they are great slippers for casual wearing but also comfortable on long walks. ive even been complimented on them by other slide connoisseurs. dont let the high price scare you off, they are durable and functional.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My son loves these shoes. They fit great and are true to size. They have a good arch support and are perfect for after football practice. Great price too.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I like New Balance products but these were ridiculously uncomfortable and felt like two different sizes. Sent back.', 'rating': '2.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X 1080 V14
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, high quality, and appreciate their soft cushioning, with one customer noting they hug the feet like pillows. They are excellent for walking and running, making full-day wear easier. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some find them snug without being tight, others say they're too narrow in the toe box. Stability and durability also get mixed reviews, with some finding them stable and worth the price, while others report them falling apart quickly and not being worth the cost.
review: {'review': "This is my second pair of 1080s, and the V14 just took things to another level. I wear these for everything ‚Äî running, long walks, even just daily errands ‚Äî and they‚Äôve honestly become my favorite all-around shoe.The Fresh Foam X cushioning is the real deal. It feels soft but still gives me enough bounce, especially when I‚Äôm putting in a few miles on pavement. There‚Äôs no weird break-in period ‚Äî they felt great right out of the box.What I noticed most with this version is the improved upper ‚Äî it wraps around your foot more snugly without feeling tight. It breathes well too, which I appreciate here in Florida. My feet don‚Äôt feel overheated even on long runs.I have slightly wide feet and went with the standard width, and they still felt roomy enough in the toe box. Sizing was true for me. The traction is solid too ‚Äî I haven‚Äôt had any slipping, even on damp sidewalks.If you're looking for a shoe that can handle real mileage but still feel great just walking around town, this is it. Yeah, they‚Äôre not cheap ‚Äî but for what they do, they‚Äôre totally worth the price.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The New Balance Fresh Foam 1080 v14 is one of the most comfortable running shoes I‚Äôve tried. The Fresh Foam cushioning feels soft underfoot while still giving plenty of support, making it great for long runs, workouts, or even just being on your feet all day. The upper is lightweight and breathable, and the fit hugs the foot without feeling too tight.Traction is solid, and the shoe feels stable on different surfaces. Whether you‚Äôre running or just looking for an everyday sneaker with serious comfort, the 1080 v14 delivers.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I have worn several different New Balance models. All in 9.5 4E. As other reviewers have noted this shoe is a bit more snug however that works perfectly for me. Others have suggested buying 1/2 size larger. I‚Äôm so glad that I did not. I would call this correctly sized. The shoe is very comfortable, very spongy to walk on. Expensive, yes but after wearing them for a week on my daily 5 mile walk I‚Äôm very pleased with this purchase. Far superior to the NB 940 they replaced.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "The New Balance 1080v14 delivers outstanding comfort and soft cushioning that's perfect for daily wear and long walks. I usually get a size 11, but if a 10.5 Wide is available, I would opt for it for a slightly better fit. Overall, a solid, high-quality shoe that I‚Äôm glad I picked up on Amazon!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "They lack stability and if you're a heavier person the sole will squish all the way down and the shoes can be wobbly sometimes but they are sooo comfortable, if you have neutral pronation and aren't too heavy I recommend them. I sadly returned them due to the squishyness but I will be honest and say I miss how soft they felt.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'High quality, the right size as expected, very comfortable, very light.  I use it for running on off-road and on asphalt.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Slipped on the Fresh Foam X 1080s and I swear I heard my feet whisper, ‚ÄúThank you.‚Äù These shoes are ridiculously comfy ‚Äî like someone convinced a cloud to get a PhD in foot support.Whether I‚Äôm jogging, walking, or just doing laps around the kitchen pretending I‚Äôm productive, these babies deliver bounce, cushion, and style. They‚Äôre so light, I double-checked to make sure I didn‚Äôt accidentally leave the soles in the box.My knees are no longer filing complaints, my feet are basically in therapy recovery mode, and I now judge every other shoe like, ‚ÄúDo you Fresh Foam though?‚ÄùIf you‚Äôre on the fence ‚Äî hop off. These shoes will catch you. Softly.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These are the most comfortable shoes I've ever wore in my life. I used to run a lot in the Army. I've always wore New Balance due to their comfort. It's been over Ten years since I've been in the army so I haven't had a reason to wear New Balance. I decided to get back in shape and start running again so I purchased these 1080 fresh foam X New Balance shoes. OH MY GOD! New Balance has completely changed the game. These shoes are the most comfortable shoes I've ever owned. It feels like your running on comfort and they are very light weight too. These are game changers. I highly recommend these shoes for running or walking.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X 840V1
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes exceptionally comfortable, well-built, and great for walking, with one customer noting the laces stretch for increased comfort. review: {'review': 'A very comfortable and form fitting sneakers üëü It is light weight and gives the feeling of walking on air. If your foot is narrow or long, this shoe is not for you. My husband, for example, wears a NB 1080. I could never wear that model. The shape of the shoe is way different. But it\'s annoying that for a wide shoe, they use short shoe laces. There is not enough room to tie a knot unless I go down an eyelet. WHY? This is such an unnecessary oversight. Irritating--I will have to buy new laces. FYI the laces they give you are 48". I figure a 54" lace will work better.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Like you are stepping on a thick sponge.Really good shock absorption.I have a none on bone knee issue so impacts and daily shock from walking makes my knee sore and swollen.I wanted to give this a try to absorb some impact, do far very pleased.Have not worn any other show since they were delivered.If you are on your feet a lot or impact make your feet tired or achy,  I woukd suggest trying g these. They're a little bulky compared to my regular running shoes, but the cushion is night and day. I'll live with the bulk and I have been happily. Extremely light and soft cushioned mid sole.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I was disappointed to learn that New Balance was discontinuing 840 V5 Running Shoe.  It has been the best shoe that I have ever owned.  I went online to find its replacement and it was recommended to try this shoe.  It is not as stable as the 840 V5 Running Shoe.  The fit is narrower even on the wide version which I bought.  The size seems to run 1/2 size smaller as I found the arch of this shoe pressing against my heel leaving me feeling like I want to slide my heel rearward in the shoe.  The foam in the shoe is squishy and leaves footing feeling unbalanced and unstable.I will be looking for new brand of shoes as New Balance seems more concerned with introducing new features to sell shoes instead of providing a product that is good for customer.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Feel greatThe laces even stretch to increase comfort', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Picked these up to try and find a rocker shoe with enough width (4E) and volume for my carbon fiber inserts and prescription orthotics. These fit the bill, being able to accommodate both and affording a decent amount of lateral stability compared to others. Most importantly, I can get the carbon plates and orthotics into these and still get a decent heel lock without having to ratchet down the laces. I other words, the depth in the heel is great as well s the amount of cushion in the heel stay. I wish more shoes had a similar build to afford such a great fit in the heel when custom orthotics and such are in the mix.That said, the toe box could be a bit wider up front,  like a more natural foot shape (and ideally a straighter last on the outside of the mid foot. The New Balance Kaiha Road feels better in the lateral mid foot area, and is cushy, but lacks the lateral stability that this shoe provides). The heel could be more stable laterally, but it's better than a host of others I have tried and checks all the major boxes for my needs. e.g., The Hoka Bondi 8 is more stable laterally, but lacks the heel lock with the carbon plate and orthotics in the mix.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': 'Due to a medical issue I need shoes that are very cushioned, durable, and wide. I‚Äôve tried other shoes that are very cushy, but they weren‚Äôt durable and the cushiness wore out quickly. Less cushioned shoes that are durable aggravated my medical issue. Then I saw these and, despite not having a lot of reviews, and a kind of high price point, figured they were worth a shot.I‚Äôve been walking around with these for the past few weeks and I‚Äôm impressed! These New Balance shoes check all the boxes: very cushioned, very durable, wide width is perfect, and they‚Äôre very stable to walk in.They‚Äôre very chunky but really lightweight too. The only thing to be wary of is that New Balance runs SMALL. I sized up 1/2 a size from my normal size, and these fit great.To me the higher price was worth it because these shoes solve my main issues and they‚Äôre well made. I plan on buying a back up pair too.Great cushy durable value for the money.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'As a senior with balance issues; this shoe helps with that problem. I‚Äôd buy again.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Time will tell naturally. First impression is wow !! Most cushioning and spring I've felt in a sneaker. You know the popular brand that looks like these. Well they'd be a little more firm then these. Great cushioning , toes and heel as well as great arch support. I recently had a big back surgery , as well as bone on bone in one knee and bad left hip arthritis. These have been great in helping the pain subside. Probably will grab another pair. Very happy with the purchase. Only gripe would be some more color variations.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These are the most cheaply made, expensive shoes I\'ve ever purchased. Zero durability!! The poorly designed soles started coming apart on not one but two pairs that I owned, after wearing them for only a few weeks. I am NOT hard on shoes. Shoes, even considerably less expensive ones usually last me a long time. The first pair of the New Balance started coming apart shortly after I started wearing them on light terrain. Amazon replaced them. The second pair started coming apart after I wore them about 5 or 6 times. This was from daily, gentle use, not even long walks. The soles have a honeycomb design. This design is flawed as segments of the sole start coming loose & create "flaps" that make it impossible to walk in them. I continuously glued down the segment flaps with Shoe Goo to make them somewhat usable. $10 would be too much to pay for these!', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The shoe is comfortable but the "Fresh Foam" insole is the worse part of the design. Gave me blisters on 4 of my toes, like sand paper. Purchased Dr. Scholls power bead insoles, changed the whole shoe in a good way. No more sore ankles, much easier to do 10,000 steps in one session. Replace the insoles, you won\'t be sorry.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X Hierro V7
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one mentioning they felt good during a 20-mile hike. They receive positive feedback for their quality, appearance, and grip, with no slippage reported. The fit and size receive mixed reviews - while some find them great for wide feet, others note they run tight and the width sizes aren't accurate. Durability is also mixed, with some saying they last a long time while others report them falling apart. The cushioning receives mixed feedback, with some finding them soft to walk in while others say they're not overly cushioned.
review: {'review': 'This is a great shoe!  Super comfortable daily shoes for me for the last few weeks, but there is a huge caveat: the toe boxes are low volume. The roof of the toe box is very close to the tops/knuckles of the toes. I tried my usual Saucony and NB  size, 10.5, in store and did not notice the claustrophobic toe box. I ordered 10.5 on Amazon and wore them in the house but never could feel comfortable and figured they would drive me nuts! I tried 10 wide (not extra wide) and that gave my digits more breathing room, solving my problem. I made a good choice going down a half size, as I believe 10.5 wide would have been too big.  The rest of the shoe does not seem to fit wide (admittedly I have not really worn wides before).Now that my toes can relax a bit I can appreciate the plush comfort of these babies. I like that the heel cups are not harsh or unforgiving, they are a little supple. I have been nursing both my Achilles tendons for a few weeks now‚Äîbreaking in Brooks Cascadia 16s on one hike nearly broke me!!I never notice the extended fins in back; I thought they might ‚Äúcatch‚Äù going down carpeted stairs, but no issue.I am almost ready to get back in the mountains with these and really test them (and my heels) out. I will mos def buy more when I see a deal. Hierro V7 are my new favorites and I have tried numerous Adidas, Saucony, Merrill, North Face, and Scarpa trail runners and hikers the last few months. Robust, comfortable, and look rad.Edit:  I just did about an hour in the dry Boulder Flatirons at Chautauqua Park, and I love these shoes. The wides were barely big. I kept them fairly loose due to concerns with my Achilles and needing some extra give going uphill. Tightened them a bit just before descent, as usual, but didn‚Äôt wanna fiddle with them again. Can easily, comfortably lock them down a bit more next time.Comfortable on trail, very soft, you do feel big rock points and ground features underfoot, but I did not mind. These Hierros do not feel tall to me‚Äîgreat height/stack/drop that reminds me of my fave NB trail runners from 20 years ago. (I only wonder how they will hold up given how soft they are.)Edit: I now have three pairs of Hierros. Gotta say I would love some rock plate protection underneath as I have to be careful with foot placement on particularly pointy, sharp rocks (like 10% of the time on foothills trails). I occasionally trim down the hairy, wispy fibers that work their way out of the abrasion protection of the toe box. The shoes are all pretty easy to wipe down with a washcloth after a dusty hike.The Gore-Tex fit for me just like the regular V7.  I thought I‚Äôd need to go up a half size like I often do for Gtx, but they were too big. Went back to 10 wide and they fit very well. You have to look at all the pix in the Amazon ad to see which are the Gtx (navy/black, crazy bright green!, and black/orange). I got the black with orange bottoms and have to say the orange is strangely close to pink‚Äînot the ‚Äúclassic‚Äù orange and black I expected. Not noticeable enough for me to exchange, though. They also have skinnier laces than the non-Gtx. The thicker laces work perfectly, but the skinny ones are a little finicky and knot up on me sometimes.  GREAT shoes.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Awesome shoes. Great grip. Was able to wear it straight out of the box and didnt need to break them in at all. I bought these to use for playing cricket and will most likely use for any hiking trips. These fit true to size and provide great support for walking and running. Highly recommend.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Purchased these for walking a gravelly terrain along an old railroad right of way. These fit my feet perfectly! I normally wear an 11.5 wide and this pair is true to size. The thick outsole took the larger rocks like a champ and my feet felt wonderful after a 2 mile after dinner walk.I would recommend these to anyone who may suffer from feet, knee or hip pain. I know all bodies are different but these work for my older chassis!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I love this shoe. It was bought for elderly man easy hiking in mountains. Only short break-in time needed. The fit, feel and heel comfort are great. Overall sole cushioning is good without being mushy. But the best feature is the Vibram sole. It adds desirable overall stiffness (less toe lift), added width gives lateral support, and lessens feeling sharp objects beneath. The nicely lugged sole on smooth, interior surfaces feels secure, although produces some suction cup sounds at times. As other reviews have pointed out, the semi-hardened toe shields do produce unsightly ‚Äúfiber hairs‚Äù over time.  I have trimmed them and they still come back. I do not know what impact this has on the shoe‚Äôs function or use expectancy.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I have flat feet and suffer from Plantar fasciitis, which causes debilitating pain in my feet for days if I\'m overworking my feet or wearing improperly fitted footwear. It\'s gotten so bad in the past I couldn\'t get out of bed without support like crutches or a knee scooter. It\'s heartbreaking to me to say the least, as I really enjoy being active and outdoors, but am afraid of the smallest slip or pushing it too hard for the fear I will be out of commission for days, so these days I am very very stringent on what footwear I buy/wear. I bought these after a small slip caused a PF flareup on the disc golf course, which is very hilly and full of uneven ground and rocky terrain.From early on I could see that these were a perfect fit for me, the wide size actually accommodated my foot and didn\'t bulge out like Nikes or Adidas shoes of the same size. The cushion is just enough without being "marshmallow-y" to where I\'ve rolled my ankles in other shoes. the grip and weight of the shoes are great to avoid slips when walking up/down hills and rocky terrain. I\'ve walked to/from my local disc golf course and played multiple rounds of disc golf back to back (~10 miles and 5 hours on my feet) in one day with not even soreness in my feet! The night/day difference after buying these shoes still astounds me.These are my absolute go-to shoes anytime I\'m doing some outside active activity, I\'ve even started doing short hikes/trails with the confidence that I won\'t have pain the next day and can just focus on the most important thing, enjoying the outdoors. I\'ve been wearing these so much I\'m seriously considering buying another pair or two before I wear these out prematurely! Those with flat feet or PF, don\'t think twice and pick up these shoes!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X Hierro V8 Gore-tex

product: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X More V4
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one describing them as walking on a comfortable firm cloud, and appreciate their cushioning, noting they feel like walking on pillows from toe to heel. The shoes receive positive feedback for their fit, particularly for wide feet, and are perfect for both walking and running. Regarding support and durability, opinions are mixed - while some find them supportive, others report reduced lateral stability, and while some say they hold up great, others mention the bottom sole falling apart.
review: {'review': 'It‚Äôs like walking on a cloud! They are so soft and comfy, tons of support, i bought two to alternate for the rest of my life', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "First off, I'm a shoe nerd. I admit it. Growing up my Dad would buy us only ùôèùôÉùôÄ cheapest shoes he could find. They were so bad that we'd wear them out in a couple of months and I should be honest, I am not hard on my shoes, either (my older brother was a different story). Didn't make a difference. My Dad would rather buy us a pair of new shoes for $20 every couple months rather than spend $35 on ONE pair that would last at least a year (if not more). As a result, when I finally got a job and could buy my own, I had quite a collection. A habit I continue to this day.With that in mind, within the last year I've purchased 2 other pairs of New Balance trail running shoes which were (at that time) the most comfortable pairs of shoes I had ever purchased. Since then I bought a pair of Brooks Ghost Max which replaced those as the most comfortable pair of shoes I had ever owned.The Fresh Foam X have now replaced (by a slim margin) my Brooks for sheer comfort. I don't really run, but I DO an awful lot of hiking and walking. So strict comfort is pretty important to me. These shoes are simply brilliant in how comfortable they are. The previously mentioned New Balance Trail runners were, for a lack of a better term, had almost too much cushion. I know, how can a shoe have TOO much cushion? Well, those do...at least for me. For instance, I would never wear them for weight training, especially doing the dead lift. The cushion is SO pronounced that I'd be worried they could pull me off balance a little too easily. But then again, they aren't designed for weight lifting, so just keep that in mind.The Foam X shoes are a perfect balance between great cushion and sheer comfort. It must be hard for companies to achieve that balance without going too far but Kudo's to NB for pulling it off. The soles aren't as durable as the trail runners perhaps, but oh man are they a joy to wear. Again, since I don't run I cannot speak to how stable they'd be at doing any long/short distance running but man am I happy with mine.Overall ùôèùôÉùôÄ most comfortable shoes I own (and I own a LOT). I am VERY satisfied with my purchase.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I originally bought these to be used as my slow, long run shoes, but find that they are so easy to run in that I always end up running a tempo run in them.  They are so soft, yet responsive and my knees and back do not hurt after a 10k in them at race pace.The only problem I have with them is they are HOT.  On a hot summer day, your feet will sweat like crazy in them, so it is best to run when it's cool else you might end up with wet shoes haha.New Balance really hit it out of the park with these.  They are my favourite shoes next to Saucony Hurricanes (which were discontinued), and I feel that I may need to get more pairs in the future.Fit was true to size in length, but the wide (2E) is really wide and feels more like a 3E to myself and I am forced to use ankle lockdown to keep my feet from sloshing around during the first half of my run.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I really like these shoes, I got them for work, because I am on my feet all day. I am a fan of New Balance shoes (I have many), and the reviews have been quite favorable from a lot of shoe experts. I have narrow and flat feet and hoped that these shoes would keep me comfortable all day by fitting good and feeling good. There's a fairly wide toe box that gives my feet room to move around, but not too wide where I can lock in my feet comfortably. Stability is kind of an issue because the shoes are stacked high, but I'm just using them to walk at work. The arch support will hopefully keep my flat feet pain free throughout the day, time will tell. There's a lot of padding and weight with the shoes that are probably going to be a little warmer than most, and they're not very breathable. I can count on New Balance for their shoe quality and durability; they should last a long time. I was able to get these under 100 dollars in this color which is awesome! Navy blue is favorite color! You can't do any wrong getting these! V5 is out now, but I'm not sure about those...", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "They are very comfortable for my complaining feet. I have worked with them daily for over a year and they are still like new in quality and comfort. They certainly rattle a bit when walking but I don't mind, I'm not a ninja.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I have been struggling with a wound on the ball of my foot for almost 6 years. I have had special orthotics, worn a boot and seen several podiatrists who all wanted to do some sort of different surgery. I bought these shoes after seeing a you tube video about relieving pressure on your forefoot for runners. I thought maybe it would help me. It really has. My wound is the best it has been and seems to finally be closing.The shoes fit true to size. I got wide ones and they are very comfortable in the toe box.  They are extremely light weight. When the package arrived I wondered if it actually had shoe inside.There is a slight learning curve if you are not used to the way these shoes redistribute your weight. At first it feels like you‚Äôre falling backwards a bit. That subsides quickly. And finally, I think they look great though my family was quick to call them ‚ÄúDad‚Äù shoes. Well I am a Dad, so maybe it‚Äôs not that bad. I certainly don‚Äôt think they look like the older stereotypical new balance that men would wear with tube socks and shorts. Overall I‚Äôm super happy and on the hunt for a pair of hikers with similar geometry.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Amazing cushioning! I love these for runs 7+ miles. Keep my feet and legs fresh', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great shoe. Beautiful.However, there was a smudge like a drop of glue fell on the side which is slightly visible. I have decided not to return it.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X More V6
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes very plush and comfortable, with one mentioning they provide better cushioning than the Hoka Bondi. The build quality receives positive feedback, with one customer noting them as the best go-to sneaker for work. Customers disagree on the sizing.
