product: New Balance Men's FuelCell Propel V5
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one mentioning running 5k's with no soreness, and appreciate their excellent quality, arch support, and stylish design. The cushioning receives mixed feedback, with some praising the great cushioning while others find it too spongy. The fit and stability also get mixed reviews - while some find them true to size, others note they're too narrow for wide feet, and while they hold up well for weekly walks, some report lack of stability.
review: {'review': "Did a search for best running shoes, and these came up. They are great. Very comfortable, and supporting. Won't be my last pair. I wear them for walking, running, cycling, and strength training. They fit as advertised. Seem very durable. Designed extremely well.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My husband says these shoes are very comfortable. He has a size 15 wide and that‚Äôs fit perfect and have a lot of cushion.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Absolutely love these shoes.  I run 25-30 miles per week and usually training for 10ks up to marathon distances.  My go-to the last few years have been brooks (ghost and Hyperion elite) but decided to give New Balance a try. I‚Äôm so glad I did as these are the perfect trainer, and the price tag is a lot easier on the wallet.  They have great cushioning, great balance and lots of spring.  Going to go ahead and get a few pairs to have on hand.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "The drop on the v5 feels slightly higher than the v4, but is still sufficiently mid-drop. I could tell when I put them both on one after the other (despite both being labeled as 6mm drop).The v5 wide seems a touch wider in the forefoot than the v4 wide, which is good for me.  I feel like the heel fits better on the v5 than the v4  (my heel is narrow-ish btw).  The v5 is also noticeably more comfortable overall to my foot.The TPU plate gives you decent bounce to your step and yet a stable feeling while the foam is still very soft & comfortable.  Very good combination.My only complaint is that there could be maybe a touch more space where my big toe goes on my right foot only (my right foot is a hair longer than my left it seems based upon my past experience with shoes).  There seems to be just a touch less space (either length, width, or height) at this precise exact spot in the v5 than there was in the v4, because I did not experience this sensation at all in the v4.Overall though, great quality for the price, there's no doubt.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "This is my firsy time trying New Balance.I am building up my health and have started my morning walks of nearly 5 miles each day. I am so impressed with the support and cushion, they are better than all the adidas shoes I've worn in the past.I want to start running again and these shoes will certainly help me to get back without any issues.I'm sold on New Balance and looking forward to more in the future.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I bought these as a complement to my NB Rebel v4\'s as while that is a great shoe, I noticed if I alternate a day between wearing the foam seems to recover better between wears.  Now for these, they are a touch heavier than the Rebels, but I find them just as comfortable for daily wear.  I did replace the laces as I dont car for NB laces in general (tend to stretch to much for my liking).  Overall a great everyday shoe as I tend to gravitate towards NB due to their comfort for my particular foot shape. I will likely buy another pair if I can catch them on sale again.Highpoints:Sizing - Spot on with my SZ15Width - If you have a wider than "normal" foot get the wide sizeComfort - Very comfortableStyle - I dig plain these (also prefer mostly gray shoes)Value - Could not pass on these being $60 below retail when I bought themDurability - to be determined, while my Rebel v4\'s foam has held up well it has stained on the bottom due to road running and walking, but not a big issue to me.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'In your mid 40‚Äôs, running a 5k without real soreness afterwards, not much more you can ask for from a shoe.  Comfortable and light with solid support.  Ended up buying two pairs.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Too narrow for a wide shoe.  Shoes look nice and good quality.  Width is too narrow compared to other NB shoes we‚Äôve purchased in the past', 'rating': '2.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Men's FuelCell Rebel V5
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, lightweight, and well-cushioned, with one customer noting they don't hurt after a 7-mile hike. They appreciate the style and stability, with one mentioning excellent arch support. The durability receives mixed feedback, with some finding them durable while others report wear after 75-100 miles. The fit also gets mixed reviews.
review: {'review': 'Love this shoe for easier runs. They‚Äôre lightweight enough for faster runs. Very comfortable.  My foot size is 9.5 to 10 and I ‚Äòm glad I went with size 10 with these. Some reviews are saying they‚Äôre roomy but they seem normal to me. People‚Äôs feet are all different, so don‚Äôt base your size selection just on what I say. The popular running shoe reviewers on You Tube are a fairly reliable source.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great shoes for all kinds of training, fast, comfortable, cushioned and reactive', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I run a lot and run in a lot of shoes. I‚Äôve worked in the industry and have fitted plenty of people for running shoes.These are a big win for NB. The shoe is everything I enjoy in a running shoe. It‚Äôs simple, fun, cushioned, responsive, durable enough, and looks great. It‚Äôs also fantastic value for money.The fit is true to size, unlike the previous model. There is no extra upper material to bunch up, but enough width to satisfy someone who complains about shoes being to narrow.The rubber outsole is somewhat minimal and it started to wear after 75-100 miles. That being said, grip is good and outsole wear is not the end of the world. The shoe still has a lot of life in it at 150ish miles. This is going to be one of those that gets turned into a dog walker after I‚Äôm finished running in it. In my world, that is a great achievement for a running shoe and is reserved for the most comfortable.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Most comfortable and nice-looking shoes I have purchased.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This is a stability walker/ running shoe. Flat feet. Very light. Breathable.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excelentes', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I feel like Sonic the Hedgehog off a lb of Betty White and 2 gallons of Red Bull. I‚Äôm expecting to break the sound barrier in a few weeks with these on. Absolutely love them and they look good. Pretty comfortable if you ask me which I mean they are asking me.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The V5 is not as good as the previous version. The fit was more narrow and didn‚Äôt feel as responsive as the V4', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Men's FuelCell Supercomp Elite V4
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes excellent, with one noting they're fantastic for long-distance running. They are extremely lightweight and provide good cushioning, with one customer highlighting the perfect balance of squish and pop. Customers disagree on the comfort level. Customers find these running shoes have a great fit. However, the heel grip receives mixed feedback, with several customers noting that the back digs into their ankle. The shoes receive mixed opinions about their bounce, lightness, and style.
review: {'review': 'Great shoe, super comfy. Extremely light and great on my long runs.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These shoes are absolute BANGERS! Easily my favorite plated long run shoe. Comfort for days. The cushion to energy return ratio is perfect for paces under 6:30/mi. I ran a half marathon in them back in March and I felt totally supported and protected the entire time while also having enough speed to get a major PR. These are the shoes I've chosen to run my Marathon later this year and I feel totally confident in saying they are a fantastic option for middle of the pack runnersaiming for a 3:30 finish.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I‚Äôm newer to running (as an adult). I have too many of the current best shoes. This is one of my top two favorites and my one if I had to keep only one for races. It‚Äôs plush and protective,  bouncy and propulsive, and stable all togetherIt‚Äôs not as lively and springy as some others (like asics MEP) or as super plush and protective as some (NB1080V13), but it‚Äôs a great combo for a somewhat aggressive but still stable and protective shoe for a race or uptempo longish should run', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Good', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable and improved my run, though at first it rubbed against my heel a bit and caused a sore for a little bit.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "A really fun shoe to run in. I‚Äôm in the minority, but that‚Äôs my honest review.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Awesome', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great shoes for longer, fast runs. Assistance from plate really helps as fatigue kicks in. Digs into back of ankles a bit but getting better as they break in.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I previously had the V3's, and while those had a breaking-in period and some hotspots, these V4's are nearly a perfect fit. I did some sprints with them today and it felt like I was flying. I'll be going on a long run with them this weekend, but I expect that they will hold up. Buying running shoes is usually a challenge for me since I need to shop for Wides, but these V4's are a slam dunk!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "The tongue of the shoe, yes, pretty garbage. Going to blister near the Achilles as well, based on the design of the shoe. Pros: propels you forward based on the design‚Äîlight, but not the lightest carbon plate shoe, but still very light. Good support for heel runners; the color and design scheme look flashy, but not too much. Overall, a good starter super shoe compared to Nike's quality.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Received used item', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'They fit nice and snug, but the back digs into my ankle. It belt like an actual knife cutting into my ankle when I was just walking. Shame because the carbon plates definitely make you stay on your feet.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Comfortable, springy, great fit!  I love running in these shoes so much I want them to be my daily runner. The price makes it hard to justify as a daily runner though. So mostly I'll use these the final few weeks up to and including races and then back to my regular shoes for regular training.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The SC Elite v4 is one of the best carbon-plated racers I‚Äôve used. It combines a propulsive ride with surprising softness, making it perfect for long races like the marathon where comfort is as important as speed.The updated FuelCell foam and Energy Arc plate offer a smooth, rolling transition that doesn‚Äôt feel overly aggressive or rigid. The shoe feels fast but forgiving, which is exactly what I want over 42K.The fit is performance-oriented but comfortable. review: {'review': 'I had these shoes for  just ten years inured before I decided they are the best running shoes I have ever had by FAR.  Here are some observations. Often shoes are described as walking on clouds but to me that means overly soft, these shoes have a firmness and give combination that is extremely comfortable for me.  I‚Äôm shocked at how good they feel.  One small note just to be fair, the insoles in these are suprizingly minimal.  I‚Äôll probably replace them with something else.  Also the drop, that‚Äôs the difference in the height of the heel and the forefoot feels like 0 which I like a lot,  some running shoes have a huge drop and feel like you are walking downhill.  I like these much better.  Hope this helps.  Oh one more thing, they are expensive but I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll get enough wear out of their quality to make up for the cost.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The shoes look good. review: {'review': 'I‚Äôm on my second pair of 1080 v13s. When I first started running in them I wasn‚Äôt sure I liked them. There‚Äôs an extreme level of cushion that I wasn‚Äôt used to. They‚Äôre a bit heavy for track workouts or interval sessions but for just about everything else, these shoes are great. I‚Äôve really enjoyed them on longer efforts. In long runs they‚Äôve kept my legs fresh. When I pick up the pace to marathon effort, or maybe even a touch faster, I really feel like I‚Äôm able to get some good energy return. But of course, slow, recovery, or just plain easy runs are the bread and butter of the 1080s.These are also a great option for casual wear - so much comfort.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Best shoes I have ever gotten. Super comfortable, this is THE FIT I have been looking for at 11 X-Wide. I love New Balance and they are getting a long-term customer from me now. These shoes have amazing grip on slippery surfaces and even in places where I walked through 4 inches of snow the grip was very good. The boots are fairly light weight and I love the fresh foam comfort. They fit well and are waterproof at least in snow. Perfect for my needs. I have a custom insole and it fit nicely inside. The boot with the original inserts does not have much arch support which surprised me.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I would really like a breathable, waterproof hiking shoe but these are not. I did not even test them in rain, standing water, puddles, creeks or streams; only in 4-6 in long grass after a steady rain. Water only seeped in slightly at the toe but if more water, rain or foliage was present it would be worse. On a positive note the shoes are very comfortable. The laces require double tying - irritating. The eyelets in the shoe are not reinforced so the hole is deforming. Other lace ‚Äúcleats‚Äù are a fabric that may be coming loose at the stitching. product: New Balance Mens Fresh Foam X Hierro V9
customer_say: Customers find these trail running shoes comfortable, well-made, and easy to walk in, with great style. The cushioning and support receive mixed feedback - while some find the cushioning great and supportive, others report instability issues while running. Customers disagree on the sizing, with some finding them true to size while others say they run small.
review: {'review': "I'm really impressed! They've quickly become a favorite for my off-road adventures, thanks to a fantastic combination of design, fit, and price. Right out of the box, the design caught my eye. New Balance really nailed the aesthetic on these‚Äîthey look sleek and trail-ready without being overly bulky. It's a shoe that performs well and looks good doing it.When it comes to fitting, these shoes truly shine. They hug my feet comfortably, providing a secure and supportive feel that's crucial on uneven terrain. My feet feel locked in without being constricted, allowing for confident strides whether I'm climbing or descending. The cushioning feels just right, absorbing impact without sacrificing responsiveness.And the price? Absolutely spot on. I feel like I got a premium trail running shoe without breaking the bank, which is always a win. My only minor critique, and it's a small one, is that they're a little tight on the side of my feet. While the overall snugness is a positive, I do notice a slight pressure on the sides after longer runs. It's not a deal-breaker by any means, and I'm hoping they'll loosen up just a touch with more wear. Despite that minor quibble, I'm genuinely thrilled with my New Balance trail running shoes. They're a comfortable, stylish, and affordable option for anyone looking to hit the trails with confidence. I highly recommend them!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Not as cushy or bouncy  as the *New Balance Men's Fresh Foam X More Trail V3 Running Shoe* but I only bought one of those and cannot find them any more but these are a good pick for trail running. I'm an older runner and need the cushioned shoes for the down hills. But these have a much better outsole like a proper trail runner should have. Not quite as wide as the X More Trail V3 but it does not seem to be an issue. I may edit this after 250 miles to say how well they are wearing. I have 416 miles on the X More Trail V3 and they are still comfortable but they are wearing out a little but I think these should last as long or longer.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "The shoe is extremely comfortable to stand and walk in. I really wish I could hae worn them.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excellent, it was a gift to my husband and he loves them, he says that they are comfortable and have good Support for their feet', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These NB shoes are amazing to walk on! product: New Balance Mens FuelCell Rebel V4
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes to be of high quality, comfortable, and lightweight, with soft soles and good cushioning, particularly suitable for daily training and long-distance running. The shoes receive positive feedback for their appearance and fit, though opinions are mixed - while some find them comfortable during runs, others note the toe box being tight. Durability is also mixed, with some customers reporting good durability while others find them comparable to race shoes in terms of longevity.
review: {'review': 'I have two pairs of this shoe, I bought my first pair after trying them on in a store and I immediately loved the way they felt. I bought my second pair (pictured) from Amazon because the colors are nice, and I needed another pair to use exclusively outside of work. I\'m very tempted to buy a few other colors. My other pair is black and white, and I appreciate how the black is slightly purple and the white is slightly grey. Anyway, it\'s great these shoes caught my eye because they don\'t just look good. The soles have a soft cushiony feeling and the uppers live up to their name: "FantomFit." They are my favorite shoes for 12 hr shifts as a bedside RN, setting PRs in 1mi and 5k, and going out for food, drink, etc. Although these shoes are cushy, they are also responsive and fast. When running shorter distances I simple don\'t think much about them and they help me do my thing and yes it\'s in these shoes I broke my records for 1mi and 5k despite owning carbon shoes Nike Vaporfly 3 and Fuelcell Supercomp Elite v3. Probably because I\'m more likely to take these shoes out daily. There are however two things I don\'t like about these shoes: 1) the upper material seems prone to abrasion, and 2) I\'d get sore on long distance. I washed my 1st oair once and used a brush on the upper of the right shoe, little broken fabric filaments are now visible all over the upper hence I simply did not scrub the left one. In general both my pairs do not show much signs of other wear so I think the main thing is to not scrub the uppers. My second issue is that I could run more than 17.3 miles in these shoes. I had bad upper foot pain on two of my long runs in training for my first marathon in December 2024. I suspect, the upper foot pain may have been caused by form modifications from other pain on my soles then knees. Because of this the Adidas Adizero Adios Pro 3 won the toss-up for my marathon shoes. With that said, 17.3 miles is quite a long distance already and there could have been other factors that may have contributed to my pain. I must mention that the Adios is a dedicated road-running shoe and is more expensive. I wouldn\'t want to work a 12 hour shift in them because they feel funny when not running. I also must mention that these shoes are awesome on the treadmill as well as the road/sidewalk. While $140 isn\'t cheap, I consider it a good value for how good they are and how how they compare to more expensive shoes.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Let me introduce you to the New Balance FuelCell Rebel v4 in Orange Beige (aka Hot Mango)‚Äîa shoe that doesn‚Äôt just support your training‚Ä¶ it dares you to push harder every time you lace up.From the moment I slid my foot into these, I knew this wasn‚Äôt just another daily trainer. The Rebel v4 blends energy, comfort, and style into one beautifully engineered package. It‚Äôs the kind of shoe that makes you want to run farther, faster‚Äîeven when you don‚Äôt have to.Performance:Powered by New Balance‚Äôs FuelCell foam, the midsole gives you noticeable bounce and propulsion with every stride. Whether I‚Äôm doing tempo runs, long efforts, or even just easy miles, it delivers smooth transitions and that addictive ‚Äúpop‚Äù off the forefoot. You don‚Äôt just run in these‚Äîyou glide.Fit & Feel:It hugs the foot like a performance sock, but with room where it matters. The upper is breathable and flexible, yet secure‚Äîso your feet stay locked in without feeling cramped. Lightweight, responsive, and just enough cushion to protect without slowing you down.Looks:Let‚Äôs talk about that Hot Mango colorway‚Äîbecause this shoe turns heads. The orange-beige palette is fire without being flashy. It‚Äôs bold, fast-looking, and absolutely unique. People will ask about them‚Ä¶ and you‚Äôll be proud to explain.Versatility:These aren‚Äôt just for runners chasing pace goals‚Äîthey‚Äôre a perfect all-day shoe for anyone who lives actively and moves with purpose. I wear them for training and then keep them on for errands or coaching. They‚Äôre light, stylish, and ready for wherever the day takes you.Inspiration:The Rebel v4 isn‚Äôt just a shoe‚Äîit‚Äôs a tool for greatness. It reminds you that every run, every rep, every step is part of the process. Whether you‚Äôre building toward your first race or chasing a PR, this shoe fuels that forward momentum with every stride.Bottom line:The New Balance FuelCell Rebel v4 in Hot Mango is for those who believe greatness isn‚Äôt just a goal‚Äîit‚Äôs a daily decision. If you want a shoe that supports your grind, rewards your effort, and keeps your fire lit‚Äîthis is it.Get up. Lace up. Get after it.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I average about 5‚Äì6 miles a day, and the FuelCell Rebel V4 has quickly become my go-to running shoe. From the first run, I noticed how lightweight they felt ‚Äî almost like wearing racing flats, but with enough cushioning to keep my legs fresh even after back-to-back days.The FuelCell foam delivers an energetic, responsive feel that makes pushing the pace effortless. Whether I‚Äôm doing an easy run or throwing in some tempo miles, these shoes handle both without missing a beat. The upper is breathable and hugs the foot well without feeling restrictive, which is especially nice on warmer days.Traction is solid on both pavement and light gravel paths, and after a few weeks of daily use, the outsole is holding up well. I also appreciate the balance between speed and comfort ‚Äî it‚Äôs rare to find a shoe that‚Äôs this quick but still keeps your feet feeling good after multiple miles.Pros:Extremely lightweight and responsiveFuelCell foam provides both speed and comfortBreathable upper keeps feet coolGreat for daily training and faster runs alikeSolid grip and durability for road runningCons:Minimal stability ‚Äî not ideal if you need extra supportOutsole may wear faster for heavier runners or rough terrain useBottom Line:If you want a daily trainer that feels like a performance shoe, the FuelCell Rebel V4 is a winner. Perfect for runners logging steady mileage who want to stay light on their feet without sacrificing comfort.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable, lightweight and breathable!! I usually run around 7km-10km these shoes are very good and the colors are beautiful.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

So, I immediately purchased these, in the same size as my current pair (11 Wide).  However, I cannot wear these for more than a few minutes before my feet start to hurt, and I can't lace them loosely enough to prevent them from making my feet feel choked.  When I was running ultra marathons, the Minimus Road and Minimus Trail were my go to shoes.  Those were also size 11 Wide and the fit and comfort were also amazing.  In my opinion, the changes made in the Minimus Trainer v2 are a disaster for anyone with wide feet.  If you have wide feet, my suggestion is to look elsewhere for your training shoes.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfy. customer_say: Customers find these turf shoes comfortable and well-fitting, with one noting the grip nubs are perfectly sized for everyday wear. review: {'review': 'Best pair of turf shoes I ever bought. Fit is perfect, love that New Balance offers wide and extra wide as an option. As described, the shoes are extremely light and makes movements feel effortless. Will definitely be purchasing again.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My softball player loves these! She said they fit well, are very comfortable and are very lightweight when worn. The turf bottoms get very good traction for her as a catcher. Overall great shoe quality and will definitely buy again when these need replacing. The white color is very unique, too, and even has a suttle design in the side mesh area.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The most comfortable trainers I have ever owned. Background: I was a semi-pro DH MTB rider for years, then Ironman Triathlete, and Marathoner (best time 2:56.25). I know what it takes to push the limits and now that I am playing in a very competitive adult baseball league, I know that: comfort, light weight and stability are valued benefits from a training shoe.I play Adult BB as a catcher and these trainers have added protection at the front of the toe without sacrificing mobility or comfort. The light weight foam allow me to wear these shoes just about everywhere, and the grip nubs are perfectly sized for everyday wear. The grip/traction is amazing on every surface, not just turf! Grass, dirt, concrete, slab cement, aluminum, etc‚Ä¶ have all been tested and I have excellent traction.I removed the stock laces and replaced them with bungee laces (this allows more even top-foot pressure across the foot - something I learned from years as a marathoner and triathlete).Highly recommend these trainers for anyone serious about their training or that just appreciate a comfortable and capable athletic shoe.I usually purchase size 10 for all of my shoes, and these are no different. Just order your normal size and your will be good to go.I have normal width feet but I‚Äôm more flat footed than most people I know. The toe box fits comfortably secure and does not move around, while the heel are stays put like it should. What little ‚Äúarch‚Äù I do have does feel supported, which contributes to the overall comfort.Highly recommend!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great price at time of purchase ( < $70).  Extremely comfortable athletic-specific shoe.  Fits well around foot and ankle.  Quality components and may take a few accidental cleatings on field or in dugout.  Vibrant color as well.  Just a great product when acquired at right price.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I wear a size 12 medium width and these fit perfectly.  Like the style and the color was spot on. He's not a big fan of traditional cleats. He wears these now to play in his men's slow pitch softball league.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I recently got the New Balance Unisex Adult FuelCell 4040 V7 Turf Shoes, and they have been amazing! The Dynasoft cushioning feels plush underfoot, making it perfect for all-day wear. Whether you‚Äôre hitting the gym or running errands, these shoes provide great support without sacrificing comfort.Fit: These cross trainers fit true to size, but they have a slightly snug fit, which is great for those who prefer a more locked-in feel. However, if you have wider feet, you might want to consider going up half a size. The slip-on design with a lace-up front gives it a sleek look while ensuring a secure fit.Design: The all-black design is sleek and versatile, making it easy to pair with any workout gear or casual outfit. The minimalist aesthetic is modern, and the subtle branding keeps the look clean and stylish.Performance: The Dynasoft Nergize V2 is excellent for a variety of activities, from light workouts to everyday wear. The traction is good on most surfaces, and the shoes offer a nice balance of flexibility and stability. However, for more intense workouts or running, you might need something with more specialized support.Durability: After a few weeks of use, the shoes show minimal signs of wear. The materials used seem durable and should hold up well over time, though the lightweight nature might not offer the same longevity as more robust trainers.Conclusion: Overall, the New Balance Women‚Äôs Dynasoft Nergize Sport V2 Cross Trainer is a solid choice for anyone looking for a comfortable, stylish, and versatile shoe. It‚Äôs perfect for low-impact workouts, walking, or just everyday wear. While it may not be the best option for high-intensity training, it excels in everyday comfort and style.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The shoes are beautiful and comfortable but they fit small, short in the length of the foot. review: {'review': 'These Gortex runners are nice! I absolutely love the color! The tread is amazing! I got these to replace my Nike Pegasus Gortex trainers for running outdoors in the winter. The traction on these is great! They feel lightweight. They keep your foot warm and dry which is exactly what I needed. These are harder- They aren‚Äôt as soft as my New Balance Fuel Cell trainers or even my Pegasus but you can‚Äôt expect all of that with these being gortex and trail shoes! They are still comfortable! I typically am a solid 8.5 and I did purchase a 9 and honestly could have sized up to a 9.5- My toe is almost right at the top. I put insoles in for added comfort but they pushed my toe so to the top they didn‚Äôt work. I typically run 4-5 days a week 3 miles or more and these will definitely do the trick! Keeping my feet dry when running through the slush or rain this winter was exactly what I wanted. I really love this shoe- They are a great buy and so cute on!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I walk all year long and when it\'s wet/snowy I need something to keep my feet dry. So far I haven\'t had these out in a heavy rain, but they are waterproof. With that said, they don\'t seem to breathe very much, and my feet are a little warm/sweaty, but that can be mitigated with the right socks (moisture-wicking). As other reviewers stated, the toe box is a little tighter than you may be used to. My toe is sitting in the normal spot, but the vertical height inside the toe box is a little less than with a different style sneaker. This doesn\'t bother me, and after about 2 minutes, I don\'t even notice it. I feel like there was a short "break in" period needed, mainly for the area around the ankle. But that may just be the shape of my foot/ankle? After the first walk in them (~1 mile), they were fine, and I haven\'t had any issues since. I was originally thinking I\'d need an insert to raise up my heel but I\'ve decided I don\'t need that. I like the color too - not too flashy and not white (to show dirt). They provide ample support for walking, and I would buy them again. I have a high arch and high instep, and the middle of the shoe fits great, very comfortable (I\'ve had issues with this in the past with certain New Balance styles). If you have a wider foot, this may not be comfortable for you though, given the more "sandwiched" toe box feel of the shoe.  I\'m looking forward to some puddle jumping to really test them!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "waterproof as promised. they are high quality and seem durable, but I haven't worn them for all that long yet. the tread is great for trails - keeps rocks from getting stuck in them. the padding isn't as thick as I would like, but I do like the amount of built in arch support. they run a little small and narrow - you might consider sizing up. my feet slide forward a bit unless I lace them very tightly, but I'm hoping that will change as I finish breaking them in. I'm a dog walker and can walk in these for a couple hours a day without my feet hurting. they get a bit hot due to the waterproofing though so I wouldn't want to wear them all day.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Ever since I had foot surgery, my podiatrist was adamant about sticking with New Balance. Unfortunately, they aren‚Äôt always the best looking shoes. But these I love. They give me great support, fit true to size, and are even waterproof to a degree.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'They are very nice shoes and I loooove the color. The width is fine and the length is fine but they squish my toes from the top‚Ä¶ lol. It‚Äôs weird. I‚Äôve never had that problem before. But the more I wear them the more they stretch out so it‚Äôs been fine. Definitely waterproof. LOVE THAT. I‚Äôm a dog bather so they are perfect.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Nice wide shoe, just what I needed. Color is accurate. Tested with some water and it rolls off. Very comfortable. Just wish the toe box was ever so slightly taller as my toe touches the top sometimes. But, the fabric gives and is soft it's  not too bad and am keeping.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'size not according to the shoe, impossible to use', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I just wore these before three weeks in very wet Scotland, and didn't get wet feet once. Good grip on wet, slippery rocks.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Women's Dynasoft Tektrel V1
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, good-looking with nice colors, and appreciate their quality and grip, particularly noting excellent traction on loose gravel. The fit and sizing receive mixed feedback - while some say the size is right, others find them a bit too narrow. The arch support also gets mixed reviews, with some praising it while others report little to no arch support.
review: {'review': 'These trail runners are *almost* perfect. They‚Äôre lightweight, super comfortable right out of the box, and have amazing grip on wet or uneven terrain. Plus, they look really cool - I seriously love them.The only downside? They run crazy small.I‚Äôve been a solid size 10 my entire adult life, and I had to try on three different sizes before finding the right fit‚Ä¶ which ended up being a size 11 Wide. I‚Äôve never worn an 11W before; usually that size feels like clown shoes on me. But for some reason, the 11W in this shoe fits perfectly.My advice? Size up at least a half-size, but honestly, most people will probably need to go up a full size. I bought them in two colors, and both required sizing up.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These running shoes completely exceeded my expectations. I‚Äôve been using them for road running for several weeks now, and the difference is incredible. The cushioning is just right ‚Äî soft enough to absorb impact on hard pavement, but still responsive and supportive.They‚Äôre incredibly lightweight, which makes each stride feel smooth and effortless. The grip on asphalt is excellent, even in slightly wet conditions, and the breathability keeps my feet cool and dry during long runs.The fit is snug without being tight, and I love how stable they feel, especially during quick turns or intervals. After trying several brands over the years, I can confidently say these are among the best running shoes I‚Äôve owned. Highly recommended for any serious runner or even beginners looking for quality and comfort!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Finally, a Stylish and Comfortable Sneaker That Works for Flat Feet!I've gone through so many sneakers over the last few years‚Äîmost were either uncomfortable or just plain ugly. I have flat feet, and one foot tends to roll inward and ache if I stand too long. I usually wear orthotics, so I ordered these in a wide size, expecting them to be tight, but they actually fit great. In hindsight, I probably could‚Äôve gone with a 9 wide instead of a 9.5 wide.Arch Support:Surprisingly good! My foot feels stable and supported‚Äîno inward rolling.These are super stylish and genuinely comfortable. No joke‚Äîfinally a pair I want to keep wearing!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Overall look is great but this are cut small and I advise you to order at least a half size larger than your normal size. They are very comfortable just are shorter in size/length.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "They're really nice shoes, overall. I got a size 10 in wide and the size fit well. They're really lightweight and they're great shoes for the cost. The grip on the bottle is what I was looking for to wear on normal hiking trails. Like any normal shoe, you definitely have to break them in. When I initially put them on, I was worried that I'd have to return them cause they were tight and didn't seem wide enough but I wore them around my house for a bit, relaced them a few times as they adjusted, and now they're fine and comfortable. The cushioning in the shoe is amazing and comfortable, very soft and nice to walk in.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I was a little concerned that reviewers were saying they ran small but I ordered same size I wear in nike and they are perfect. I have high arches though and there's not that much support but this is a common problem for me regardless of brand.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Nice looking shoe.  Not as much cushion as I like...they don't have much arch support and just feel flat inside. The tongue is old school: not 'socks fit'. VERY difficult to loosen and tighten because of the way they lace down the sides...I'll have relace them so they lace like a normal shoe.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My new favorite, comfort, width and the colors are so beautiful shoes', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Women's Fresh Foam 510 V6
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-made, and appreciate their good arch support and nice colors. The fit and size receive mixed feedback - while some say they run true to size, others find them very narrow. Customers disagree on the feel, with some describing them as soft and squishy while others find them hard. Durability is also mixed, with some saying they hold up well while others report them falling apart. Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-made, and appreciate their good arch support and nice colors. The fit and size receive mixed feedback - while some say they run true to size, others find them very narrow. Customers disagree on the feel, with some describing them as soft and squishy while others find them hard. review: {'review': "I recently bought the Women's 510 Running Shoe from New Balance, and I couldn't be more pleased with my choice. During my runs, these shoes have provided me with more support and comfort than I had anticipated.The midsole's cushioning is excellent, delivering a responsive feel that deflects impact without being overly soft. My knees have occasionally been sore, but ever since I started wearing these shoes, I've noticed a noticeable change in how they feel after my runs.Even on slippery or uneven conditions, the outsole maintains outstanding traction. With every step, I feel secure and solid, which frees me from anxiety about slipping or sliding and lets me concentrate on my run.These sneakers' breathability is just another fantastic quality. Even during extended runs or in warm weather, the upper mesh material keeps my feet cool and dry. No more uncomfortable and hot feet!In terms of sizing, I discovered that these shoes fit true to size and offer a secure and supportive fit without being oppressive. The design is fashionable and I value the range of color choices that let me select a pair that goes with my running gear.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'New Balance is my favorite sneaker.  This is well made but a little wide.  I bought my usual size but they seem a little wider than usual.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "The New Balance Women's Fresh Foam 510 V6 Trail Running Shoe are very nice and very comfortable.  I prefer a wide toe box.  I bought these in a wide size and they are wide enough for me to spread my toes.  If you like a really soft squishy shoe with a lot of arch support, these are great.  For me they were too squishy and archy and it made my feet work harder to walk in, which was bothersome.  The good part is the insoles can be removed.  Once I removed the insoles they were much more comfortable for me.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great price. Very comfortable.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I have been buying New Balance Shoes for the better part of two decades.  They were my go to shoe because they fit my feet and were economical.  This is the second time I have had the exact same problem with these shoes.1.5 months ago, I ordered a similar style shoe only to find that they squeaked.  I did not end up returning them because I felt it would be a hassle.  So I ordered a second pair, this pair.Within a week, they are squeaking as well.  I understand the need to keep costs down, but they are compromising in the wrong areas.  New Balance has now lost a costumer.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I like these shoes very much, except for the insoles.  They fit me like I expected.  I need wide, and New Balance is one of the few brands with wide sizes that actually feel wide.  I have an average arch, and this shoe has the right amount of arch for me.  The shoes are well made and have a nice tread.  I have worn these hiking and camping several times and wear them often for just normal wear.  The shoes are not advertised as waterproof but do seem to be water repellent.  I have not submerged them in water but have worn them in damp conditions, and my feet remained dry.Now for the negative, the insoles.  The insoles are textured. The original packaging indicated the insoles were massaging.  I found the texture mildly annoying from the beginning but livable.  After only 4 months, the insoles became very annoying.  I could feel the texture a lot.  The insoles seemed to become hard.  My feet began to hurt quite a lot.  I was disappointed that I might have to discontinue using the shoes.  I took the simple, flat, thin foam insoles out of another pair of shoes to try in them, and the pain and discomfort immediately stopped.  I'm going to buy a cheap pair of thin foam cushion insoles for this pair of shoes, so I can continue to use them.  The shoes look almost new and show very little wear on the tread. Another problem with the insoles was that they squeaked with every step.  That is no longer a problem with the original insoles removed.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These sneakers are great!! They not only give great support but are very comfortable. They have just enough grip to make you feel secure but not stuck to the road. I love the way they look with multiple outfits, because the accent colors are subtle but bold enough to be beautiful! product: New Balance Women's Fresh Foam Garoe Mid V1
customer_say: Customers find these trail running shoes comfortable, durable, and well-made, with good ankle support and a stylish design. The fit receives mixed feedback, with some customers reporting a perfect fit while others find them tight across the toes. The waterproof feature also gets mixed reviews, with some customers saying they are waterproof while others disagree.
review: {'review': 'Looooove these!!!! Not only are they cute, but they are super comfortable, kept my feet safe (bumped into multiple rocks while running a 8.5 trail race) and the ankle support‚Ä¶ chef kiss!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Just got these midcut trail runners and been walking around the house for awhile.Initially I hesitated to buy because I sometimes have issues with the mid-ankle height. They tend to bother my ankle bone... but not these New Balance. They are comfortable and do not rub or chafe the bone.My other issue was the chunky squared heel/sole. I thought it was going to be obtrusive.  After putting them on and checking them out I think they are rather complimentary and do not stick out at all.The materials used in these hikers are very good.  I sprayed water on the toe area and it beaded and ran right off, so they are waterproof as listed. Gore-tex rocks!! No one likes wet soggy feet while running and hiking around the country!!Arguably the best feature on this shoe is the locking lace hooks. The final top two lace hooks lock the lace in when you snap it in... great feature because you don't have to hold tension when tying the laces!!! My Merrell hiking boots do not have this feature and I am forever trying to hold them tension at the correct point while tying them. It's rather frustrating because it's hard to get them right... they either get tied too loose or too tight. Not so with these. Once you set the correct tension you simply lock the lace it and it gets held right there so you can tie the shoe with ease.I wear an 8.5 M... in every shoe I have ever bought,  so I bought an 8.5 M and in length they fit perfect. My foot is by no means wide but wearing mid-weight socks these kinda hug my foot and the toe box feels a bit restrictive. I much prefer a wider toe box to prevent toe issues and foot fatigue. So my only real complaint is that this may be an issue on long walks, runs or hikes. Also due to the materials used making these, I rather doubt they will stretch any.Overall, I am glad I decided to give these NB a try... they are more comfortable than my Salomon Speedcross 4s which for me are far too stiff in the soles and tire my feet out.I will keep this pair...", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These are my favorite sneakers. I get compliments on them all the time but I also like them bc they are super supportive especially if you have weak ankles. New balance has always been a quality shoe and these are no different. They fit like a cross between a trail sneaker and boot so just sturdy enough but not too sturdy that you feel like you‚Äôre wearing a hiking boot.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable looking very nice and good engagement on trails', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "My daughter always wears New Balance shoes because they're durable and usually very comfortable.  She loved the look of these.  Unfortunately, the shoe is too shallow, creating pressure on top of the foot.  This hasn't been the case for other New Balance sneakers.  We were sad to have to return them, as they look very nice.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excelent', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice hiking boot. Looked well made. Support felt good but size was way off. I have a wide foot and usually wear an 8.5 but even the 9 was a bit short', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I had been looking for a sneaker boot that would be appropriate for walking my large dog through off the beaten path parts of our local parks. I'm prone to stumbling and foot pain so the shoe needed to offer comfort and stability. I say this shoe does exactly as I need it to. It's comfortable and my footing is secure. The padding around the ankle helps stabilize my ankles while not being so thick and stiff as to be uncomfortable. I will say that some comments made mention of the shoe running slightly small. I think it's the width. I purchased my normal size 8 but got the wide version and it's perfect. I can wear thick socks if needed but don't feel like it's squeezing my toes. For me these are working out great and I would recommend them.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': "I love the style and the fit, I wear a size 9. I love the look and how they feel on my feet. The only thing is I suffer from fasciitis and Sciatica. The mesh is almost a dark hunter green/light black.  They‚Äôre sweet üëç', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I am a plus size woman and struggle to find shoes that fit and last. New Balance have been my go to brand for quite a while. Was disappointed when I couldn't find any durable ones that were fashionable until I bought the New Balance Garoe Trail Running shoes. I bought them Jan 4, 2024 and am still wearing them almost daily in October. I am ordering a new pair as we speak but will continue to wear these until they are completely done. Thank you New Balance for making this design. The fit, comfort, and durability are unmatched for the price!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I got the black w/sea salt flecks... pretty cool and kooky looking sneakers. I have another pair of NB sneakers which are GREAT for walking so I bought these as well. I am narrow feet 8.5-9, and the 9 regular width NB fit me fine. I can put a thin additional insole for my heel, and I wear thin to medium socks and all is well.The only little thing is the heel of the sole has quite the funky bit sticking out behind- so much so that when i am walking downstairs I can often feel the heel rubbing on the stair risers behind my foot.. bit of an odd sensation but not consequential.Overall I like these and would buy again as long as they are on sale. The black with 'sea salt' flecks are very fun looking and extremely comfortable for me for walking miles and miles on pavement and asphalt like i do.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "9.5 wide.  This is one of the best pair of NB shoes I own, and I own a lot of them.  I just rarely get rid of them.  I ordered a half size larger, which is the usual, since they run a bit smaller than other brands.  They are vey cushy and yet stable on the sides.  This one does have the wide toe box and narrow heel, which they never publish, so its a crapshoot.  I'm going to order another pair.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Well I was looking for good shoes for people on their feet all day.  Among all the brands I couldn't afford,  I saw that New Balance is recognized by podiatrists. I can afford New Balance, I thought. I still spent $90 on these shoes titled Fresh Foam. I expected softness, foamy, cloud like comfort when i put my foot inside . I got none of that.  In fact, the shoe felt hard as a rock in the bottom. I guess the fresh foam refers to the bottom that you stand on. The phrase fresh reminds me of the 80's just like this scribble, paint design on the bottom of the shoe. I must've missed that in the picture. I found it ugly and immediately colored over that with a black market. So now I have spent almost $100 on shoes that I find to be rather uncomfortable and ugly. I've given it a couple weeks now and I can say these things: the toe protect is just a waterproof barrier but keeps toes from getting wet in puddles.  These do NOT qualify as slip resistant and will in fact send you skating . The main body of the shoe is net which I didn't notice when ordering. Not the warmest shoes for winter. I wouldn't recommend these to anyone and I wouldn't buy them again either.  I'm still on the hunt for some good shoes that make my feet happy. This foam isn't fresh enough for me.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Love the colors and design! Remind me of LSU colors!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I work 12 + hour shifts in a hospital and I was looking for a shoe to alternate with my xlogs for work. I tried some of the trendy brands out there, but none of them felt as comfy as these ones. I did size up and it seemed that they ran a little small and pinched my toe when I bought them in my normal size. I have narrow to average width feet, so maybe these just have a super narrow toe bed? I find these quite comfortable after a long day and will most likely purchase again.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': 'I‚Äôm a recently retired, semi pro athlete, and I‚Äôm very picky about my footwear. I have a straight lasted, narrow foot; very neutral gait; normal arch and no structural or biomechanics abnormalities other than boney ankles. I bought these NB Hierro trail shoes in the low cut version and they turned out to be my favorite trail shoes ever! And they have great durability - after a year and a half of regular use, they‚Äôre still going strong (I alternate several pairs of shoes at a time to extend their mileage), but I‚Äôm soon ready to retire them to be yardwork shoes. So I wanted to try these with a slightly higher ankle to keep the dirt & debris out better. I was a bit nervous because my ankles are so boney, so high tops often dig in. But these don‚Äôt! üëèThese are truly waterproof and have a gusseted tongue. They‚Äôre very comfortable, responsive and cushioned - every bit as responsive and cushioned as the low cut version. They‚Äôre light weight and very grippy, but you can still feel the road/trail for agility. And I really love the colors! It‚Äôs a very cold gray, almost blueish grey. The lavender with dark pink accent colors are beautiful. They aren‚Äôt too dark to wear in the summer, and they‚Äôre attractive without being too bold so they don‚Äôt clash with most outfits. These aren‚Äôt nearly as hot as my winter hiking boots that are actual hiking boots and not just high top trail shoes. It‚Äôs so nice to have both!There‚Äôs only two negatives, which the low cut ones don‚Äôt have. The toe shield on these is just leather, not hardened for extra protection like the low cut version. And you do have to be careful about how you lace these because the tongue is just barely wide enough, and something can dig in if you don‚Äôt get it just right. I rethreaded one hole on the left shoe from under to over, and it‚Äôs much better.I still wear Nike Vomero‚Äôs on the road, but these are my favorites for the trails! üèÉüèª\u200d‚ôÄÔ∏èü•∞', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Update:Took these out on a hike at my local state park after a particularly wet week. There were lots of puddles, mud, and lots of places to slip.Tested water resistance when I sank into a muddy puddle. My foot got wet, but dried quickly. The traction was good when we had to cross large puddles on wobbly fallen branches.My feet stayed cool throughout the whole hike! I was impressed, even when it was pretty hot and humid out.Overall, these shoes are everything I needed them to be; cool, comfortable, cute, and supportive of my ankles and feet.‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîOriginal:I‚Äôve been on quite the hunt for a shoe that offered good ankle support, that‚Äôs breathable for the summer, and something at least semi-cute. In the world of hiking, cute is not in the manufacturer‚Äôs vocabulary‚Ä¶ at least nothing that is reasonably affordable. I‚Äôm pleased that these check all those boxes.I ordered these in a half size larger and in wide since I read several reviews about these being tight all over. The half size and width make these very comfortable and allow me to add thick socks for wetter and colder seasons! So plus!Bought these for an upcoming camping trip where there will be light hiking, but being pregnant, I need breathable shoes for the humid Texas heat. Haven‚Äôt had a chance to test them out yet, but will update me them after I get a chance to put them to the test.It‚Äôs worth noting that the rim of the ankles are stiff and does need to be broken in. Even with tall socks, they are rubbing.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable and lightweight.True to size.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I loved these new balance hiking/running boots. They're super comfortable and they're cute and stylish. They worked perfect for hiking around Puerto Rico for a vacation this summer.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Great fit, comfortable,  and very supportive.  I'm very impressed.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I like the style of the shoe. True to size but the toe area is VERY narrow even in the wide option. Also, if you have high arches then where the tongue is sown it is a little bit uncomfortable. I‚Äôd never buy this shoe at full price. Wait until it‚Äôs on sale.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'O. M. G. Where do I begin‚Ä¶‚Ä¶First off, the shoes came in a generic (non New Balance) box which means they‚Äôve previously been returned.Not a good sign.Tried them on and they were super uncomfortable around the ankles, very stiff and felt like I was being jabbed. Tied them somewhat loosely to see if that helped, it did not. \xa0Maybe they need to be broken in?? With this in mind I figured I would give them a fair shot and test them out. Put them on with boot socks and got on the treadmill.NOPE. Less than 5 minutes and I couldn‚Äôt stand it. Felt like I was doing the Frankenstein/Herman Munster walk. Super stiff all around, not just at the ankle.Normally a huge New Balance fan so I am extremely disappointed. Definitely going to return them.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Really cute shoes and lightweight. Shoe came in NB box, however the box was not in best shape. Both shoes had visible scuffs at the toe area, 2 loose threads and hairs in one of the shoes. The soles looks new but there are visible signs it has been worn before. I wanted to love these but I will have to return them same day I recieved them unfortunately.', 'rating': '2.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I‚Äôm a recently retired, semi pro athlete, and I‚Äôm very picky about my footwear. I have a straight lasted, narrow foot; very neutral gait; normal arch and no structural or biomechanics abnormalities other than boney ankles. I bought these NB Hierro trail shoes in the low cut version and they turned out to be my favorite trail shoes ever! And they have great durability - after a year and a half of regular use, they‚Äôre still going strong (I alternate several pairs of shoes at a time to extend their mileage), but I‚Äôm soon ready to retire them to be yardwork shoes. So I wanted to try these with a slightly higher ankle to keep the dirt & debris out better. I was a bit nervous because my ankles are so boney, so high tops often dig in. But these don‚Äôt! üëèThese are truly waterproof and have a gusseted tongue. They‚Äôre very comfortable, responsive and cushioned - every bit as responsive and cushioned as the low cut version. They‚Äôre light weight and very grippy, but you can still feel the road/trail for agility. And I really love the colors! It‚Äôs a very cold gray, almost blueish grey. The lavender with dark pink accent colors are beautiful. They aren‚Äôt too dark to wear in the summer, and they‚Äôre attractive without being too bold so they don‚Äôt clash with most outfits. These aren‚Äôt nearly as hot as my winter hiking boots that are actual hiking boots and not just high top trail shoes. It‚Äôs so nice to have both!There‚Äôs only two negatives, which the low cut ones don‚Äôt have. The toe shield on these is just leather, not hardened for extra protection like the low cut version. And you do have to be careful about how you lace these because the tongue is just barely wide enough, and something can dig in if you don‚Äôt get it just right. I rethreaded one hole on the left shoe from under to over, and it‚Äôs much better.I still wear Nike Vomero‚Äôs on the road, but these are my favorites for the trails! üèÉüèª\u200d‚ôÄÔ∏èü•∞', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Update:Took these out on a hike at my local state park after a particularly wet week. There were lots of puddles, mud, and lots of places to slip.Tested water resistance when I sank into a muddy puddle. My foot got wet, but dried quickly. The traction was good when we had to cross large puddles on wobbly fallen branches.My feet stayed cool throughout the whole hike! I was impressed, even when it was pretty hot and humid out.Overall, these shoes are everything I needed them to be; cool, comfortable, cute, and supportive of my ankles and feet.‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîOriginal:I‚Äôve been on quite the hunt for a shoe that offered good ankle support, that‚Äôs breathable for the summer, and something at least semi-cute. In the world of hiking, cute is not in the manufacturer‚Äôs vocabulary‚Ä¶ at least nothing that is reasonably affordable. I‚Äôm pleased that these check all those boxes.I ordered these in a half size larger and in wide since I read several reviews about these being tight all over. The half size and width make these very comfortable and allow me to add thick socks for wetter and colder seasons! So plus!Bought these for an upcoming camping trip where there will be light hiking, but being pregnant, I need breathable shoes for the humid Texas heat. Haven‚Äôt had a chance to test them out yet, but will update me them after I get a chance to put them to the test.It‚Äôs worth noting that the rim of the ankles are stiff and does need to be broken in. Even with tall socks, they are rubbing.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable and lightweight.True to size.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I loved these new balance hiking/running boots. They're super comfortable and they're cute and stylish. They worked perfect for hiking around Puerto Rico for a vacation this summer.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Great fit, comfortable,  and very supportive.  I'm very impressed.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I like the style of the shoe. True to size but the toe area is VERY narrow even in the wide option. Also, if you have high arches then where the tongue is sown it is a little bit uncomfortable. I‚Äôd never buy this shoe at full price. Wait until it‚Äôs on sale.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'O. M. G. Where do I begin‚Ä¶‚Ä¶First off, the shoes came in a generic (non New Balance) box which means they‚Äôve previously been returned.Not a good sign.Tried them on and they were super uncomfortable around the ankles, very stiff and felt like I was being jabbed. Tied them somewhat loosely to see if that helped, it did not. \xa0Maybe they need to be broken in?? With this in mind I figured I would give them a fair shot and test them out. Put them on with boot socks and got on the treadmill.NOPE. Less than 5 minutes and I couldn‚Äôt stand it. Felt like I was doing the Frankenstein/Herman Munster walk. Super stiff all around, not just at the ankle.Normally a huge New Balance fan so I am extremely disappointed. Definitely going to return them.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Really cute shoes and lightweight. Shoe came in NB box, however the box was not in best shape. I wanted to love these but I will have to return them same day I recieved them unfortunately.', 'rating': '2.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Women's Fresh Foam X Hierro V8
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and well-cushioned, with good arch support and durability, particularly noting the long-lasting cushioning and tread. review: {'review': 'Love these shoes!! Like walking on a cloud, fit perfectly.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable,  feel like walking on clouds, I forget I have heel spurts, love the colors,my feet feel supported, fit perfect i have wide feet, good quality.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I buy two or three new pairs of tennis shoes every six months. Buy a half size up - I'm usually a size 10 in Nikes, but in the New Balance, I needed a 10.5.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I‚Äôm an ex semi-pro triathlete. I‚Äôve had a few injuries and I‚Äôm not 29 any more, so I‚Äôm very picky about my shoes. I used to only run on roads for speed but do trails now that I‚Äôm retired from competing. This is my second pair of NB Hierro trail shoes. My first pair were v7 Gore-Tex, and they were the best trail shoes I ever had! They‚Äôre very comfortable, have enough cushioning &  protection, but I can still feel the ground which I like because they‚Äôre more agile. They‚Äôre light enough, and they look nice. And I love the toe protect! It has saved my toenails more than once. And both the cushioning and tread last incredibly long - longer than Nike and much longer than Brooks. I like these better than the Nike Pegasus trails because I felt my heels slip in the new Pegasus trails and because these have the toe protect and they last much longer, although I still prefer Nike Pegasus and Nike Vomero on the road.I like to have a second pair of both road and trail shoes to alternate each, and I only need one pair of each with Gore-Tex for when it‚Äôs wet because without GTX they‚Äôre more breathable and a tiny bit lighter. These v8 have a different tread than the v7 that is more grippy; otherwise they feel identical.The only thing I don‚Äôt like about these is that they‚Äôre wider than the last model, why do not to be a dealbreaker. I actually double check the box to make sure they didn‚Äôt send me the wrong width. I probably won‚Äôt buy them again because of this.These arrived in a super beat up New Balance box with torn paper. Fortunately, I don‚Äôt really care about that. They were sealed in a plastic bag and then in another box that was in perfect condition for shipping. The shoes themselves are fine, but I can tell they‚Äôve been tried on because the laces were twisted. Again, I don‚Äôt really care because I got them on sale and they‚Äôre otherwise brand new with the tags still on, but I thought I‚Äôd mention it for people who might care.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Purchase on a great deal day. Comfortable while walking. Style and quality is wonderful. The fit and value for the money: unbeatable.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable. Great fit, true to size.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excellent Comfortable, soft and durable, it was what I expected and more.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Women's Fresh Foam X Kaiha Road V1
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-cushioned, and appreciate their arch support. The style receives positive feedback, with customers loving the look. While some customers say the shoes fit true to size, others find them too narrow, and durability is a concern as customers report the shoes tearing apart. The quality and value for money receive mixed reviews, with some customers loving them while others find them terrible and overpriced.
review: {'review': 'I‚Äôve had two pairs of the Kaia model and just ordered two more. I‚Äôm a moderate treadmill runner. (5-6 days a week ranging from 3-4.5 miles a day). I love the fit and support of the Kaias and how they keep my feet and legs healthy. It took me a year to recover from shin splints after wearing the wrong shoes for too long (oops). The Kaias last for about 300 miles as the treadmill eats up the soles pretty badly, but I‚Äôll take to soft, flexible feel of the sole over a firm and unforgiving shoe any day. The sole is the only thing that ever shows wear and tear. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre a like-minded runner.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'So far, so good! Purchased these to support fitness walking of long-ish distances and manage mild to moderate knee pain. They appear to be helping so far, time will tell if they continue to deliver.So many shoes have gone to the Hoka-inspired massive, mushy sole and for me, those are not at all comfortable. I don‚Äôt like how my foot strikes the ground and I don‚Äôt feel the energy return from each step is optimal. THESE shoes, on the other hand, seem to offer a somewhat restrained fuller sole that gives some cushioning but still feels as though the physics of energy return are supporting your desire to walk with some speed/sense of urgency. Not sloppy at all. And it seems your feet hit the ground in a more natural, comfortable way.These look nice, too. I got the dark grey/black upper with while sole. Pretty understated vs screaming with color which is what I personally prefer.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Very comfortable, fairly priced. I love how light weight they are and easy to clean and they are true to size. I'm a size 9 and the fit is perfect.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes fit great and were comfortable right out of the box. I love the color. I hope they last. The soles are thicker and cushion very well.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I‚Äôve been wearing these New Balance Fresh Foam sneakers for a few weeks now, and I‚Äôm seriously impressed. I originally bought them for light workouts and walking, but they‚Äôve quickly become my everyday shoes because of how comfortable and supportive they are.The cushioning is fantastic‚Äîsoft without feeling squishy‚Äîand offers a nice bounce during workouts like walking, cardio, and strength training. What really stood out for me, though, is the arch support. I have slightly flat feet and often deal with foot fatigue, but these shoes give enough support to keep me comfortable, even during longer workouts or when I‚Äôm on my feet all day.They‚Äôre also really lightweight and breathable, which is great for the gym or just running errands. I‚Äôve had no issues with rubbing or blisters, and I didn‚Äôt need to break them in at all. I went with my usual size and the fit was spot-on, with a bit of extra room in the toe box.If you‚Äôre looking for a versatile sneaker that works for both fitness and everyday wear‚Äîand especially if you need decent arch support‚ÄîI highly recommend these. New Balance really nailed it with this one.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "As someone with a number of foot and ankle issues, finding the right sneaker has always been a challenge. However, the New Balance Women's Fresh Foam X Kaiha Road V1 has been a game-changer for me ‚Äì so much so that this is my third pair! Quite simply, these are the best sneakers I have ever worn and they last longer than more expensive shoes.The comfort level is exceptional. The Fresh Foam X cushioning provides a fantastic balance of softness and support, which is crucial for my sensitive feet. spending long days on my feet coaching high school football and lacrosse , these shoes consistently deliver all-day comfort without any of the aches and pains I've experienced with other brands. For me, they've been a true lifesaver, and I'll likely be reaching for a fourth pair when the time comes!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "On December 28, 2024 I purchased this sneaker in  Black/Phantom/Taro this style held up great.  After 6 months of wear the sneaker started to wear on the bottom and loose its bounce so I decided to purchase another pair on May 4th in Black/Phantom/Silver Metallic.\xa0 This sneaker has not held up like it should.\xa0The entire bottom of the sneaker has worn out in only 2 months of walking wear.\xa0\xa0 I don't know if the quality of the\xa0Black/Phantom/Silver Metallic is different\xa0from the Black/Phantom/Taro, but I would think I should get the same 6 months wear from the same style of sneaker if it is even a different color.\xa0 I did just purchase\xa0another pair in the original color, I hope\xa0this holds up as well because the comfort I get from this sneaker is amazing and I can walk for hours pain free.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes were a great surprise and I love them.  I have difficult, painful feet and I change my shoes out 3 or 4 times a day.  My grand daughter recommended these and I only bought them to not disappoint her.  I\'m so glad I did!  They\'re comfortable enough for me to wear with 5 hours on my feet.  I thought the toe would be too narrow but the meshy fabric has enough "give" that my toes (bunions) aren\'t cramped.  I highly recommend these shoes.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Women's Fresh Foam X Vongo V6
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and appreciate their excellent cushioning, good arch support, and overall quality. They like the style and color, and one customer mentions they help with back pain. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some say the extra wide width is perfect, others find them too narrow. The durability is also mixed, with one customer reporting issues with the sole falling apart.
review: {'review': "I think I waited too long between my last pair of running shoes and my new ones, because the difference in experience is phenomenal. Maybe the foam sole breaks down faster? I'm not sure, this is a new concept to me with my last pair.My new kicks are super comfy. I'm not a runner, but a back pain patient. I pretty much live in a New Balance running shoe or a Mephisto Helen sandal. My trusty physical therapist wants me in a solid wide based sole for stability - check. Good arch support - check. (I also insert my custom orthotics from my podiatrist.) Fits my wide foot well in a wide size - check. Looking good! - check. Got on sale during Prime Days for a great deal - check. (I always purchase a pair of New Balance that lists at $140 or more for construction and durability. The support feels more solid.) Can throw into the washing machine for easy cleaning - check.These running shoes are super comfy and stabilizing, and help my back pain. I recommend.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'They look great and fit very well.  Sprained my ankle and these offer the extra support and balance I needed after getting out of the walking boot. Very nice for walking.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable, excellent cushioning, great stability shoe and the wide width is great.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice shoes that are pretty comfortable right out of the box.  Took one star off as they are not really ‚Äúbreathable‚Äù and my feet get super hot in them. These were recommended by my doctor for plantar fasciitis.  My feet still hurt after wearing them but I‚Äôm hoping over time they will help.  Good traction walking around on our tile floors.  Fit is true to size.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This is my first pair of New Balance shoes after wearing Mizuno Wave Inspire with an orthotic for moderate over pronation for 13 years. I wanted to start a shoe rotation, hearing that helps prevent injury, so I threw these shoes into my rotation. I also wanted to try to run without my orthotic to take advantage of the newer shoe models and technology that is built into them. I appreciated the comfort and cloud-like feel of these shoes. They have good support, and provide some extra return when pushing off. They are lightweight and comfortable. They provide good stability, although I also purchased the Mizuno Wave Horizon as my second shoe in the rotation, and that shoe is much more stable. The color is nice and the fit is good for me, although I have a more narrow foot. Overall, I am happy with the shoes and recommend them for those with moderate overpronation.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Too wide and soft\xa0 not stable enough', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great shoes!  Love New Balance for their arch support, cushion and wide toe box and narrow heal.  Great fit, light weight and durable.  They are really nice looking as well.  I wear them with jeans, shorts etc.  I wear these as everyday shoes to protect my feet and back because of their support.  They don‚Äôt have enough cushion for me for running or extra long walks.  I wear the New Balance Fresh Foam X More that provide the additional cushioning that I need for my personal needs.  They are true to size.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Super comfortable', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}
