customer_say: Customers find these running shoes great for wide feet, with a roomy toe box and true-to-size fit. They receive positive feedback for their comfort, with one customer noting they can walk for many hours without pain, and customers appreciate their support, particularly the great arch support. Customers like the look and color, and while some find the cushioning great, others say it's not well cushioned. The durability receives mixed reviews, with some saying they last a long time while others report mesh rips and seams separating around the toe.
review: {'review': 'The 840 is the perfect shoe for me. I have a wide foot, a small bunion and I have had surgery for neuromas. A tight shoe will cause me discomfort and aggravate my feet. The 840 has a wide toe box, I have to buy an extra wide.  I wore my first pair of 840s for almost 2 years. I exercised or walked 5-6 days per week and never had any problems. A couple months ago I bought the 880 in an extra wide, thought they were wide enough, within ~6 weeks my feet were hurting, my plantar fasciitis flared up, even had to go to the doctor.  Besides following the doctors orders I ordered a new pair of 840s. My feet are back to normal. The 880 is a nice shoe other than a narrower toe box the shoe is comfortable and supportive. I will wear them on days I don‚Äôt have to do a lot of walking. If you need a wide toe box go with the 840.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This is my fourth pair of 840 running shoes.  It is only available on Amazon.  NB is not manufacturing it anymore.  They seem to have moved to a less expensive version, made of materials that wear out quickly, This version has a roomy toe-box, a reinforced strip around the entire front of the shoe, and a strong rubber sole.  Not so for the current version sold by NB. The toe-box is narrower, there is no reinforcement surrounding the front, and the sole is made of foam.  The newer version is made of materials that do not last as long as this one.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Hard to find this version, but the most comfortable for me.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great fit.  Great shoe‚Ä¶I find it feels hot an heavy in the summer so I switch to my ON sneakers for the warm weather.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I have low volume, flexible feet with a low arch. Also have neuroma and a bunion and bunionette.These are the only shoes I have been able to wear without pain. They provide firm, yet flexible support with a nice round toe box so I can spread my toes. Excellent heel support. I tried the v4 last year and they were too wide and sloppy for me. I did size a half size down for the v5 and they fit perfectly. Usually in an athletic shoe I have to size up a half size but not with these. They‚Äôre great, please do not change them. I‚Äôm ordering the other color soon. Thank you, New Balance!Additional info, it is a fuller shoe but I think it can still work for those with lower volume feet. I have forefoot issues and may add a metatarsal pad to help off load my forefeet. People with foot issues have such a hard time‚Ä¶. I hope this helps someone else.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My favorite athletic shoe for the last five or six years. I wear them all the time and wear them out quickly so I was very pleased to see that I could get the 840 new balance on Amazon! They fit me perfectly and they are so comfortable!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I like the 940 better don't know why NB discontinued. These look good and fit about the same. Less arch support and not as much cushion at the ball of the foot which is where I have issues. Will keep them just not sure if I'll buy again or try a new brand next time. Been a NB fan for years but they just don't last like they used to, like everything else higher price lower quality.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Great sneaker. I wish New Balance had not revised the sneaker with more padding. It's not useful!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Womens Fresh Foam X 860 V14
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and well-fitting, particularly noting their wide toe box and good arch support for flat feet. The shoes receive positive feedback for their cushioning, with customers describing the feel as amazing, and customers appreciate their nice appearance. While some customers report no foot pain, others experience blisters. The durability receives mixed reviews, with some saying they last long while others report issues.
review: {'review': 'I‚Äôm obsessed with these shoes!! They are unbelievably comfortable and supportive, and I can wear them all day without my feet getting tired. The cushioning feels amazing, and the design is so sleek and stylish. Honestly, they‚Äôre perfect for everything‚Äîrunning, walking, or just everyday wear. Definitely my new go-to sneakers!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Comfortable and supportive.  Like the color. Laces could be a bit longer but not big issue.  Fits my usual size.  Helps to stabilize my arthritic foot when I am walking.  Might be too warm for summer but rest of seasons, is comfy.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'So far, I have been very satisfied with the comfort and wearability of this shoe.  I was reluctant to buy a shoe with a fairly thick sole, but the shoes were recommended by physical therapists as being one of the best for people whose knees are sensitive to concrete floors.  The shoe is well-padded inside - the arch support is perfect, the heel cup keeps narrow heels in place.  The toebox is wide and gives your toes plenty of room to move in.  Also, important to me is the mesh covering over the toe box.  I had surgery on my right foot and can never find comfortable shoes.  These shoes fit the bill.  Best of all, walking on concrete and suffering the rebounding effect of sore knees is gone.  The inner sole feels ergonomically designed for the bottom of the feet, and there is deep cushioning with a bit of spring action.  This is a perfect shoe for me.  I bought a pair of white shoes but want to buy other colors, as well.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I‚Äôve been wearing these for a while now, and they are my favorite shoes for walking and working out at the gym. Great stability for the ankles, nice cushion for the foot, plenty of room for the toes. Will buy this style again.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "This stability shoe seemed quite comfortable in every respect. I wore it around the house, then purchased it. When I went for my daily 3 mile walk, I realized what wasn't apparent during the time in the house with it: the toe box, even in a wide, was rather snug. It was wide enough, but shallow. Over the extended time of the walk, my second toe became sore. I'm normally a size 7, purchased a 7 1/2. If I were doing it over again, I'd get it a full size bigger. I own a NB 1080 size 7 1/2, and the toe box is roomier, so it's this particular model.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "It's harder for me to find shoes because I need them to support my overpronation, but I also where a 2A (narrow) width. There's not a lot of options, but this one is perfect. It's very comfortable, supportive and looks nice as well. Size is accurate. The bottom of the shoe actually has a good design and seems like it will last a while.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'As far as the stability shoe and comfort, this is a wonderful sneaker and believe me I have tried many what I cannot understand is how the sizing is so off !I wear an eight and typically size up to an 8.5 in my running sneakers. I ordered a nine based on reviews saying that the sneaker was small. Had to return currently wearing a 9 1/2. ! I also have narrow feet and these are borderline too tight for me in the regular with, but the wide was too wide.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I wore these shoes for a 12 hour shift right out of the box. I took an extra pair of shoes to work with me just in case, but didn‚Äôt use them. I had wanted some white shoes for a while and when shopping for a white shoe many had other colors or weren‚Äôt really white. These are nice and white. I bought my regular size and they fit fine. I have worn New Balance shoes in 3 other styles and all of them fit and are comfortable so I felt pretty confident that these would too. I‚Äôm on my feet for almost all of that 12 hour shift .  My feet were tired but not at all painful. So these are good for work and I will wear them for walks and  other casual wear.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Womens Fresh Foam X Hierro V9
customer_say: Customers find these trail running shoes extremely comfortable, rugged for hiking, and durable through repeated use. They receive positive feedback for their support, cushioning, and style, with one customer noting they feel like walking on a supportive cloud. Customers disagree on the sizing, with some finding them wide while others say they run small.
review: {'review': 'I‚Äôve bought the New Balance Women‚Äôs Fresh Foam X Hierro multiple times, and I absolutely love them! As I‚Äôve gotten older, I‚Äôve realized just how crucial a great shoe is for comfort and support, and these deliver in every way. The Fresh Foam X cushioning feels like running on clouds, providing a soft yet stable ride that‚Äôs perfect for my daily walks and occasional trail hikes. The Vibram Megagrip outsole offers fantastic traction, even on uneven or slippery surfaces, which gives me confidence on various terrains. I also appreciate the breathable mesh upper and the snug, supportive fit‚Äîthough I‚Äôd recommend trying the wide option if you prefer extra toe room. The shoes are durable, stylish, and versatile enough for both trails and casual outings. They‚Äôve held up well through repeated use, and I keep coming back to them for their unbeatable comfort and reliability. Highly recommend these to anyone who values quality footwear, especially as comfort becomes more important with age!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Why did you pick this product vs others?:I tried on several pairs of trail runners, and these were by far the most comfortable (I would have bought them from the store where they fitted me, but they didn't have the black shoe in stock, so Amazon to the rescue.) I myself need a thick and cushioned sole, so I can see how some people would find these too thick, but for me they are perfect. I wore them on one hike so far, without breaking them in, and they already feel more comfortable than my other hiking shoes that I've been breaking in for months. I feel like I can walk forever in these, which will be helpful on my Mont Blanc Trail hike I'm doing in 2 weeks. Additionally, they are stylish and sleek, and I've received many compliments on their appearance. I'm so glad I found these shoes!Fit:8.5 (true to size)Shoe quality:ExcellentColor:BlackStyle:Women's Trail RunnersComfort:Very comfortable, the best I've ever found", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are very well built but run a little small. I reordered shoe in extra wide. I received this original pair as size 10 wide and it says it is but also says it‚Äôs B width. They are very comfy for bottoms of my arthritic feet. Worth the price if I can ever get the width correct .', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Cannot speak enough about how comfortable these sneakers are. I have bad knees and need support cushion and rise in my heel to keep my leg steady. I came across these sneakers because I am a New Balance avid user but these have now replaced my 1080 version 14 running sneaker. They are more comfortable. The color ways are so stylish rugged for hiking and have great suspension. Just bought my second pair in the green color way I have the pink also.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'these wear like heaven on my wide feet.  my shoe size is typically 9w but purchased 10w in this style.  i hiked all over southern utah in them and it was like walking on clouds.  i have a difficult time finding comfortable shoes and was absolutely thrilled with this pair!  they‚Äôre also really cute and don‚Äôt make my feet look big!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I have loved new balance shoes and these trail ones are perfect.  Great support and bottom cushion.  Lightweight and perfect for the trails! Plus this color is a great fit for the outdoors!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'They ran small. I forgot new balance generally runs small. The cushioning feels good but they are tight around my toes. I might return them.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Novice trail runner here! Tried Saunconys‚Äô initially and ended up with a horrible blister. These are SO comfortable and I still feel like I have control of my step. HIGHLY recommend.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Womens Fresh Foam X More V5
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one noting they don't feel the ground at all, and appreciate their quality and cushioning, particularly for sore and achy feet. The shoes receive positive feedback for pain relief, helping with sciatic pain in both hips, and offer great arch support. Customers like the color options, with one mentioning they come in six different colors to match scrubs. Regarding size and fit, while some find them true to size with a wide toebox, others report sizing issues and not enough room for the actual foot.
review: {'review': "It took 10 or 11 days to finally get these sneakers. !  Got them today, tried them on. You don't feel the ground at all. The stack of foam cushion is very high. Makes you taller a bit. These shoes are outstanding. Very impressive. Hope they last and hold up for a long time. I got my regular size and they fit snug, like a half size small. They are narrow too.  Amazing shoes tho.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are true to size and super squishy soft yet still surprisingly supportive. Great for standing on hard floors and walking. I have not used them for running yet. I mostly wanted them as a comfort & recovery shoe, for which they are well suited. These shoes are the most cushioned and supportive I‚Äôve found. I normally wear Hokas and find these even more comfortable. My feet don‚Äôt get tired. I struggle with high arches & plantar fasciitis, but these shoes make me forget it.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I just tried on these sneakers, I love them! It‚Äôs good to see they have lived up to their name over the years. These shoes are comfortable, and I especially recommend these shoes for my fellow nurses , and also for walking. Overall, I would rate this product 5 stars.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are comfortable and well made. Of course, their New Balance. They  are sturdy yet light weight! I would recommend these to anyone.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This shoe was beautiful!! I loved the color and the gold stitching. The bottom of the shoe had great support and was comfortable. The issue for me was in the toe box. I ordered my normal size for NB 7.5Wide, but this shoe was so tight in the toe box, and especially across the top of my foot, it felt so tight. I really liked the shoe, so I was bummed to return it.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I absolutely love these sneakers! I have been having so much foot pain from plantar fasciitis and heel spurs, and I wasn‚Äôt having any luck with finding something that felt GOOD on my feet until I saw these, read the description and the reviews and thought I‚Äôd give it a try. I am very glad I did because I bought them in another color as well. They are super comfortable, lots of cushion for sore and achy feet, my orthotic inserts fit just fine when the original insoles were removed. The first time I put these sneakers on I literally sighed in relief. I definitely need more of these in all the colors! \U0001faf6üèª I recommend if you are experiencing foot pain and if you have a wide sized foot like I do. I found these in my wide size and in colors that aren‚Äôt boring or üëéüèª! Woohoo! Bonus! As a teacher I wish I had found these before school ended! Thank goodness they will be in my wardrobe ready for the end of August!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I got these shoes for a trip where I knew I was going to be walking a lot. I usually have knee pain after walking more than 2 miles so I was prepared to invest to ensure I was comfortable. I walked >5 miles every on a 3 week trip and had no pain at all for the entire time. I‚Äôm used to my feet aching at the end of the day but that never happened! This is my new favorite pair of shoes, and I always reach for them. They‚Äôre the perfect low drop, wide toe box and supportive shoe.One thing I would say is I originally got a wide but it still felt a bit snug so I had to exchange for an X-Wide.They are also a bit chunky so just be aware, but overall I think it helps with stability and balance. If you‚Äôre okay with trading some style points for extreme comfort this is the shoe for you.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, with the FuelCell technology keeping feet comfortable, and appreciate their quality and timeless style. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some find them roomy for orthotics, others say they're much narrower than expected. Customers disagree on the support, with some finding them great for arthritic feet while others report poor arch support. The size and durability also get mixed reviews, with some saying they last for 2 years while others report issues with fraying edges and stained laces. While some consider them well worth the price, others find them expensive.
review: {'review': "I got these several days ago and am in the process of breaking them in.  I've been buying this model of New Balance for many years since they fit me and work well for everyday walking and casual living.  There is good arch support, they're very comfortable If I could find another brand that worked so well, I wouldn't hesitate to try them.  So far this is the brand that works.  They are pricey though, but they work for me and last years!  I got them a 1/2 size larger than my previous ones because I feel I need the extra room.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Comfortable and good fit for my narrow foot!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Recommended by my podiatrist, these are good quality, durable, and comfortable.  I wear them every day.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are really comfortable if you are walking and on your feet throughout the day. I have wide feet for a woman and I went a half size down from my true size because this shoe runs a little long. Other than that, going a half size down fits perfectly. They are not as firm and heavy as a shoe like the Nike Air Max, but they still provide a fair amount of stability and support. I definitely recommend this shoe for active people and I personally plan on buying another pair when this one gets old.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I love New Balance 990 shoes and have bought them for years.  For some reason, this year's women's 990v6 has shoe laces that are too small to tie.  I went to my local New Balance shoe store, they said that everyone was unhappy with this and that I should call NB customer service.  After half an hour on hold, New Balance Customer Service told me that they do not solve shoelace problems, and that the problem is all mine.  The shoes come with too-small laces in 2 different colors (how special is that!).  It is costing me an additional $15 to order replacement shoelaces on Amazon, while taking my best guess at the right size to order.  I asked NB Customer Service to at least document the fact that their product has a problem, and the agent seemed overwhelmed at the effort that this would require.  With a $199 price tag, something here should really be handled a lot better.  Any chance that someone up there will read this?Footnote:  I bought the extra shoe laces, and now I really hate these shoes.  There is a huge amount of shoelace showing (is this supposed to be decorative?), and I prefer a shoe which is less shoelace, and more shoe material.  New Balance seems to have considered this, by providing 2 pairs of shoe laces - one white and one navy.  Theoretically, the navy laces would be less visible.  Unfortunately, the shoe has a white piping around the lacing area, so the navy laces just look dumb.  Use the white laces, which will never stay white, and they cover 1/3 of the shoe's front.", 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I wish they shipped with navy and white laces as I prefer navy more.  No arch support - I had to add my arch support insoles but overall really comfy and good looking shoe.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I have a very narrow shoe size, and it's difficult to find shoes that fit. I don't wear any sneakers other than New Balance because they fit perfectly.  I expected to pay about the same price as I would if I purchased them at the retail store, but they were a little less expensive on Amazon.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'It‚Äôs s√∫per confortable and I love it sooo much I will get this repeatedly every time it‚Äôs worn out', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: New Balance Womens FuelCell Rebel V3Running
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable for running 2-4 miles and appreciate their high quality, with one customer noting they're great for indoor track use. The shoes are lightweight and provide good cushioning, with one customer mentioning they're suitable for long-distance runs. They receive positive feedback for their traction, with one customer highlighting their effectiveness on concrete paths, and customers report pain relief, particularly in knee pain. However, customers disagree on the fit, and durability is a concern as heels collapse after one month of use.
review: {'review': 'I ordered these shoes on sale, and ordered them a half size up from my normal running shoe size (or .5-1 full size up from everyday shoes) and they fit perfect! These shoes are plenty roomy in the toebox, have a nice colorway, the laces are thin and stay tied, and the gusseted tongue is thin, comfortable and stays right where it should. The shoes are highly ventilated and breathable, not to mention extremely light, bouncy, and fast! I do have some gripes with the seller, though. I ordered from Fast Goods and when they got to me, there was only the inner box portion, no lid, and it was beat up pretty badly. I could definitely tell the shoes had been tried on/worn, and were certainly a return or a regret for somebody else. I loved them so much, though, and got them at such a great price, that I was willing to keep them despite all that. I just didn\'t find it very professional of the seller to sell them as "brand new" when they really weren\'t, so be aware of that. I couldn\'t find the rose and white colorway elsewhere or at such a good price, so I cut my slight losses on brand new shoes and kept them, because they are truly a comfortable and amazing shoe. I intend to get at least 300 miles out of them if possible!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I absolutely love these shoes! I've been trying a variety of Asics, Hoka, Altra, Brooks, and Rykas over the past year. Most I either tried on in the store or purchased and wore for a few minutes before returning. Others I thought worked until discovering after a few weeks that they weren't right. I have metatarsalgia and Morton's Neuroma in one foot and have tried the shoes recommended by foot specialists. I need wide shoes for both toe box room and metatarsal comfort not constricting the outer edge of my foot. However, all these shoes resulted in some ball of foot soreness. I do Jazzercise, which involves jogging in place, jumping, lunging, balancing on one foot, and plenty of other footwork. It's important that my weight be placed primarily in the heel and arch to minimize impact to my forefoot. Only the FuelCell Rebel V3s have resulted in zero soreness during and after a class. They are light and springy to boot. When I stand for a long period, I am aware that there is no pressure on the ball of my foot or toes (and why I don't feel pain or soreness). In fact, I had to wear a pair of fancy stage shoes last weekend that hurt my foot. Afterwards, I put on these NBs, and my foot felt better within minutes. I've worn them for the past three weeks and want to purchase another pair. I only intended to wear these shoes to workouts but find myself in them almost daily because my feet feel so dang good.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Love these! Every 4 or 5 years I manage to find a pair of New Balance shoes in a color/style I love that I can\'t find locally. They are comfortable for me (I like the increased width) and I\'ve washed them a few times returning the brightness of the "pineapple" yellow and they still look and feel great. Thanks NB, keep up the good work!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These Sneakers fit great.  I would have rated them a 5 but the tongue was too short for me.  I have planter fasiitis, metatarsalgia and a hammer toe.  These accomodate all of these conditions with a "drop" that I need to be comfortable.  I love New Balance!', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Love this shoe!I have recently gotten back into running after a 35 year hiatus. After logging about 75 miles in September, I signed up for a couple of 10ks and a half marathon. My wife did some research and these were the shoes she decided upon and they are amazing.Incredibly light weight, breathable, tongue stays put while running, great cushion over long distance. I am 51, and the cushion on these things is great for my knees.I have since bought two other pairs of shoes, Hoka Mach X and Adidas Duramo Speed and the New Balance are still my favorite shoe.I cannot recommend them enough', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I purchased these on 7 Apr, it's June 5th.  Like a previous poster, I tend to be a heal striker and bought these specifically for their rated cushioning and design for marathon runners.  I can't run anymore but I speed walk and put in between 4 to 10 miles 5 days a week.  I expected these shows to last at least 3 to 6 months.  Sadly after only a month and a half of use the right heel has completely blown out and is flat.  The sole is also pulling away from the body of the shoe so the shoes are garbage now.  To say I'm disappointed is an understatement.  I can't return them to Amazon now but Im hoping New Balance honors thier six month outer sole warranty.Sadly I can't recommend these.  I've used New Balance shoes for over 20 years and have never had an experience like this", 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very lightweight running shoe with a spongey sole that I‚Äôm using as my work shoes in a hospital. I‚Äôm on my feet and walking around a lot indoors so I need a shoe that‚Äôs light, is breathable, and has some bounce. They are very quiet to walk around on hospital flooring. They‚Äôre not constantly squeaking.These wouldn‚Äôt be good as outdoor work shoes. These are great shoes if your feet get hot easily. They‚Äôre very breathable so they dry out quickly and completely after taking them off after a shift.I have a different pair of new balance shoes for running but I feel like I could do a marathon in these ones.I usually buy size 12 for converse all-stars, or Vans slip on shoes, but this style of shoe I needed a 12.5.I‚Äôve been wearing New Balance for almost 20 years and I trust them for my work shoes and running shoes.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I was struggling with muscular issues, trying to run with my old, inflexible legs.  So I searched for some very "cushy" runners that would reduce the strike when running on pavement. NB always fit me well, so I chose these. They worked well, as I have been able to comfortably run 2-4 miles at a time.  Can\'t say how long they will last with such a soft sole, but I suppose that\'s a tradeoff to live with. I only have a hundred miles on them so far...', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-fitting, and true to size, with excellent durability that holds up over time. review: {'review': 'Comfortable, lightweight and great true to size fit. A stylish, quality shoe for a fantastic price. Only time will tell with durability but Nikes are usually always durable. These aren‚Äôt my first Nikes and they definitely won‚Äôt be my last!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Comfort and quality', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'They do fit too size, my Husband love them', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice shoe but was to small for my son if you have wide feet get a bigger size', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Most comfortable shoe I've owned", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I have been buying Nike Revolutions for quite a few years now. I normally run approx 10 miles a week and these last a decent amount of time. Typically the Revolutions start to squeak after a few months, which is annoying, but doesn't affect the performance of the shoe.I haven't put enough mileage on these newest ones to know if the squeaking will show up!The sizing is always the same which is a big bonus for me.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The left shoes squeaks loudly as I walk making it unwearable especially indoors.  Otherwise this shoe is very comfortable just like my other nikes.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Lite weight and good for the gym are just running to the store great shoes, I'm on my second pair the first is still intact after a year, now my lawn maintenance shoes.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, lightweight, and great for various activities including HIIT workouts and indoor gym exercises. They receive positive feedback for their quality, style, and arch support, with one customer noting they help relieve foot pain. The fit and sizing receive mixed reviews - while some find them a great fit, others say they run slightly small.
review: {'review': 'So glad I came upon this shoe. OMG!!!! So light & comfortable. I received so many compliments on them. I need another pair in another color. Very impressed!!!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Super cool! I love these shoes. Very comfortable and good fit. They look very cool! Will buy another pair.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These are lightweight and perfect for an intense HIIT workout.  Love the way they hug the foot and offer support and traction.I have a deep aversion to sneakers with bulky rubber soles so my selection pool is shallow.  These checked my sole profile box and are actually cute and functional.They arrive in a Nike Box without a lid but all the shoe packing was fresh.  Seller wraps product in a clear plastic.This particular style is not easy to come by anymore.  I consider them a great find', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Order these for the gym. Shipping was fast. The shoes were priced great. Naturally when something is cheap you assume they are poor quality. The shoes are comfortable i can slip them on without undoing laces.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My daughter loves the shoe. She is a waitress and said she wishes it had more arch.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I bought this for cross training/HIIT and weight lifting to replace my old Nike. I paid 48 dollars for the grey color, which is perfect for my needs. This shoe is super light (I don\'t lile bulky shoes) and can feel like barefoot at times. It performs really well on body combat classes for high kicks and jumps, it does well on weight training, and it is almost good for HIIT. My only negative for it is that it has very limited lateral support for HIIT training, and that it feels a bit too wide/roomy for my narrow-ish feet (I\'m a 7, 117lbs/5\'5" and bought a 7). Also it slides backwards slightly for lunges, but not for squats. It also slides backwords for planks, so I need to place my feet on the mat to stay put.I did some light treadmill running in these and they worked for the lower intensity/short runs as well.Overall, I reccomend this shoe. If it\'s for walking / kicking around, these are super light and comfy and cute. If it\'s for cross training, these offer a very lightweight, responsive shoe (as opposed to the bulky ones with added whistles and bells) and it may surprise you that you will pick them every time for a quick gym workout.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': '\u200bRun, Don\'t Walk, Away from These "Nikes"\u200bIf you\'re in the market for a new pair of running shoes, I have a recommendation for you: run as fast as you can in the opposite direction from these. I don\'t know who made these, but I\'m pretty sure their product development meeting went something like this: "Okay, we need a running shoe that looks like a Nike, but is it a Nike? Absolutely not. Will it support your foot? No. Can you run in it? You can try. Should you try? Probably not."\u200bThe lack of support is truly a work of art, a masterpiece of structural failure. It feels less like I\'m wearing a running shoe and more like I\'m running on two very stylish, foot-shaped pillows. You know how some shoes have a heel cup to keep your foot in place? These have a heel suggestion, a gentle nudge that basically says, "Your foot should probably stay here, but hey, if it wants to slip around, that\'s cool too."\u200bAnd let\'s talk about the midsole. I\'m not a podiatrist, but I\'m pretty sure a shoe\'s midsole is supposed to provide a stable foundation, not an expanding one. These shoes have a tragic flaw: the midsole has decided to spread out like a happy-go-lucky house guest who\'s gotten a little too comfortable on the couch. Every time I take a step, I can feel the shoe itself surrendering to the laws of physics, widening and flattening out under the sheer weight of my disappointment.\u200bI waited too long to return them, a classic rookie mistake. I was too optimistic, hoping that with each run, they would somehow magically transform into the supportive shoes they were pretending to be. They did not. Instead, they just got worse, which is honestly impressive. So, would I purchase them again? Not unless I\'m training for a clown marathon where oversized, floppy footwear is a requirement. Would I recommend them? Only to my worst enemy. You\'ve been warned.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable I recommend that very light and comfortable', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these basketball shoes to be of good quality, with a great fit and nice appearance. Excelentes para entrenar', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This is my 3rd pair of this model (Interact Run). This is my 2nd pair of the white/day-glo green logo model. The shoe just looks great. I get a lot of compliments on its looks.Fit: I wear a 9.5 Wide, typical shoe size. However, on my work out shoes I usually go up to a size 10. I need the extra toe box width. This size 10 feels a little tight to begin with, but it does stretch out pretty quickly. I did order a 10.5 on one pair and it opened up the toe box, but is a little loose.Durability: The tread is not very deep, so I find that I am wearing the grooves out in my major contact areas pretty quickly. I am getting about 90 days of everyday workout use before the certain areas are slick. The shoe is still very serviceable, so it gets relegated to a walking or casual shoe.Value: I could sometimes get this shoe for under $60. That for me is a great value. Similar shoes go for around $120 in my experience.I would highly recommend for an indoor gym / cross training shoe', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Amazing shoes. review: {'review': 'I bought these Air Jordan 1 Mid sneakers as a birthday gift for my husband, and he absolutely loved them! His usual size is 10.5, but I decided to order size 11 after reading the reviews that they run a bit small ‚Äî and I‚Äôm glad I did, because the 11 fits him perfectly. The quality is excellent, they look very stylish, and he says they‚Äôre super comfortable to wear every day. I‚Äôm very happy with this purchase and highly recommend them, especially as a gift.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These are the dopest pair of ajordans that I own. The fit is perfect I am usually 9/9.5 in women so I purchased a 7.5 in men. They fit great with socks on if I would‚Äôve gotten an 8 in men these would be EVEN more comfortable and better. Style and color is EVERYTHING I could ask for in a sneaker that not a lot of ppl own. Can‚Äôt speak on durability or wearability but I‚Äôm sure they will do great. This isn‚Äôt a shoe I‚Äôd wear everyday because of course not. GREAT SHOE! NICE PRICE POINT!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I recently picked up a pair of the Nike Men's Air Jordans in that stunning light blue color with white and black accents, and I couldn't be happier. These shoes are an absolute showstopper! The color combination is clean, bold, and modern. The light blue gives off a cool, fresh vibe while the black and white details add the perfect contrast for a sleek finish.Comfort-wise, they're exactly what you'd expect from Jordans ‚Äî top-tier. The cushioning feels great for everyday wear or even on the days we spend too much time on our feet, and the support around the ankle gives me confidence in every step. You can tell the quality is there, from the stitching to the materials used.Whether you're a sneakerhead, a casual wearer, or just looking for a standout pair of kicks, these Jordans deliver. I‚Äôve gotten compliments every time I wear them. Stylish, comfortable, and built to last ‚Äî what more could you want?Highly recommend!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "When I purchased these red, black, and white Jordan 1s in 2024, they fulfilled every expectation I had.  The color scheme is striking yet still complements practically every ensemble, striking the ideal mix between traditional and contemporary design.  The stitching is excellent, and the leather feels high-end.They provide excellent ankle support and the ideal amount of cushioning, making them unexpectedly comfortable for all-day usage.  Every time I wear them out, I get compliments.  These Jordans are a no-brainer whether you're a sneakerhead or simply want a dependable pair of shoes that draw attention.Ten out of ten for comfort and style.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Shoes are comfortable very nice shoes to wear at the gym or just doing daily activities. review: {'review': 'Christmas gift for my daughter.  The Nike version is well made and comfortable.  She loves the pink.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Got them for myself in a womens size. Its been over a year and I still wear them. Just try not to get them too wet as the tip will start to wrinkle.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These are really nice and reasonably priced!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I wear these around my house as slippers because I have hardwood floors and I have RA and walking on the hardwood barefoot hurts my feet. These are super comfy, so soft, and cute (I got the black and hot pink ones). They fit true to size. Maybe a little snug but I like it that way because I don‚Äôt feel like they‚Äôre going to slide off my feet when I‚Äôm walking or if my feet get sweaty.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Amazing shoes. Unfortunately they have a very bad squeaking problem.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I run a lot. But these shoes are so tight that you won't be able to run in them. The sneaker has a fantastic appearance. These look good on you when worn with casual attire as walking shoes. However, if you plan to use it as a running shoe, order a size larger.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My husband loves these shoes. He wore them out till they had hardly any tread on them. He will definitely be wearing these again!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The first day I wore these, I went for a walk, and upon my walk was a nice big pile of dog doo doo. I was unaware of this big pile of doo-doo until it was too late. As I flew ybackward, I recall looking up at the sky, and to my surprise, I saw one of my brand new shoes flying by.  Next thing I knew I was lying there on the cold, hard sidewalk in such shock I layed there for what felt like forever. I slowly began to rise to my feet. I started to check myself for any injuries when suddenly I got a whiff of a nostril-burning foul smell. I reached my hand around to my back only to bring it right back abruptly.  I let out a loud scream followed by a gagging reaction to the dog poop that was now on my hand.  I ran to the grass and dropped to my knees I frantically began wiping my hand on the grass. As a tear ran down my face I remembered thinking can this day get any worse? Well, guess what it did! Behind me was a loud bark that scared me so much I jumped forward. I was now lying on the ground once more. As I got to my knees, I stood up quickly, eager to see the culprit that I believed to be the doggy doo doo bandit, but as I turned around to confront this demon, I promptly began to plead because in this dogs mouth was my other shoe I slowly began to approach this dog as I got close enough I made a daring move I tried to jump on the dog. I was unsuccessful with dog poop on my back, and with only one shoe on, I began to walk home sad and smelly.  Anyway I hope this helps your decision to buy these shoes or not', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes to be of good quality, comfortable, and well-fitting, with one customer noting their knees don't hurt while wearing them. They receive positive feedback for their appearance, with one customer describing them as the best design Nike ever made. However, durability is a significant concern, with reports of the side tearing out within the first month and the left shoe's air pocket breaking within 6 weeks. Moreover, customers report issues with the air bubble, noting that it deflates within a day and the right shoe goes flat after 2 weeks of use. The value for money receives mixed reviews, with some customers considering them a great buy while others find them terrible value.

product: Nike Men's Air Monarch IV Training/Workout
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-fitting, and good value for money. They receive positive feedback for their appearance and arch support, particularly noting they provide good support for side-to-side motion and walking and working out. The durability receives mixed reviews - while some say they hold up well, others report issues with the rubber separating from the sole. Customers also mention the shoes squeak badly and are very noisy.
review: {'review': 'These are often called "grandpa" shoes because they look a little clunky but they are still the best shoes I have found for exercise classes and basketball in that they are extremely stable through the last and I have not had an ankle turn since I started wearing them yeas ago. The bottoms of my feet are sensitive with minor neuropathy and these shoes fit wonderfully and wrap the foot well. The pivot point is great for people who take a cardio, Jazzercise, Shine, or equivalent class in that it facilitates turns, spins, and rapid direction changes.I do have to get a full size larger in Nike shoes (in all Nike clothes for that matter). After a couple of months of heavy use these Air shoes will start to squeak, often quite loudly, well before they wear out. I simply remove the lining  from the shoes and put baby or other talcum powder into the tiny holes under the lining and work it into the holes. This has served me well for years to stop the squeak and it has the additional benefit of freshening up my shoes.I have tried numerous shoe brands over the years and the only shoe that came close to the comfort and stability of this shoe is the Strutter from Adidas, which is no longer made to my knowledge and didn\'t last as long anyway.One thing Nike could do better is to more firmlyvsecure the sole to the body of the shoe. The glue used by Nike to secure the rubber part of the sole is the first part of the shoe to fail, especially if these shoes get wet regularly from rain or wet grass or even puddles when going to and from your car and the gym classes. I can normally get 6 to 8 months out of the shoes and I have at least 8 one hour classes of various intensity a week (and I do my best to keep the bottoms dry!).For those who wear orthotics, these shoes take them well whether they are heel focused, toe focused, or cover the whole foot. I now wear Goodfeet orthotics and they are quite comfortable in this shoe.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I recently picked up these amazing shoes for my 11-year-old, who is super picky about both style and comfort. I took a chance and chose them without his input‚Äîhe usually says no to everything! Imagine my excitement when he opened the box and exclaimed, ‚ÄúMom, I LOVE these!‚Äù He couldn‚Äôt stop raving about how comfy they are, and his favorite feature? They‚Äôre not just easy to slip on, but they also give him a little extra height with thick but soft soals! If you‚Äôre on the hunt for a pair that combines style, true to size, comfort, a boost in height, and lets not forget the colors are deep bright and excellent combination,these Nike shoes are an absolute must-have!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I bought the Nike Air Monarch shoes, and they are amazing! Very comfortable, supportive, and perfect for all-day wear. The fit is true to size, and the quality feels great. Definitely recommend for walking, gym, or everyday use!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This model shoe has been around for a long time. Years ago, when the sale price went up to the regular price (33% price increase), I stopped buying them. With the temporary 25% discount, its a good value.They are substantial, have a good tread, and offer cushioning while walking. Years ago, the bright white was the style. Now it stands out. And the black is not discreet either. Wish they offered a medium gray version.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "People of a certain age aren't looking to keep up with fashion, we need comfort!Why not have both?These shoes are perfect for the savvy everyman, comfortable, stylish (for us), and the price is a bargain.Thick tongue, as durable as any Nike shoe, easy to keep clean for the weekends.Perfect product!Have a great day!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Super stylish and comfortable shoes, my son loves it!True to size, great quality of the product. Highly recommend!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'If your feet are average size consider wide shoes. These are awesome shoes.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice looking shoe..your toes do not hit the end like on some new balance tennis shoes because the new balance toes tapper off like a cowboy boot...But shoe squeeks.. not going to slip up on anybody in these...noise seems to be going away and not bothersome.....', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': 'I ordered the Nike Metcon 6 Free about a week ago, and I‚Äôve been pleasantly surprised with the performance right from the start. The shoes are extremely comfortable, offering a secure yet flexible fit that adapts well during both lifting and conditioning workouts. What stood out the most is how easy they were to break in‚Äîpractically no adjustment period was needed. Within the first couple of sessions, they already felt like a natural extension of my training routine.The breathability is another strong point; the mesh upper keeps my feet cool even during long, high-intensity workouts. The stability in the heel gives confidence under heavier lifts, while the forefoot remains flexible enough for sprints, jumps, and dynamic movements. It‚Äôs a rare balance of support and comfort that makes the Metcon 6 Free versatile for both strength and functional training.Overall, this shoe delivers on all fronts: comfort, stability, and ease of use. If you want a training shoe that won‚Äôt slow you down with a long break-in period, the Metcon 6 Free is a solid choice.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Lightweight and very comfortable. Fit is great.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "This version of the Free Metcon (Version 6) is by far the best all-purpose workout shoe that I've ever used. I really put my workout sneakers through the ringer; using them 7-days a week for weight training and cardio (3.5 miles/day of incline treadmill). Aside from comfort, being lightweight, and accommodating wider feet (unlike version 5 of the same sneaker), what really stands out about these is their versatility. I've never had a workout sneaker (metcon, running sneaker, powerlifting shoe) that has provided ample stability to perform barbell squats while also being comfortable, flexible, and lightweight enough to do an hour of cardio in. I wish that they lasted me slightly longer than 5 months, but considering what I put them through, these are great value for the money. I've purchased 5 total pairs of these and would recommend to anyone for almost any application.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "The Nike Metcon 6 is an excellent all around athletic, workout shoe because it provides good cushioning, stability, breathability and flexibility. Before purchasing these shoes for my Gold'sFit workout class, I used running shoes, but running shoes did not provide enough lateral support and stability during lifts and doing side to side movement. The Nike Metcon 6 feel much more stabile and confidently perform through a variety of activities. When I started looking at other people's shoes in the gym, I was surprised how many also also chose the Nike Metcon.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Light weight, comfortable and very stylish.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Really good shows for CrossFit', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Box came damaged  but product was good overall. review: {'review': "These shoes look sharp and are accurate to the pictures supplied in the description.  I found the quality seems like they'll last a long time.  I'm comparing them to other Asics and New Balance brands I've had in the past couple of years, and these are built different.  I appreciate the loops on the shoes to allow you to put them on with ease.I found them to be a little stiff at first. They definitely need a breaking in period.  But after a few workouts at the gym and a few miles walking on pavement, they've broken in nicely and are much more comfortable.  They're fast becoming one of my favorite pairs of shoes.I wear a size 13 mens, and the shoe is spot on for fit.  I also have a higher instep, and these shoes fit quite well.  For support, I find them average but not bad.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are very light and comfortable with plenty of support.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excellent product, my husband loved them because they feel comfortable when walking, jogging, running or doing any type of exercise, I recommend them for their quality and price 10/10', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Fits very well, is well-designed, and comfortable.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I started using these shoes on June 11, 2019.  At the time of this writing, that\'s almost 6 weeks. I\'d suggest when you are reading these reviews you keep in mind how long the reviewer has been trying out the shoes; it can take several weeks to fully get used to a new shoe and reviewers who give hasty reviews (either good or bad) are not giving you the real picture.____________________In a nutshell, I got these shoes so I didn\'t have to spend a bunch of money on running shoes AND gym shoes. Nor clutter up my closet with too many pairs of shoes.  After using them for over a month, I am surprisingly satisfied.First off....I\'m 6 foot and 175 lbs. My shoe size varies between 10.5 and 11 USA. My foot is slightly wide, with good arches.  I got these shoes in a size 11 and they fit great.  But not at first.....for the first 4-5 wearings they felt tight around the middle of my foot. At first I was disappointed and felt like they were not going to be a good fit. But after about a week of wearing them, they broke in just fine, and the fit now is great. I attribute the tight feeling to the plastic side braces that the shoestrings lace through: if you lace them overly tight, that will contribute to the uncomfortable feeling.My experience:  I have been running at least 3X a week for over 40 years. I\'ve weightlifted and/or cross trained on a regular basis for over 30 years. I have been a personal trainer in the past (certified by ACE). I\'ve run one of the toughest marathons in the world (Big Sur International Marathon), although I consider myself an average runner. I\'ve used everything from cheap $40.00 Big 5 shoes for running to $130.00 Brooks. I\'ve never bought a pair of shoes specifically for weight training or cross-fit workouts; I\'ve always used running shoes for that.Here\'s how I wear them:- running 1-2 times a week. My average run is around 2.5 miles, but I\'ve run up to 6 miles in them and they performed well. I would not recommend wearing these for regular runs longer than 3 miles because that\'s not what they are built for. I run mostly on pavement in California (moderate weather), although I just did a 6 mile run on trails in preparation for a 10K race later this month.  I feel like that was pushing the shoe to its limit, but it did fine.- stationary biking.- weight workouts. I do squats, standing barbell curls and overhead presses and these shoes are stable and don\'t shift. Of course you need to adjust the tightness of the laces depending on what you\'re doing and that\'s the cool thing about these - you can loosen them up a bit for non-critical exercises like stationary biking or tighten them up for running or squats.- kettle bell swings: again, they are stable and flexible.- burpees: this particular exercise really tests the stability, flexibility and shock-absorption of the shoe. If you\'ve never done a burpee, I suggest Googling it to see what the movements are. In this exercise the shoe is subjected to squats, kick-outs where I land on the toes as I do a push-up, then they flex as I bring my feet back under me and jump up into the air, forcing them to not only be stable in launching me up but in absorbing my return to earth.I work out in these shoes 6 days a week.  The photo shows them as of today, nearly 6 weeks into daily use.  I typically run a couple days a week, do burpees 2x a week, weight lift 2-3 times a week, kettle bell swing 2x a week and do moderate cardio such as stationary bike 1-2 times a week.I didn\'t buy these to replace running shoes; I got them to use as short-distance runners and gym shoes. You shouldn\'t get these if you are doing multiple runs of more than 3 miles in a week - they aren\'t going to give the performance and protection you need for serious running. But for gym work, cross fit training and shorter runs, they are great and can replace expensive running shoes.You should note that the plastic shoe lace-ups/brackets on the side of the shoe have 3 positions. The position closest to your toes is the least secure/loosest fitting style. Each hole you lace going back towards your heel tightens the shoe\'s grip on your foot.  I use the middle lace hole for running and burpees and the stability is fine.  I lace it all the way to the back hole for squats to make sure the shoe doesn\'t slip.I\'ve noted some reviewers say the "sock" collar around the ankle opening is loose.  I can say yes, it doesn\'t fit flush to your ankle when laced up, but that doesn\'t mean it slips! My foot is stable even if the sock appears to be loose-fitting. It isn\'t overly warm or hot, either (I was worried about that when I first got them).Again, if you\'re a serious runner I\'d invest in good running shoes and use these for the gym. But if you\'re a casual runner of shorter distances and fit in weight training and/or cross-fit training, these shoes do a great job.I\'ll close by saying that in the last 20 years or so I\'ve gotten wiser and have spent more money on running shoes, and with these shoes I\'ve gotten my first shoe specially designed for cross-training also. I am happy with the performance of the shoes so far. I\'ve never had a serious running injury, partially out of luck but largely because as my joints have gotten older I\'ve used better shoes.  Good luck and good health to you!', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': '', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I was shopping for training shoes I could wear at the gym. These looked so stylish I kept thinking about them. They are wonderfully comfortable. The way the shoe is designed, it wears more like a sock. There is no traditional tongue. They feel almost like I‚Äôm going barefoot, which I find delightful. These Nikes work great for training and they look cool too.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I think it was a great product just for me. They were not very comfortable, but it‚Äôs a good product', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these trail running shoes to be of high quality, with exceptional shock absorbing heel cushioning and a great fit. review: {'review': 'Great cushion, excellent traction, the shell and sole will last. I ordered a size 10, my usual size it fits well. I would buy again!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are absolutely wonderful!! I got these for my boyfriend as a surprise gift because he had the same pair that he works in maintenance and needs waterproof shoes as a must!!! he says that they are extremely comfortable and he is on his feet for 10 hours a day‚Ä¶ highly recommend these they‚Äôre super comfortable, very easy to clean, very easy to wash in the washing machine, and they look great on him!! I‚Äôm just now writing a review six months later after purchasing them and they are still looking brand new! And he works in them every single day!!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'They feel great on the feet. Like walking on a cloud. They don‚Äôt look goofy like hokas do. They are a good fit so ordering you size should be fine', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very nice shoe. Well built & appears durable. I especially loved the soft ankle.With high arch/high instep and wide forefoot, these shoes were not a good fit for me. Despite being men\'s running shoes, they felt like a women\'s B width. There is zero give the way they are stitched making them super tight across the forefoot at the base where lacing begins, and I mean cutting off circulation tight!It\'s clear to me that these shoes are made for heelstrikers with narrow feet:1) Exceptional shock absorbing heel cushioning that gives rather than squishes;2) Very little forefoot cushioning but provides good toe-off springboard action.What I found peculiar is that Nike did away with the 3rd gas tube running front to back with this model. No middle tube made my feet feel like they were being forced down midfoot‚Äîsomething that has actually resulted in stress fractures in the past‚Äîbecause I AM a supinator (underpronation, which means my natural gait strikes along the outside of my feet).They felt "corrective" so I would NOT recommend these to supinators, those with high arches and/or high instep, and definitely not to wide footers or wide forefooters, or forefoot strikers. Shin splints (along with other painful maladies) WILL occur‚Äîguaranteed!About me:  I was an avid fitness enthusiast years before I ever set foot in a commercial gym‚Äîand that was 35 years ago. Since then, I went on to become a personal trainer, taught aerobics for 20+ years, and have worked in numerous gyms‚Äîtwo of which I managed for some time.And for most of that time, I\'ve been a Nike snob. However, their latest "improvements" on new models and elimination of older ones convey a simple message:  It\'s time to pack up my toys and move on. My groundpounders deserve compatible playmates.4 stars because I believe this to be a Nike typical, high-quality shoe. No 5th star because there is no mention or caution on the incredibly narrow width in a men\'s shoe, or the zero give with this new stitching, nor is there any information on the type of runner this shoe would‚Äîor would not benefit.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'No fue el Color que seleccione, talla muy ajustado pero tiene una suave marcha', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Bad size', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I‚Äôve put a little over forty Florida-summer miles on the Nike Pegasus Trail 5 GORE-TEX, most of them in sideways rain, and they‚Äôve already earned a reserved spot by the door. The Invisible Fit membrane keeps water out without giving that plastic-bag feel‚Äîmy socks stay dry, and the shoe flexes like a regular trainer instead of a clunky winter boot.Underfoot, Nike‚Äôs new ReactX midsole brings road-shoe energy to mud, roots, and crushed-shell paths. I finish runs feeling bouncier than I have any right to on swampy routes. The outsole lugs and sticky rubber grab wet boardwalks and slick limestone with zero drama, so I‚Äôm not tip-toeing every time a puddle shows up.Little design touches seal the deal: an extended ankle collar that blocks sand and pine needles, a 3-D toe cap that shrugs off rocks, and a black/grey colorway that looks totally normal at the brewery post-run. The only trade-offs are the premium price‚Äîabout $180‚Äîand slightly warmer feet on steamy days. Thin socks solve the latter; the waterproof peace of mind justifies the former.Bottom line: If you want one shoe that handles ankle-deep puddles yet still feels lively on dry pavement, the Pegasus Trail 5 GTX delivers. Consider me converted.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'buen producto, empeine bajo, si buscas una zapatilla con empeine ancho, no te recomiendo', 'rating': '2.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: Nike Men's Reax 8 TR Cross Training
customer_say: Customers find these shoes comfortable, terrific-looking, and well-fitting. However, the quality receives mixed feedback, with some saying they're great while others find them not up to Nike standards. Moreover, durability is a concern as the top lace holders break and they start creaking after less than six weeks of use. Additionally, customers disagree on whether the size matches the description, and opinions on value are divided between those who find them good for the price and those who consider them terrible shoes.
review: {'review': 'This shoe is very comofrtable - very supportive - very durable - very stylish - and very cheap (for Nike)! You will not regret buying this shoe for just about any physical activity.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Fit a little small but comfortable alot of support. Well worth the money.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': '', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I purchased a pair after trying them on locally first. They are true to Nike size, comfortable and the built-in tongue is a plus for keeping it centered. But be cautious!!! After wearing them for 2 weeks, I'd estimate 6 miles of walking, they being to squeak. Not just a random squeak but a every time you take a step it bellows a eery squeak like the front door of a haunted house. Wildlife creatures are running for their lives when I attempt to walk my local natural trail. Hunters are angry that I scared off the 8 point buck from a mile away that they've been staying all season. I seriously can't hide at work. They know exactly where I am and when I'm walking down the halls. I'm 5' 10'', 185. It's not like I'm hurting the shoes but they are screaming for help with every step! I know, I know. It's just a inexpensive pair of shoes that some hard working child in Indonesia put blood and sweat into producing.  I really do appreciate every tear that they shed to glue them together, but they missed a spot. The most important spot. The spot that keep the shoe from squeaking. So to everyone that's has to hear me walk in them in the local Walmart and Target, I'm sorry! I wearing them for your enjoyment (with earbuds in my ears) so you can have a laugh for the day. One little star. You're welcome...", 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Ordered 11 and shoe is not for wide feet....light comfortable and well built', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excelente compra', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "The most comfortable sneaker I've ever owned ,but they squeak when I walk so I may have to order another pair or give up on them", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Muy bien calidad y son tal cual se muestran', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these sneakers well-made, comfortable, and great for running, with one customer noting they're particularly suitable for city sidewalk use. The shoes receive positive feedback for their fit, style, and value for money. Regarding durability, while some customers find them awesome, others report issues with the sole falling off after 8 months of use. The color receives mixed reactions, with some loving the color while others note the shoes aren't actually red as advertised.
review: {'review': 'I love these!! My son is 12 and finally hit ‚Äúman‚Äù size sneakers. The comfort difference is significant because he absolutely doesn‚Äôt stop talking about the support and bounce these have. They look fantastic and the colors are even better in person. The value for the money goes beyond what I paid for these. They are lightweight and they feel durable while looking nice. He‚Äôs just getting out of a boys 7 so these fit a little bit big but it‚Äôll work for his Fall growth spurt he has every year. He loves to make random stops to show how fast he can stop so great traction for running.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Comfortable shoes!  Nice fit!  Very durable.  I like these shoes!!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This Nike Pegasus 39 is a perfect pair of running shoes for people who value money, quality shoe material, etc. I find it really light and soft to wear. I like that it has an all-black option‚Äîclassy looking and stylish for all types of clothing.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'It was a pleasant experience running with this shoe! I got about 260 miles of running out of it  before having to purchase new ones as my ankles were flaring up. I did use these for work outside as well, but my job had minimal walking, but I think it may have worn the shoes down a bit! Will continue using for my job and have a new shoe dedicated only to running. Going to be a year since I have had purchased these', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Shoes are great, love the color, shipping was slow though.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "To me, this is the one of the nicest looking running shoes out there right now. White is a great shoe color and most running shoes look ugly in my opinion.I was concerned coming into this with how dirty it would look due to dirt, but it's actually very manageable. Simply throw it in the washing machine with some Oxyclean, air dry, and it looks nearly brand new. If excessively soiled, soak in Oxyclean overnight and then wash.The fit is true to size but slightly snug as you break it in. The entire front of the shoe is like a soft mesh so it's very comfortable, but that also means if you kick anything it'll hurt, trust me. The cushion is pretty good- an upgrade over non running shoes but not excessive like Hoka's. I can walk for about one and a half hours before my feet actually start hurting.Overall, would recommend. Definitely is kinda pricey but it's hard to find good looking running shoes so it's an L I was willing to take.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Fit perfectly', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I do mid distance events and can't go more than a 3 mile run in these shoes without my feet hurting and feeling like caluses are forming. I will only buy the Pegasus 40 from now on. It's More comfort,fits better and is still lightweight", 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, lightweight, and great for walking and running, with good value for the price. They appreciate the fit, style, and build quality, with one customer noting they get better with use. Shoes fit to size, great stability (at a cost below) have great toe box up front for those with big toes.  Great support on sides of feet, and using my orthotics give wonderful run support needed for dummies like me who jumped off things alot when young and feet are flat.  Within 4 miles these shoes felt really good on the treads.  Good weight room support and strong support on 1k rows.  My last shoes started really giving out on the rower, noticed that first.  But these feel really well formed and allow lots of power push on rower.  Only thing I do not like....  The same plastic bands that give such good side foot support is exceptionally painful on lateral lunges.... like being stuck with a stick...  Hopefully the plastic will flex better as it breaks in, as we all know OTF feels about lunges is like Rick Astley... review: {'review': 'I bought a pair of these shoes from a local store back in 2018 and loved how they fit my foot like a glove and felt so light on my feet for any kind of activity.  I went back to the same store a couple of years later to buy them again but they did not carry the same model.  I was very happy to find them on Amazon in many more beautiful colors than the two colors my initial pair were available in.  I had bought my first pair for $60 and feel that spending $100+ is rather expensive but it is also difficult to find running shoes that feel so good and I loved the bright color so I bought 3 more pairs to hopefully keep me in running shoes for the next several years.  My first pair has held up very well for me and have been washed several times so I feel good about the overall quality of the shoes.I have low arches and have had double bunion surgery many years ago so I usually exchange the insoles that come in shoes for insoles with an arch.  I did not need to do this for about three years with my first pair but lately began having some toe pain so I simply added added a gel arch under the regular insole and that easily solved the problem.I generally wear a 5 or 5.5 but a 6 fits me perfectly.  I also have narrow heels and these shoes gently hug my feel all around, giving a solid feeling of stability and lightness.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I love them. They are a little bit big. I like everything about them. review: {'review': "These shoes arrived on time and in perfect condition. They are a fabulous fit at size 8 and I use them daily at the gym. I am a lifelong NIKE customer and this quality is on point with the Nike brand. Very good heel cushion as I have some slight heel pain to deal with. Four stars for the design of the shoe laces. I have thin ankles and the shoe slips unless you thread the shoelaces through the second loophole at the top of the shoe lace row. I realize it is a 'me' problem and not a shoe problem - but thought it would be helpful to share how I solved this problem to make the shoe work for me. Also, the shoe is lightweight and cool - the bottoms are light colored. If you live in a very hot climate (like VEGAS) the asphalt is very very hot. If you wear a dark sole shoe it absorbs the heat and makes your feet so very hot. I would recommend wearing a thinner sock with this shoe if you are a runner/walker. It seems to enhance the comfort. Excellent shoe for the gym and very stylish!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'True to size and very comfortable. I wear a 10.5; ordered this size and they fit very well. I have walked around in them for hours at a time and they did not cause any pain or discomfort. Very good support and because the bottom of the shoe is thick, this added a layer of comfort as well, which helps a lot when I use it to exercise walking. I originally wanted a black, but this color has grown on me, as it really does go with a variety of outfits. The style is nice and so far, I am getting value for money.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'They were comfortable from the moment I put them on.  Fits my size 8 foot perfectly. Would buy again.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Received these shoes in a box that stated "this item has been repackaged in recyclable, frustration free packaging because the original box was damaged in transit." review: {'review': 'I absolutely love these sneakers! They‚Äôre super comfortable right out of the box and fit true to size. Matches description and fast shipping.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This sneaker fit true to size, very comfortable, lightweight, no smell', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I am very happy with this purchase. I intend to keep the shoes & use them for the gym and PT. I am unsure If I will use them on the court for Pickleball however, or other sports however.  They seem more aesthetic than sports effective.  There is not much arch support. They are the same caliber as the Cole Haan  tennis shoes which are actually good & much better than Dooney & Burke which are definitely aesthetically designed.  The leather on the Nike is EXCELLENT.  Much better than the brands I just mentioned.  I could tell by the way they buckled  to conform to the crease of my foot on the first wear without breaking. They will definitely hold up a lot longer than most brands I have had. I am happy with the fit & was able to adjust the laces to fit the extra width of my feet satisfactorily which is not always the case.  Some brands cut the width short @ the base & before letting the shoe widen out to save $.  Nike did not do this & I was very happy with being able to adjust the fit.  The heel padding is EXCELLENT ALSO. This shoe fit durability, quality, sizing, fit, heel padding, leather quality, ease of cleaning, true to description & aesthetically pleasing! The only reason I did not give it a 5 is that These qualities were all so good that the arch support did not compare to their definite 5 rating.  So what could have been an overall 5 shoe in every category got uncharacteristically, almost unfairly downgraded to a 4 because of one  category‚Ä¶. Arch support.  If all shoes could say that they would be 5‚Äôs. I guess this is a rather critical review if all the categories are 5 except one.  I hope this is helpful.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The shoes are gorgeous, exactly what I was looking for! product: PUMA Men's 8 Pack Low Cut Socks
customer_say: Customers find these running socks to be of good quality, comfortable, and well-fitting, sitting just above the ankle bone. They offer decent value for money and provide good cushioning without being bulky. The durability receives mixed feedback - while some say they hold up well over time, others report they don't last long. The thickness and sizing also get mixed reviews, with some finding them thicker than expected while others describe them as super thin, and some noting they run small.
