product: PUMA Men's Attacanto Indoor Trainer Soccer
customer_say: Customers find these soccer shoes to be of great quality, with beautiful colors and good grip. They are comfortable and worth the $25 price tag. The fit and sizing receive mixed feedback - while some say they fit great, others find them too tight. The durability is also mixed, with customers noting they are not flimsy, though one customer reports issues with the sole separating from the upper.
review: {'review': "The material of the boot itself is thin in a good way. It feels one with my foot since it's a snug fit. The sole is thin so you feel close to the ground, but absolutely not flimsy. It's a full rubber sole and plenty grippy and flexible.They do run small and narrow, but I prefer tight and snug for soccer cleats because I make better and more reliable/predictable contact with the ball, and my feet stay planted and don't move within the shoe.Running shoes I size like regular shoes but lace them tight and snug. Soccer cleats I size them small and tight so that the boot/shoe itself is snug and not forced by laces which is difficult to tighten and also makes for pressure points...snug cleats don't cause pressure points and are easily snug without relying so much on laces, for me. These are great and well worth the $25!!I wear a 12 in Mizuno andSaucony running shoes, and 12 in these Pumas feels pretty damn tight on me on width and length. 12.5 may be better and I could probably wear them all day, but it'd still be unusually snug on the width...but that'd be good for soccer. The 12s on me I wore for 4 hours and my feet weren't hurting at all, but when I took them off, I enjoyed the feeling of them being off. My toes are pretty much at the very end of the toe box on these 12s, yet I have a comfortable gap on my running shoes. I'm keeping the 12s because they're so smug and great. I'll probably buy longer laces so I can loosen them more easily without difficult tying.I'm not regretting my purchase at all, just sharing my experience.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great shoes.  A little bit of a tight fit though.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Shorter and way more narrow than expected. Typically I wear a 9.5 but these seemed like I needed 10.5 and the ey were so narrow it felt like I was walking on the out side of the shoe. Nice design good quality. Just too small', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Good feeling, adequate to my feet', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I have been a loyal fan of Puma sneakers for years, appreciating their consistent fit and comfort across various styles. However, my recent experience with a new pair in men's size 10.5, a size I've comfortably worn in other Puma styles, left me notably disappointed. These sneakers felt unusually tight and seemed to be undersized, a stark contrast to the reliable sizing I've come to expect from the brand.Initially, I held onto the hope that the shoes would stretch and conform to my feet after a period of breaking in. This optimism led me to keep the sneakers past the point of return. Regrettably, they did not improve in fit as I had hoped, which ultimately rendered them unwearable for me. Acknowledging my misjudgment in not returning them immediately, I've decided to donate the shoes to Goodwill.This experience serves as a reminder of the variability that can occur in manufacturing and the importance of addressing fit issues promptly. While this has been a setback in my history with Puma, it also highlights the need for careful consideration when trying new styles, even from brands we know and trust.", 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'For the price, they look and feel good and are light weight.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Good deal', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Looks to be good quality, but they are a bit tight - if you have a wide foot, these are not going to feel comfortable at all', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': 'I recently wore the PUMA Caven 2.0 Men‚Äôs Sneakers for several weeks to test their comfort, fit, and style. Here‚Äôs my honest experience:Clean, classic designThe Caven 2.0 features a sleek, retro-inspired silhouette that pairs easily with jeans, joggers, or casual shorts. The minimalist style works for both casual outings and everyday wear.Comfortable cushioningThe padded insole and soft lining provide excellent comfort for all-day use. customer_say: Customers find these shoes comfortable, with one noting the thick insoles, and appreciate their quality, with one highlighting the quality knitting on the leather. They are stylish and come in a beautiful brown color, with positive feedback about the cushioning, and one customer mentions the rubber outsole offers good traction. The fit and sizing receive mixed reviews - while some find them true to size, others say they run tight and are narrow. The material quality also gets mixed feedback, with some confirming they're made of real leather while others note they're made of manmade materials.
review: {'review': "I recently purchased the PUMA Club II Era sneakers, and they've quickly become my go-to pair for daily wear. The combination of leather and suede in the upper gives them a sleek, retro-inspired look that pairs well with various outfits. The SoftFoam+ sockliner provides excellent cushioning, making them comfortable for extended periods of walking or standing.The fit is true to size, but if you have wider feet, you might consider going half a size up, as they have a slightly narrow profile. The rubber outsole offers good traction, and the overall construction feels durable and well-made.Overall, these sneakers strike a perfect balance between style and comfort. Whether you're dressing up or keeping it casual, the PUMA Club II Era is a versatile choice that doesn't disappoint.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My husband loves these shoes! They do not have arch supports, so he had to put arch cookies in the shoes. Fit is true to size. Quality is spot on. Value for the money is just right. product: PUMA Men's Ignite Elevate Wide Golf
customer_say: Customers find these golf shoes comfortable, great-looking, and appreciate their excellent grip on the course. They consider them good value for money. The size receives mixed feedback, with some finding them a good fit while others say they run small, and the cushioning and durability also get mixed reviews.
review: {'review': "Seriously this is the rainiest beginning of summer that I've seen in NCPA in years and these shoes have kept my feet dry, comfortable and glued to the ground during this 40 days and 40 nights of rain. I ordered the wide and was a bit concerned when I first tried them on because they do run narrow but after wearing them for 14 rounds, mainly walking, I can honestly say these shoes rock. And they clean up very easily with a damp sponge and still look like new.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice shoes but run very small size up and go wider they run narrow', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I bought the size 13W according to the Amazon recommendation. I normally wear size 12 dress shoes and 12.5 running shoes in wide.  The length is just right. I have Hawaiian "luau feet" and always need wide shoes with room in the toe box. The width on these Pumas are fine in the mid foot, but a bit narrow in the toe box where I need it most. It\'s not so bad that I can\'t wear them. The feel of the shoe is soft and comfortable and I was able to walk 18 holes without real discomfort. The grip is far better than the running shoes I have been wearing. Overall, it\'s a good shoe.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These shoes feel great. These shoes made me shoot under 90! Nah i'm kidding, BUT they do feel and look great. The price isn't too bad, and the traction on the grass is great as well. Awesome shoes", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Can't say enough good things about this shoe.  I wear a wide size (which these come in) and they are the most comfortable golf shoe I own.  I use a push cart, so they get a workout.  Also the most waterproof shoe I've owned, other brands being Nike, Skechers, and Footjoy.  Bottoms usually clean off easily with a stiff brush (even the goose poop). These shoes have quickly become my favorite pair for everyday wear and light workouts.Firstly, the design is sleek and modern. The Pacer Future sneakers have a streamlined silhouette that looks great with both athletic wear and casual outfits. The combination of mesh and synthetic overlays provides a lightweight feel while ensuring durability and support.Comfort is another standout feature of these shoes. The soft foam midsole offers excellent cushioning, making every step feel comfortable and springy. Whether I‚Äôm walking around town or spending time at the gym, my feet feel supported and well-cushioned.The sneakers also offer good breathability, which helps keep my feet cool and dry, even during longer wear periods. This is particularly important for active days or warmer weather.Additionally, I appreciate the affordability of the PUMA Pacer Future sneakers. They provide excellent value for money without compromising on quality or style.Overall, I am highly satisfied with the PUMA Men‚Äôs Pacer Future sneakers. product: PUMA Men's Softride Enzo 5 Cross Training
customer_say: Customers find these cross trainers comfortable, with one noting their feet don't hurt 24/7, and appreciate their build quality, value for money, and perfect fit. They receive positive feedback for their style and durability, with one customer mentioning they're great for walking and running. The slip-on feature and sturdiness receive mixed reviews, with some finding them strong while others report eyelets breaking after a month of use.
review: {'review': 'As someone who\'s already bought and loved a pair of these, I can confidently say the PUMA Men\'s Softride Enzo 5 Cross Training shoes are a fantastic investment, so much so that this is my second pair. I\'ve found them to be an excellent all-around shoe that provides comfort, style, and solid performance without a hefty price tag.\u200bThe "Softride" foam is the real star of the show here. The cushioning is incredibly comfortable right out of the box and provides a plush, responsive feel whether I\'m walking, doing light jogging, or working out. It\'s a noticeable upgrade from many other shoes in this price range. The support and stability are also great for cross-training. The TPU cage gives you a locked-down feel, and the zoned rubber outsole provides reliable traction on a variety of surfaces, from gym floors to pavement.\u200bBeyond the performance, they simply look great. The sleek design and clean lines make them versatile enough to wear not just for the gym but also for casual everyday use. The fact that PUMA uses at least 30% recycled materials in the upper is a nice bonus and something I appreciate as a consumer.\u200bThe long-lasting comfort is why I keep coming back to this model. My first pair held up incredibly well to daily use, and I expect the same from this one. If you\'re looking for a shoe that\'s comfortable for all-day wear, performs well during a workout, and doesn\'t break the bank, the PUMA Softride Enzo 5 is a perfect choice. Highly recommended.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I tried on a lot of sneakers brand names, but this sneaker is above all of them today is the first day. I‚Äôm wearing it ,it‚Äôs made great looks strong . Try it you will like it.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Puma shoe are comfortable and worth the price I got them for.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The shoe is very comfortable for both walking, exercising, and hitting golf balls. However, I encountered an issue: while lacing up my shoes, I heard a snap and the top eyelet (lace hole) broke as I was tying them.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Really happy with this purchase! The pair of Pumas arrived right on time and were in excellent condition‚Äîjust as described. They looked even better in person and fit perfectly. Great value and quality for the price. Overall, a smooth and positive experience‚Äîwould definitely order again. Thanks!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I recently bought a pair of Hokas for $120... they were okay. Today I bought this pair of Pumas for $55 I find them more comfortable for my feet to wear all day at work.  I wish I could return the Hokas but it's too late, oh well!!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Have only worn these for a couple of weeks and the piece of plastic that has the holes for the shoe laces already snapped near the base. customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and well-fitting, with one mentioning they provide a perfect blend of comfort and energy return. The shoes offer good traction, with one customer noting they're great for tempo runs, and customers appreciate the cushioning and grip.
review: {'review': "I already have a few pairs of great running shoes in my rotation. Though these are not one of the big brand names, the reviews on these were amazing. Got me curious to try them because I  will always add another great pair that fits well , seeing I have a hard time finding good and comfortable shoes that don't rub on my one bad little toe. I usually kow within a few steps if they are going to work or not. These by far are the most comfortable and great feeling and riding shoe that I own. Amazing to run in and they are more comfortable than any running shoe I have ever owned. If I had to pick just one shoe this would be the one. Great lockdown and unbelievable ride and no overlays over the toes to press or rub. All the reviews I watched and read on these shoes are spot on. Maybe not the best looking ones out there but I'd buy them again in a heartbeat. They beat out my Saucony triumph 20, my Ascis novablast 3 and my New Balance 880 v12 which are all phenomenal in my opinion. Guess I got a lot of running to do!...lol", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great everyday trainer!  Light, grippy and the right amount of cushion.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These shoes are the perfect blend of comfort amd energy return. I felt a HUGE difference running downhill with these shoes, compared with more expensive options. If I ever need shoes that do it all - easy runs, tempo runs and everything in between - these would be the shoes hands down!!!I've recommended these shoes to 2 friends of mine and they came back with the same response - best shoes they've ever bought!!! Great value!!!!!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great all around runner. Good fit.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice cushion yet has some pop for shorter runs. Didn‚Äôt feel great walking around on first wear but really came into its own within first five miles. Typical use is in the 8 -15 mile range. Great grip. True to size.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Since I'm too lazy to run, I walk daily (6-7 times a week) about 2.5 miles. During the past few years I've worn out Nikes and in recent months tried out couple pair of Adidas and Pumas and a pair of Under Armour but none were good for one reason or another. After some research, excluding Nike that I no longer care to patronize, I ordered this pair of Pumas and a pair of Adidas.  Both had very good reviews by credible sources. After trying on both I went with these and have worn while walking the past couple weeks. They've been very comfortable and supportive and appear to be wearing very well even with the daily 2.5 miles on pavement. Actually I've noticed some discomfort on a few walks but believe it was due to lacing a little too tightly. Bottom line, I've pleased enough and think with continued wear these shoes and my feet will acclimate. I'd go 4-to-5 star if possible but rounding up optimistically.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These are great for Tempo Runs, Fartleks, and short sprints.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great fit, nice midsole with awesome bounce yet stable ride. review: {'review': "I have five pair of these shoes in different colors and they are, for me, the perfect shoe. They are comfortable for walking, standing, and give all day comfort. I am 5'10 175 lbs and wear a 10 medium. They fit true to size for me. I've worn them for about twelve hours on some days and never had a thought about them. They give great feedback while driving. I have a Porsche six speed and these are great driving shoes. I find the sole to have the perfect balance between to much and not enough cushion. Usually you get one or the other, but these shoes give both. I don't find them to slip on any surface but that's not to say they don't, I just haven't found that surface. I have been wearing them for about six months.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My 80yr old Dad prefers this style of Puma shoes. He says they help his feet feel better (he has nerve pain). I believe they help with compression without being too tight. This is his second pair. Length sizes run normally, although they are more narrow than most sneakers.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Honestly, the shoe looks great on my screen, but when it arrived, The Color appears more like a burgundy or deep red, not what I expected visually.  The Red is more toned down than I expected - it could stand to be a few shades lighter IMHO - I have multiple Puma shoes with Red, and this is definitely darker in appearance than the others;  I'm not sure that I'm going to keep them - I'm on the fence with this color.  Decisions, Decisions, I dunno?? - The jury is still out. :)", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Gr8t shoe , very comfortable', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Perfect fit and super cute', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'If I could give this product zero stars I would. Too bad it is past the time when I could return them.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Since no one thinks to use leather any longer on sneakers (I guess the shoes will last to long and be comfortable.) the man made materials used are subpar compaired to what they used to be back when Levis were saying "Quality never goes out style.". I will definitely buy them again. I will say that I‚Äôm used to wearing cowboy boots and had to stop wearing them all the time due to medical reasons. But I am used to leather and leather-like items. But if you are not, these might feel warm if you wear them on a hot day. They have some airflow but they definitely aren‚Äôt like a running shoe for air flow. Cowboy boots allow no air flow so I‚Äôm used to it and I don‚Äôt have a complaint about it. They also have a strong leather smell when they are new, which is not my favorite smell but I‚Äôm used to it with cowboy boots again. But if you don‚Äôt like the smell of leather it might be overpowering at first. Overall nice shoes that are comfortable and look nice that I wear everywhere I go now. They fit well and don‚Äôt seem to untie themselves constantly like some shoes seem to. I wear them in wet grass all the time and they are waterproof in short grass. They have breathing holes across the top so if you step in a puddle that is over your shoe it will likely fill from the top and then you would have to take it off and actually dump it. Overall, great shoes.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'For the Price Point, I am 100% Satisfied with the gym shoes. I love the white, black, and red color combination. They look great with both athletic and casual outfits.User experience:Very positive. They‚Äôre comfortable, durable, and stay in great shape even with frequent use.Value for the price:Definitely worth the price. Quality brand with reliable performance.Would I recommend them?Absolutely. Great choice for both everyday wear and training.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: PUMA Mens Redon Bungee Slip On Casual - White
customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, lightweight, and easy to slip on, with one customer noting they're excellent for golf. The style receives positive feedback, and customers like the fit, with one mentioning they're not too narrow. The laces receive mixed reviews - while one customer appreciates the bungee cord design, others note that the elastic straps are not adjustable.
review: {'review': 'I just received these Puma Redon Bungee shoes today and they\'re exactly what I was looking for.Let me begin by debunking a few of the misconceptions about this shoe you\'ll find in other reviews here.  Apparently more than a few people did NOT realize what they were buying.  I saw complaints about the thin midsoles being uncomfortable to walk in all day.  Umm yeah, they weren\'t designed for walking.  And someone was complaining about the lack of arch support.  Once again, that is intentional.  This wasn\'t designed as a running shoe or a trainer.This is designed as a driving shoe.  It minimizes bulk.  So no bloated padded midsole like running shoes.  And outsole wear is not really a top priority so, the rubber outsole is thin too.  Also the sole is flat with zero heel drop unlike most running shoes.  And there is basically zero arch support on purpose.The reason for taking out all those "features" is to make a shoe that fits like a second skin.  Light, tightly fitted to your foot with no excess bulk to give you maximum space around the clutch, brake, and gas pedals in the car\'s footwell.  And that thin, flat midsole and outsole is designed to give you maximum feel of the pedals under your foot.  The rubber outsole is curved up the heel of the shoe for a reason, to prevent slip in your right foot when you are trying to heel and toe downshift a manual transmission.Can you wear these to walk from the car to a restaurant?  Sure.  Do you want to wear them to walk all day or for a 7 mile run?  No way.  These are a specialty shoe.  They are great on long drives.Puma sells to motorsports unlike most sneaker brands.  They have at least 3 other motorsports shoe lines, the Speed Cat, Drift Cat, and Future Cat.  But the Redon is the only one (I think) to offer a slip on bungee lace design.  I\'m used to leather driving loafers for the street but those don\'t really look right with jeans or shorts.  So, I bought the Redon\'s as a casual driving shoe with the same slip on convenience a my leather driving loafers.  And truth be told, I\'ll use them as my house slippers too because they are easy to slide into or pop off.Another thing that may confuse people is that Puma also makes shoes for martial arts fighting on mats.  The Redon has a much of the same look as their fighting shoes.  Minimal bulk, skin tight fit, flat soles, rubber on the outside of the heel, light weight.  So it looks a lot like a fighting shoe which is another highly specialized product.So the Redon is not your usual casual sneaker or a running shoe.  But it\'s a really nice driving shoe that can be worn to walk a few blocks with no problem.  I like the clean minimalist look a lot.  I like the light weight.  I love the slip on feature.  And I love the thin sole that gives me great "feel" of what\'s under my foot.Another complaint I\'ve seen here is the fit.  I wear a size 11D (medium width) in a running shoe so that\'s what I bought in the Redon Bungee.  They fit me fine in both length and width.  I didn\'t need to size up or down.  They are snug but easy to step into.  They feel secure on my feet but not so tight that they\'re annoying or painful.  But I\'d advise anyone with wide feet to think twice about these.  They are made snug to work with the bungee lacing system.So all in all, I\'m really happy with these driving shoes for the street.  At $40 they\'re a great value.  I may ditch leather driving moccasins altogether.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'True to sizeVery comfortableLow profile / stylishOrdered a second pair', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Mucho m√°s de lo que esperaba, teniendo en cuenta su precio.Muy facheras y est√©ticas.Excelente dise√±o.Me encant√≥ su cord√≥n fijo el√°stico.No hay que atarlo.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The shoes look really nice!', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'They have the bungee cord type shoe laces. I replaced mine with regular laces.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Todo muy bueno', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I use Fanatec Clubsport pedals with grip tape decals on the faces.These shoes are perfect for this.  They are not ‚Äúcasual‚Äù or ‚Äúcash register work‚Äù or ‚Äúfashion‚Äù shoes as others have reviewed them.  They ARE purposefully designed to be used for Motorsport driving where firm, thin soles, snug, slim shoes are required.  For THIS they are great.The people wearing them for fashion, or work must be young and don‚Äôt realize yet that their feet, shins, and legs will hurt.They aren‚Äôt even grossly overpriced, that is refreshing!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I‚Äôve previously owned 2 pairs of these in years prior. I missed this style as they were great shoes, I found these and I was super happy. So I purchased, now I regret it. Just after my month was up to when I could have returned them, the shoe laces broke and the inside soles are starting to rip apart. I‚Äôm not pleased. Wish I could have my money back. I‚Äôd stay clear of these shoes and spend your money elsewhere.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'}

My first pair of Puma track/driving shows four years ago.  My first pair of Puma driving shoes lasted for four years of cycling before they started to fall apart.  For cycling (or driving) these shoes are really comfortable, fit great, have great quality, and the Velcro closures solve the only problem I had with my old Puma's - the shoelaces get caught in the bike gears.  I highly recommend this shoe to cyclists and drivers.Last notes‚Ä¶  These are not shoes for anything other than short walking distances ‚Äì they aren‚Äôt designed for walking, they‚Äôre designed for driving while seated, and in my case and others cycling while sitting.  And finally, the soles of this shoe can be very slippery when wet so take care.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I use these shoes strictly for driving as I have a long commute and sometimes drive a windy road. But if your plans are to wear them for driving or some specific sport, these are good for the price.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Was looking for sim racing shoes on a budget. Looked into water shoes but was put off by the many reviews stating the soles were too soft. Saw these and figured, for $27 what the hell. I was previously using regular shoes that would occasionally cause me to press the accelerator while braking because of how wide they were. These taper towards the front which completely eliminated the accidental accelerator presses. The sole is stiff enough to give you great feel and they‚Äôre very light. review: {'review': "I bought these shoes to get my feet wet in trail hiking / running.  I was and still am pleasantly surprised by what feels like a shoe that will hold up for the next 6 to 12 months at minimum as I put them through their paces ... not necessarily with what I had originally planned (trail hiking and running), but more so everyday life (work and play). I've tried some of the highest rated and more expensive shoes.  From a beginner running (9.5 min mile) standpoint and a person who tries to eat right and exercise everyday I would say that these shoes are a perfect fit for anybody's everyday activities. I work long 12-hour shifts and I'm constantly on my feet.  These shoes stood up to the time duration and did not cause my feet any discomfort.  They have just the right amount of padding, firmness and stability so that you feel confident with every step you take.  Granted I did not test these shoes in wet environments on varying surfaces (specifically smooth).  These shoes are said to be waterproof however I would probably caution people with regard to that and just say water resistant.  This is my first pair of Pumas and I am truly impressed.  For treadmill running I have a pair of Adizero Evos which are also fantastic but seem to be more environmentally limited due to their lack of semi cleated soles for outdoor running.  I'd highly recommend these Pumas as an everyday shoe.  They have served me well in varying environments including the rough sidewalks/streets of Tijuana MX.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I recommend ordering a half-size up In comparison to Nikes and Adidas. I wear a 10.5-11 in Adidas and Nikes and had to return a size 11 pair of these to get an 11.5 pair. The 11.5s are slightly snug and feel and look great. Should break in nicely but will update if not. First time buying Pumas and pleased so far.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Good looking shoe. review: {'review': "I needed a good-looking black pair of sneakers.  I wanted them to be of quality, comfortable and not be cheap.  I think I found them.I have owned many Puma sneakers.  They were extremely popular in the late 70's and early 80's.  The design, fit and quality were really good.  But, somehow, they simply stopped making a great shoe, and the ones after the above time period were poor quality, looked cheap, were cheap, and ugly.  Not made nor designed for a man; more or less for a teenager and someone in their early 20's.  It was hard to find a classic Puma.  After searching, I did.They arrived today.  Perfect fit, comfortable, and a good-looking sleek, black pair of sneakers.I didn't buy these to rock climb, go jogging or for hiking etc.  I bought these for a casual sneaker: go to the gym, wear around sneaker.  Concerning the durability, I will have to wait and see.  If they last a few years, then I will be fine with that.  I suspect they will last longer because I have other sneakers for other type of wear.If you want a classic, clean looking, black pair of leather sneakers, with all the above I described, consider these.By the way, the size was perfect.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These Pumas feel comfortable during my long walks around the neighborhood. review: {'review': "I'm a 64 yr old senior, and I exercise nearly every day. I've used the $200+ sneakers .... and I gotta say:  the Pumas are MORE comfortable and supportive for my workouts (including jumping jacks and jump rope).  I use an orthotic, and I expect to replace them a few times a year.  However, the MUCH more expensive brands broke down almost as quickly.  I keep a stash ahead, just in case Puma stops making these.  Sale prices are amazing - try the Puma site as well for their promotions.  I can wear the women's 8.5 as well as the men's 7.  Comfortable, very supportive, hold up well.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The foam inside is very comfortable! I‚Äôm very happy with this purchase and would definitely buy them again.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I'm disappointed because this relationship started off really well. The shoes are adorable! Love the bright colors, nothing too loud, but definitely noticeable.  This is a very comfortable shoe with a Gel insert, so your steps are pretty cushioned and light. H O W E V E R, THERE ARE TOE-HOLES ON MY SHOES NOW!  To get an idea of the usage for wear and tear, I've used these shoes at the gym 5 days a week for 1.5 hrs for only the past 6 weeks - with only 25 minutes of that being cardio. I do not use these shoes for any other purpose.  I'm upset because these shoes wore out already! I'm not sure what type of resistance sneakers should withstand, but I can tell you that today I have shin splints (which I believe is because the insert has worn down) and I just noticed these toe holes!  For the record, I'm well groom with mani-pedi's so my toenail did not bust open this shoe!If you need this for the gym I do not suggest it unless you are ok with the life span and maybe alternate shoes. As someone who spends all day on my feet, I truly appreciate how lightweight and cozy they are. They fit true to size, which is a huge plus. I opted for the black pair, and I'm already planning to buy a few more in different colors. I highly recommend these shoes to anyone looking for comfort and style!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I bought these just before I injured my foot, so I didn't get to wear them until recently. Once I was cleared to wear real shoes, they were the first ones I put on. They are incredibly comfortable!! I wore them to physical therapy, and it truly felt like I was walking on air. The support and cushioning are incredible. The sole is thick and provides amazing protection from hard surfaces. The big, thick sole is also brightly colored, almost like a neon effect -- very flashy!! I like it! You get amazing comfort, Puma style, and a cute pink puma on the instep. What's not to love? I bought them for work shoes, but to be honest, I think they're too cute for that and I will just end up using them for working out/walking. Perfect sneakers.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Returned.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I bought these Riaz Prowl Rainbow sneakers for my wife through Amazon a few of weeks ago. She wore them three times for approximately twenty minutes each time, but complained of getting a bad blister on one foot (heel). It turns out it\'s because there is a big hole on the inside of one shoe, exposing her heel to a hard surface. I contacted Puma because I wanted to return them and have a replacement pair sent, but they informed me they had "determined that there is no defect with this specific product that would qualify for a refund or reship." When I initially contacted them, they replied on October 22nd saying they would get back to me in 7-10 business days. They actually made me wait three full weeks (or 15 business days) before responding tonight (November 12th). All in all, this has been terrible customer service.As a big fan of Puma footwear (Speedcats in particular), and having worn nothing but them for the past decade, this experience has made me rethink my brand loyalty.I cannot recommend this shoe or brand in good faith to anyone.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and appreciate their excellent cushioning, with one noting the responsive nature of the cushioning. They receive positive feedback for their appearance, fit, and value for money. Customers disagree on the stability of the shoes. Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-made, and stylish, with good cushioning and a great fit. The durability receives mixed feedback - while some find them durable, others report that the sole falls apart within 6 months. Customers disagree on the support, with some praising it while others find it inadequate. Value for money is also mixed, with some considering them good value while others say they're not worth the high price.

review: {'review': 'Really comfortable and lightweight.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice shoes for teens in school', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "First of all, this shoe is true to size, there is no need to size up or down (like normally happens with Reeboks). Just pick the size you normally wear in the other brands. This shoe is a running shoe (soft breathing cloth mesh upper) and feels like a typical Under Armour sneaker. The entire upper is soft and tight, even the tongue, which makes it a great shoe for gym and sports. It is very light (by weight) compared to other sneakers. I'd say its good for summer, sports, running, but not for work or winter. The design and colors are great. There are some nice colors even in the female version that's worth checking out.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice , very comfortable', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'muy comodas me gustaron mucho y  talla precisa', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Tight fit10 1/2.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Why did you pick this product vs others?:Very comfortable and great price!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excelente producto', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': "Have started using this shoe as my daily running shoe.  Only have a handful of days using them, but so far they are very good.  They have the right cushioning feel, which I think is important for staying injury-free.  Nice toe-box room, which is #2 on my priority list since I have sort of big feet with a size 13, and don't like a cramped toe feeling which sometimes happens.  Heel collar doesn't feel tight around my ankle, which can be a big negative for me as well. The price was very reasonable as well.  All in all, very satisfied.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These were the first pair of running shoes I purchased after hours of online research and I am so glad I picked these!I have been running in these shoes for the past 6-7 months and they have been so comfortable that I am debating on buying myself another pair! Reviews online have mentioned that these shoes are best for short runs (3-5 miles) but I regularly go on 8-10 mile runs in these shoes without any problem. product: Reebok Men's Rb4041 Sublite Cushion Safety Toe Athletic Work Black
customer_say: Customers find these work shoes comfortable, well-made, and appreciate their lightweight design as the lightest alloy-toe shoes available. They consider them worth the price and report that their feet rarely hurt anymore. The fit and durability receive mixed feedback - while some say they fit well and hold up well, others find them too narrow and report durability issues with the outer soles. The feel is also mixed, with some praising the cushioned sole while others note the stiff sole.
review: {'review': "Good, lightweight, comfortable work shoes for individuals who spend a lot of time walking and standing, great for kneeling and needing a flexible shoe so as to be on the ball of the foot and not on the toecap.  No climbing hill, but it has a flexible sole for a good grip. In medium to high work industries, shoes will only last for approximately one year. Saying that I'm on my 3ed pair.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I bought these for my husband because he works long hours on his feet in a warehouse, and he was always complaining about foot pain. Since he started wearing these, he says the difference is huge. First thing he told me was, ‚Äúthey feel like sneakers!‚Äù They‚Äôre lightweight, super cushioned inside, and the safety toe doesn‚Äôt bother him at all.He also really liked the design ‚Äî they don‚Äôt look like the usual heavy, bulky work shoes. He finishes the day with much less foot pain now, which makes him happy (and me too). Highly recommend these if you‚Äôre looking for something both comfortable and tough.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These steel toe shoes have been a solid choice for work. Right out of the box, they were surprisingly comfortable, with enough cushioning and support to get through long shifts without sore feet. The steel toe protection is solid, and the shoes feel sturdy without being too heavy or bulky.They‚Äôve held up well over time‚Äîthrough rough surfaces, long hours, and all kinds of weather. The grip is reliable, and the materials are tough enough for daily wear in demanding environments.That said, after about a year of regular use, the original insoles started to wear down, and I noticed some foot fatigue. Swapping in a good pair of aftermarket insoles made a big difference and brought the comfort right back.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These are some fantastic work shoes. I bought them off the shoe truck in 2017 when I noticed a lot of co-workers wearing them, now retiring them for a new pair after 2 years in the warehouse.Lugging boots in and out of a sit down and stand up forklift all day can get tiring and even painful once the company starts requiring that mandatory 20 hours of OT at the end of the week. These things are so light weight, my top of foot pain has gone away. I'd actually gone jogging with them once...back in 2017.They have a decent amount of room in the toe area, never get any crowding. The cut-across design of the bottom of the shoe allows for extreme flexibility, meaning when you're squatting down to check that pallet label, the rear and sides of the shoe don't dig into your ankles as much. Pretty comfortable for an uncomfortable position.These things have kicked pallets, kicked boxes, kicked racks, forklifts and even a couple co-workers. I used the toe to drag pallets out on a daily basis, the mesh on top held up pretty well considering how wreckless I am with them.I tried a couple pairs of quality boots, a couple cheap pairs of steel toes from local department stores. These are much cooler and more comfortable than all of those. I'm a very warm mammal and get sweaty from time to time, switching from boots to these have eliminated that issue.The alloy toe means they're very light which is important if you're walking 15,000-20,000 steps a day while jumping in and out of equipment.I think two years is a bit longer than you'd want to stretch it, much of the padding in the heel had disappeared, but I wore these til the day my new ones were delivered with no issues.Adding an additional insole made these even more comfortable. I'm a big guy (240 lbs) so standing 10-12 hours, I need the extra cushion, but the included cushioning would probably suffice for those sit down forklift weeks.Gotta say, if you're on your feet all day and you haven't tried work shoes and have always been a boots person, you need to try these.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "While if this was a normal shoe from me it would at least get a 4 star review based on its Comfort, Perceived Durability and Materials Makeup.This shoe will only recieve a 3 star review because of one category Slip Resistance.Slip Resistance - This shoe claims slip resistance. I'm not sure what this is actually for whether its for dirt or whether it's for oil. Typically I see it for oil.(Just a heads up I write this first for the people who depend on this category for work. I do not hate this shoe and rather like it)I will say that this shoe on normal ground (just like your average shoe) grips great but the moment oil is introduced you will start sliding. I work in a manufacturing environment for food where cooking oil is always around.I cannot help but slip all over the floors of my place of work even with the claim these shoes make. I give this category a 1 out of 5Comfort - This shoe is pretty comfortable I would give it a solid 4 out of 5 in that. I had to buy wide as the toe area squished my toes on the first pair I bought.It hugs your shoe but it does have some space between the top of your foot and the top of the shoe. Even after tieing it tightly. Also the Steel Toe in this show is not uncomfortable which is a plus.Percieved Durability - I will say that from what I can see after wearing them for a week is that this shoe will be very durable. It wont be prone to the side walls stretching out due to the reinforcement on the sides. Definitely a 4 out of 5 on thisMaterials Choice - I will say that everything on this shoe feels mostly premium. The mesh is good and not cheaply made and the steel toe is good.The only thing I will say badly about this is that the bottom of the shoe sole does not feel premium and it feels more like foam than it feels like rubber. I will give this a 3 out of 5.Good luck on your purchase. I do actually recommend this product if you wont be working in an oily environment as these will definitely keep your feet safe and comfortable.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: Reebok Men's Ultra 7 DMX Max Walking
customer_say: Customers find these walking shoes comfortable, well-fitting with extra width, and appreciate their solid construction and good value. The shoes receive positive feedback for their appearance and cushioning, with one customer noting the combination of memory foam insoles and air cushioning. However, the durability receives mixed reviews, with one customer reporting the bottom coming off, and customers find the shoes squeaky.
review: {'review': "The Reebok DMX line of sneakers has been my favorite footwear since 1997, due to its extremely comfortable insole, good quality, and endurance.  Reebok outlets and other stores that sell the brand and DMX line don't always have my size in stock. Amazon does, along with swift delivery.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The product is as described, fast delivery, and excellent service. The price is considerably good, and the packaging was adequate for mailing.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I am very overweight but I always had excuses as to why I didn't want to walk, my feet hurt, my shoes were uncomfortable and I didn't have the strength.  My g/f pushed me to go to the website for the shoe store and use their suggestions to find a comfortable shoe (As I am not doing an endorsement for them, I won't mention the store).I selected this and I put it on and it hurt my left foot as normal for me, I was about to return it and be disappointed yet again but I decided to simply adjust how it fits by the laces.  First adjustment, it was flopping as it was not secure, the second adjustment did the trick.  Now instead of being sedentary, this big boy is knocking down a mile a day, almost every day, steadily increasing to now 1.5 miles a day and I have no intention of stopping.Comfort, security, confidence, all packaged in this show.  Walk on brothers and sisters.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "They are quality shoes and I was going to give them a lower score only because if you are older or have balance issues don't buy these.The center of the sole is raised and it causes balance issues and I didn't have any before.I would buy the brand again as usual but not this specific shoe.You actually feel like you are walking on a tight rope.A bit dangerous for me at least.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are comfortable... however that is quickly replaced with a very loud and distinctive squeak with every step you take. I have bought 3 pairs of these shoes.Returned the first pair thinking it was just that shoe. Then ordered a spare pair before the replacements arrived. The squeaking is ridiculous.If any shoe executives are reading this. The problem is when you step forward and lift your toes it squeaks.My second pair I have worn for several weeks so its not a break in period', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I wear a 14 4E and have had to settle for what ever was in stock in my size and while some of them were good it always took a month or two of breaking in before I noticed my feet didn't hurt anymore. BTW in the last year I have purchased Sketchers and New Balance and will problably never use them again unless I know I am stepping into something fowl.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'At first they were nice. product: Reebok Men's Walk Ultra 7 DMX Max Walking
customer_say: Customers find these walking shoes comfortable, well-designed, and good value for money, with great arch support that's particularly suitable for older feet. The fit receives mixed feedback, with some finding them good while others say they're too narrow. Moreover, durability is also mixed, with some saying they're durable for walking or working while others report them falling apart. Additionally, customers note that the shoes squeak like crazy.
review: {'review': 'Ok, these shoes are stellar; comfortable, supportive and with the dependability of genuine leather. The (Ortholite) insoles are amazing and the Moving Air technology seems to work really well. My pair fit to perfection and look splendid. That they reached me fast via the incomparable Amazon experience is just gravy, as is the surprisingly reasonable price. Dance on, Reebok.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'He really liked them  said they were very comfortable.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I bought these sneakers to replace a sub-$30.00 pair of Kirkland sneakers that I got at Costco five or six years ago.  That\'s a long time for a walking sneaker, but those things refused to die.  They were some of the best money that I ever spent on footwear.  They\'ve been pretty much indestructible, and they had the most comfortable insoles that I\'ve ever had the pleasure of experiencing.  I\'ve replaced the insoles a couple of times, but now the sneakers are looking long in the tooth.  Time for a new pair.  Unfortunately, it seems they don\'t make those particular sneakers anymore.  If they do, I can\'t find them.After looking over Amazon, I found these.  I\'m not interested in any "fashion forward" screwball looking sneakers.  I just want I nice regular pair of sneakers at a reasonable price.  I\'ve had pretty good luck buying sneakers online.  I order a size twelve and they fit without issue.  I was a little surprised when I first tried these sneakers on and they felt a little snug.  I like a snug sneaker, but these almost felt undersized.  I\'m strictly talking about the width here.  Length wise they\'re fine.  I\'ve been wearing them for over a week now, and they are definitely starting to break in.  They do feel like they run a little on the snug side, so if you like your sneakers roomy, you may want to consider going up half a size.Pros:- These were listed at $48.00 when I ordered them.  That\'s a good deal.  Assuming they hold up.- They feel well made and appear to be good quality.  (I\'ll revisit this after I\'ve had them for awhile.)- They look good.  Of course, this is a matter of taste, but I think they look really nice.Cons:- They\'re a little on the snug side.  Okay by me, you might feel differently.- Short tongue.  Should be 1/2" to 1" longer.How they feel on your feet is a matter of taste.  These are getting more comfortable as I where them.  That\'s a good thing.  I like a snug fit, because I feel that it gives me more support.  You may feel otherwise.  I wish the soles were a little wider for more lateral stability.  This is a matter of individual preference.  The insoles are the soft and spongy type.  They provide comfort, but not much support.  I like them, but I don\'t think they\'ll last very long.  Overall, I\'m happy with these so far.  If they hold up, I\'ll probably come back and up the rating to five stars.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My opinion these are the best walkers on the market. Great fit and support. This is my 2nd pair, wore the first ones out!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The shoes are very comfortable.  This is my go-to for work shoes because they work well with my messed up feet.  They accommodate the bunions on the outside of my foot, my messed-up pinky toe, and have good heel cushion.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I've been ordering the same shoes (with some slight model variations) for work from the same manufacturer for years. I'll usually wear them until the seams come apart or the tread wears out. The tread seemed to wear out pretty fast with the last couple pairs I bought, so I thought I'd try these instead.Got them yesterday and put them on today. Nice looking shoe. I'm worried about glue breaking down and the seam eventually  coming apart around the toe, but I guess that may or may not happen- will update. I usually order a wide shoe but that wasn't avail for this shoe, so they fit kind of snug. Not too snug though- definitely workable and I'm sure they'll loosen up as I break them in. Lots of cushioning. In fact, they're almost bouncy.Only issue out of the box is they are incredibly noisy. They squeak and creek with every movement. On both hard and soft surfaces, as well as wet and dry surfaces.  Mostly from the arch and heel area. And it's LOUD. I can't remember ever having shoes this noisy. I really hope they get less noisy as I wear them.UPDATE: So over 3 weeks later, the left shoe has quieted down a lot. It's still a little noisy though. The right shoe has shown no change. It sounds like a duck with each step I take, and it's quite loud. Inside, outside, wet, dry, hard surface or soft, this shoe is LOUD.  It's the rubber tread/sole on the bottom of the shoe that makes the noise. I'm almost 60 and I've never had shoes with this type of issue before. I'm very disappointed that a major brand like Reebok uses such crappy materials in their product. I WILL NOT be purchasing from Reebok again.UPDATE 2: So here it is 2 months later, and the right shoe is still loud as heck. It's the tread and the way it moves when I walk. It like rubs up against itself somewhere and makes that squeaking sound. I wear the shoes to work 6 days/week so you'd think it would have stopped by now. The other day it was raining and these shoes got soaked. They were too wet to wear the next day so I wore my back-ups, which are my previous pair by another brand. I was immediately reminded how nice it was to walk without loud noises coming from my shoes. That's it. I'm throwing these away and ordering a pair of my regular brand. will not buy these again.", 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Quality just OK. Not as good as previous models. Wears quickly inside the back heel and has an annoying squeak when walking. But I guess, for the price, it's OK. Functions well as a light and comfortable walking shoe.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'A very comfortable walking shoe. This is my third pair.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, with feet never hurting during wear, and appreciate their appearance, noting they look brand new. Customers disagree on the fit, with some finding them narrow while others say they run small. The material quality receives mixed feedback, with some praising the leather while others note it doesn't look as good as expected.
review: {'review': "A Gen X favorite.  Stylish and comfortable kick. If you know how to wears these, you already know. I wanted to buy the black ones but the price is too expensive.  This style of shoe is worth anything between 60-65 dollars anything less than that is a hell of a bargain, it has that nostalgic feel. Reasonably priced its a excellent buy. Update: I caught the black ones on sale for 30% off and paid 55 dollars for them. Again, Excellent buy for comfort, style and nostalgia. Quality without killing yourself in the pockets. And they don‚Äôt look like the blanket/tent sneakers the kids wear today. Reebok always put out a quality product, they just refused to go crazy and kept it conservative. I like it.Thank you.1 Samuel 17:39 And David girded his sword upon his armour, and he assayed to go; for HE HAD NOT PROVED IT. And David said unto Saul, I cannot go with these; for I have not proved them. And David put them off him.1 Samuel 17:40 And he took his staff in his hand, and chose him five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in a shepherd's bag which he had, even in a scrip; and his sling was in his hand: and he drew near to the Philistine.Stick to the proven.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'A solid, stable work out shoe.  Could be a bit wider across the toes.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I'm a  Reebok Classic fan. These are actually my preferred workout shoe. Mostly because they're all leather and I need the support that they provide over  the cloth shoes that are so popular nowadays. And then there's the wrap-around soles. I've found that they don't get caught on any parts of my various pieces of exercise equipment.I had a problem with the soles of my other Reebok shoes getting caught on the foot supports of my rowing machine. These resolved that issue and because they're made of leather, after I've worked out in them a few times they soften up and mold to me feet. This makes for a custom fit - and I love it! I caught them on sale for forty bucks so I have a new pair waiting for me to wear out my current pair. And believe me I will! :-)", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "They are some good-looking shoes and I really like them. I would recommend going a size up because they run slightly small. I'll update my review when I've worn them for longer.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Love'em glad they kept some of the original styles", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These sneakers are fabulous, they are sleek, fit are true to size but a tiny bit fitted, nevertheless, they can still be worn if you buy your exact size. The look is just as in the pic, excellent quality!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'stiff and somewhat tight in the front but shouldbreak in fine, quality isn\'t awesome as there are a few glue globs and a spot where there is not enough glue and the logo looks a little patchy but for the price I paid (35$) the seems decent, I like the materials so far I will update if they fall apart but I expect to have to reglue the soel in a few monthsUpdate " outside holding up well after a couple months of heavy use however the inside is pilling a lot and I\'ve worn a hole in part of the inside where my pinky toe rests, overall decent shoe 3/5 wish the inside was holding up better', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I really like this shoe. I don't always enjoy the endurance of some brands in the plus size I need. These, however, lasted me forever it feels like. I started wearing them as my work shoes because they were comfortable and purchased a second pair for errands or occasions.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': "I've been wearing the Reebok Energen Lux shoes for over a month, and I'm genuinely impressed by their performance as an all-day, every-day shoe. I needed something that could handle both short gym sessions and constant wear‚Äîfrom morning errands to evening walks‚Äîand these have quickly become my go-to pair.What truly stands out is the enduring support. Many comfortable shoes feel great on day one but start to flatten out after a couple of weeks. These Energen Lux shoes have successfully retained their cushion and responsiveness, even with continuous daily use. The mid-sole provides a fantastic blend of softness for comfort and firmness for stability, which is essential for keeping feet and joints happy when you're on your feet for hours.The fit is true to size, and the upper mesh material is breathable without feeling flimsy. The construction is solid, showing no premature signs of wear on the sole or the upper fabric, which speaks volumes about their quality at this price point.If you are looking for a highly versatile, comfortable, and reliable sneaker that can transition effortlessly from a light workout shoe to a shoe you wear daily without losing its supportive feel, I highly recommend the Reebok Energen Lux. Fantastic value and performance.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice, comfortable and affordable pair of sneakers, bought on sale, and it was a great purchaseDurabililty has been great so far', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Excellent productThe sneakers exceeded my expectations. customer_say: Customers find these work shoes comfortable, particularly for safety use, and appreciate their quality and lightweight design. review: {'review': 'Light weight and comfortable. Really like this shoes . Specially if you work in wearhouse or any other job which requires to have safety shoes . This one is highly recommended.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great for warehouse work, had to get wide and they are amazing, haven‚Äôt had much feet pain in a while', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "In the last 6 months I have discovered that finding a pair of breathable hard toe shoes, that also are actually wide, and have arch support is apparently to much to ask.  I will admit I have an odd size foot at 11.5 4E, I've tried atleast 12 different brands now and to this point these shoes are the only one that comes close to fitting my size.  Most notably for me, they have a wide enough toe box that I can walk a lot and not get blisters, note that they are not perfect, however if you need some breathability as well these might be your best bet.  I also got the composite toe and it's been light enough not to really notice and does not set off metal detectors.Note:  if you have a flat or fallen arch the support may be great for you, that said if you have any arch, or like me have a decent arch you will want to like at getting an insert or additional support.  For this reason I've rated it a 4/5 stars, I have worn Reebok shoes before and these by far have the least comfortable insole of any I've worn before.  I think it has to do with the materials they used to help them be rated for industrial use, that said I still find it hard to beleive that Reebok would approve a shoe with such a lack of support.Overall, if your looking for a safety she that has a wide toe box, is breathable, and has a composite toe you probably wont find a better option.  I recommend using Amazon Wardrobe to try these out, I could not find anyone that had these in stock to try on and out city us a decent size.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Super comfortable for walking around in.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Good sneaker', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The shoes are light weight and seem very well put together, as you\'d expect from a major brand like Reebok. I wear a men\'s 12 or 13 depending on the brand and fit so I went with a 12 as I saw other reviews saying they run a little big. The toe area is wide (I don\'t have wide feet), of course that has more to do with the safety toe than anything, but the 12s length is still a little big on me too. They\'re not overly loose or uncomfortably big, just a little extra room than I probably would have chosen had I tried them on in a store, but not enough to justify returning them. They are the most "normal" looking safety toe shoes I\'ve seen and I don\'t think most people would even notice unless I told them. I\'m happy with them and will buy another pair whenever these ones wear out.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These are very comfortable, lightweight, and pass thru TSA metal detectors. This is why I bought them.As an stagehand, Maybe I'm harder on them than most people, but they didn't hold up well for me. They were great, for about a year. It's been 18 months now, since I bought them, and they're really wearing out fast now.Both shoes wore out the fabric on top and the sole on the bottom of the toe. Also the safety toe inserts are loose and move around.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Great work shoe that isn't a boring color wish they came standard with bungie laces but hey what shoe does dieing shoes is to 19th century for me.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': 'These shoes are excellent for both the gym and casual wear. They‚Äôre lightweight yet supportive, with a solid grip that feels stable during workouts. The cushioning is comfortable without being too soft, which makes them perfect for lifting, running short distances, and everyday use. Stylish and versatile.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The Reebok Nano X4s are not just shoes‚Äîthey\'re a lifestyle. Honestly, I feel like I could climb a mountain, wrestle a bear, and then hit a CrossFit WOD all in the same day with these bad boys on my feet. üêªüèãÔ∏è\u200d‚ôÇÔ∏èFirst off, the comfort is unreal. It‚Äôs like Reebok secretly hired a team of NASA scientists to design a shoe that hugs your feet like a clingy toddler. Whether I‚Äôm lifting, running, or just strutting around pretending I‚Äôm in a sneaker commercial, these kicks have me feeling unstoppable. üí™üöÄThe grip? Let‚Äôs just say I could probably run up a wall like Spider-Man if I really wanted to (I haven‚Äôt tried... yet). They‚Äôre stable enough to keep me grounded during squats but flexible enough to make burpees almost bearable. Almost.And let‚Äôs not ignore the style. These shoes are so sleek that even my non-gym-going friends have been asking, "Where‚Äôd you get those?" customer_say: Customers find these gym shoes superior in quality, comfortable, and effective for workouts, with one customer noting they're great for leg days at the gym. The shoes receive positive feedback for their style, support, and fit. Customers disagree on the sizing, with some reporting the shoes are too small and too short.
review: {'review': 'Solid cross trainers for people with a lifting focus. Flat sole, way less toe spring than many other cross trainers. Wider toe box as well. Result is a more stable shoe with excellent ground contact. Not anchors or lifted like a lifting shoe and excellent side grip which gives it good lateral movement as well.Overall a stylish unicorn of a shoe that meets several needs of both weightlifting and aerobic activity.Obviously this all has trade-offs. Less toe spring and wider box means not as good of a running shoe as some others. Less heel and more flexible lateral movement means not a perfect squat shoe, but this is my pick for a weight lifter focused cross trainer that wants to fit in some cardio and calisthenics in the same workout without changing shoes.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I've never worn a more comfortable gym shoe! I take them on walks and short runs too but just wearing them out for the day and in the gym feels great. They fit perfectly and look very nice!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Bought one size up and it for perfectly, amazing for runs and I'm also on my feet in my day job for hours on end so the support is amazing, immediately saw improvement and decrease in my backpains, I also train daily and it feels great under pressure", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nanos are ALWAYS great! Not too mention, I get compliments on them all the time!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I really love these shoes. Very lightweight with solid support. I do mostly CrossFit which means running, barbell work and gymnastics. It is perfect for workouts that involve a little bit of each. I wouldn‚Äôt do heavy squats or Olympic lifts in them but they work for lighter workouts I don‚Äôt want to wear my lifters for. I wouldn‚Äôt run a marathon with them but I prefer them if I have to run intervals while also incorporating barbell work.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This version is shorter and narrower. Ordered size 12.5 per my last X1 pair and these do not fit. Typical of Reebok to modify sizing every iteration of the Nano. Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-fitting, and nice-looking, with one customer noting they're good for everyday gym use. The material quality receives mixed feedback, with one customer mentioning they're made from 50% plant-based material. The durability is concerning, with one customer reporting fraying after just two weeks of use.
review: {'review': "Had this in my cart for a few weeks before finalizing my purchase. When I finally did I was still hesitant. When I got them the were a bit tight in the mid section but after wearing it 2 times they got really comfortable. The only draw back I have for this is the material, someone stepped on my foot the first night out and I have to use a mild brush with soap and water to get it out. But that's just about it.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I got these about two years ago and they are still kicking. Great value, I got a lot of miles out of them. They survived me two international trips and many trail hikes. The fit is a little on the snug side at first so if you have a wider foot keep that in mind. The color and style . I did not much care for at first. But that is small compared to this light weight, versatile shoe.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'It is mainly for walking but because it is also designed attractively, it also serves as casual wear.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Got these for my grandson who wears shoes out quickly!  They fit well and are nice looking.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Good for everyday gym.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "First the good.  The shoe is lightweight.  Laces stay tied during long runs and the sole of the shoe is comfortable for the most part during runs.  If you are worried about the environment shoe is made from 50% plant based material.  What that exactly is, is not specified anywhere on the shoe.  My geuss would be cotton.  It feels like a canvas type shoe but not as soft.  Shoe fits well enough.  I tend to buy wider shoes but didn't have to with this shoe.  If you have a narrow foot, this shoe might be too big width wise.The bad.  The insole of this shoe does not remove.  It's also just a flat piece glued into the shoe and one could easily add their favorite insole on top and hopefully not lose much space inside the show.  The shoe is made with a rougher material.  Similar to canvas.  Unfortunately there is no additional padding around the Achilles' heel portion of the shoe and the heel tab part of the shoe rides up a little higher than most and doesn't have a notch.  Which leads to my biggest issue.  For me running with this shoe with no-show socks or no socks at all creates a rubbing action against my Achilles' heel and gets very raw and painful.  Even on a short run (3 miles) this becomes an issue.  I have to wear socks that completely cover this area in order to not have the issue.The rubber sole is very thin and seems to be wearing out quite rapidly.  I doubt I will get my normal use (around 500 miles light running) out of these running shoes.  These shoes may be better suited for walking.  I don't recommend them for running shoes because of the issues I observed.UPDATE:  Only used this for running about a month, switched it to a walking shoe and it pretty much fell a part very quickly.  Avoid this shoe, not worth the money.", 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I have run in this pair for several days, with more than 20 miles. review: {'review': "I love these shoes.  I have bought 4 of these in different colors. These are the only shoe I buy for work... customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, stylish, and lightweight, with great support and positive feedback about their quality, particularly for tennis and pickleball. The fit receives mixed reviews - while some say they fit great, others find them too narrow. The durability and heel angle also get mixed feedback, with some noting they have enough durability to last and one customer appreciating the heel-to-toe drop, while another finds the higher heel angle problematic.
review: {'review': 'Never had better court shoes! They are a bit hard to put on, but once they are on, they are very light and comfy. They feel like snug-fitting padded socks. I can just forget that I‚Äôm wearing them. No sliding around or hitting a hard wall in the toe box. Just incredible! Heel protection is superb. Lateral stability is good with a natural feel. The insoles are unbelievably good. I usually change the insoles of my shoes because the originals never provide enough arch support, cushioning, or booth. These do a great job. They actually get thicker towards the heel to provide more cushioning but they are thinner in the front so the shoe feels connected to the floor. (I did actually try to replace the insoles with Dr. Scholls, which were marginally better in certain aspects, but they were obviously not designed for these particular shoes so overall they did not work as well together as the originals.) I was concerned about durability because of other reviews and I do see some wear after 2 months, but not more than other shoes I had. (For reference, I play pickleball at about 3.5-4.0 level twice a week.) I also really like the heel-to-toe drop, which makes them feel like sneakers and stretch my achilles/calf muscles noticeably less providing some relief.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These Reebok Nano Court sneakers are hands down the best sneakers I‚Äôve ever owned! The colors are insanely bright and vibrant ‚Äî they totally make my outfit pop and turn heads everywhere I go. But they‚Äôre not just about looks; the comfort and support are next level.Whether I‚Äôm hitting the gym, running errands, or just out and about, these sneakers keep my feet feeling great all day long. The fit is perfect, and they‚Äôre surprisingly lightweight while still super durable.If you want sneakers that bring energy, style, and comfort to your day, don‚Äôt hesitate ‚Äî these are the ones!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Amazing shoes for tennis and pickleball but this tear happened within less than 2 months. If the shoes were $40 I would be like okay but they are over $100!', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice looking very comfortable', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great design, super comfortable, gives you a lot more balance on the court, and a sturdy footing. There does seem to be an inherent flaw in the design though because if you are using them to the max with quick collateral movements and hard play you will notice that they start to tear at a weak part on the outer edge towards the front of your foot. I‚Äôd have to say for the price they should have been a bit more durable but a year later I‚Äôm still using them, but I could imagine an advanced player running through these in a few months.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Look pretty cool, but are not comfortable. Arch doesn‚Äôt hit right. Fit is a bit narrow, doesn‚Äôt provide much slide on court.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I bought these shoes for pickleball and love them. When I first tried them on they were very snug and narrow, but after a few weeks of play, they fit perfectly. They have great lateral support and enough durability to last for some time. I like that the tongue is incorporated into the shoe so it‚Äôs all seamless and be tied to make tighter if needed. Would definitely recommend if you looking for a solid shoe both on and off the court.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These are some amazing court shoes. I use them for pickleball and they are comfortable and the best part is the toe guard for those of us that have a tennis background for those strong forehand hits', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': 'These shoes are great if you are looking for a zero drop shoe with a wider toe area. They aren‚Äôt extremely wide, but for me just perfect. Really a great shoe for squats. I also do a lot of work that requires me to walk on roofs and this shoe is very comfortable and provides great traction on an asphalt or cedar shake roof.I hope Reebok continues to provide a shoe option with a zero drop sole, these are really great. I have tried many of the barefoot shoes and these are way more comfortable and practical for wearing outside of workouts where the barefoot shoes are great for a workout, but you look kind of weird walking around or working in a barefoot shoe.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This is by far one of the most perfect lifting shoes, they have an amazing ground feeling. I personally use them for heavy squats and deadlift as they offer superior stability and support, also they feel so comfortable they can be worn for most exercises. Reebok has bridged the gap between barefoot shoes and workout shoes, weather you‚Äôre looking for a casual shoes to wear to the gym that will give you great feel with the wider toe box to intense sessions of powerlifting and CrossFit these are to go shoes. They are flexible yet very well built and constructed from materials that will last and the pair are very light in weight that you will feel comfortable wearing for extended periods of time. When it comes to sizing these for me are true to size, I wear size 11 on the Reebok nano and I find the same size works for these. Reebok well done on these, most exciting shoe release of the year.One more point. Compared to other barefoot workout shoes or low stack height shoes these are perfectly priced compared to other who exaggerate their prices especially that these are made from higher quality material', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Not a barefoot shoe.
