customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, well-made, and appreciate their classic leather look. The shoes offer good arch support and are considered good value for money. However, customers disagree on the fit, with some finding them too narrow. Moreover, the cushioning receives mixed reviews, with some finding them very cushiony while others say they're too stiff. Additionally, several customers report foot pain, particularly mentioning that they hurt their feet and cause knee discomfort.
review: {'review': 'Let me tell you about these shoes.  These run about 1/2 size too small. The width is accurate; however it is necessary to get the proper width because they don\'t give and relax like leather shoes .  The synthetic leather is sewn over a non giving Inner  "shoe".  That firm inner liner gives these gym shoes a lot of support and structure.  These will hold their shape for the life of the shoes.  They are very sturdy.  There is a band around the front of the shoe.  That gives additional structure.  They have a cushioned insole.  They have good arch support.  It supports exactly where it should on the arches. The tongue is padded and the heel area is padded.  The laces aren\'t overly long.  The gym shoes are lightweight.  On the feet, they look like good leather gym shoes.  They don\'t get those ugly creases in them.The insole is comfortable.  The synthetic leather is soft, but that is not felt because it is sewn over that inner shoe. The inner liner is soft, but firm.  The top of the shoe, before the laces have some "play".  That one area is softer. The rest of the  shoe is firm, non giving and will stay that way by design.  That\'s why getting the proper width is important.  The feet feel very supported.  These are nothing like those popular mesh gym shoes.Now, there are  two sole attached to these shoes. The first is flexible.  The second is not. It does not give.  It feels hard while walking.  The second sole is the one that is treaded.  It is deeply treadedThese shoes are not for running.  For anyone that has lost a lot of knee cartilage just know the last sole is  hard and inflexible.  If it wasn\'t,  these would be an absolute dream come true for anyone with knee issues.  Since it is so firm, initially they don\'t maneuver  easily in all directions while walking.  That\'s important for anyone with knee problems. They do absorb shock  and have lots of cushioning. The entire sole is almost 2".  They are well worth trying, because they absorb so much shock and pressure off the knees  while walking. Note the photos;  the heel is designed so that  wearer has to heel strike first.  It\'s not an option. That is the proper way to begin walking.  That takes further pressure off the knee joint......I\'m a Massage Therapist.I really don\'t think you will find a better shock absorbing shoe.  The more you walk in them the more thick cushioned sole is felt; the less the hard sole is felt,  and the feet are able to adjust to movement in all directions.  When first trying them on they just feel so hard.  That leaves after about a day of wearing.  After first trying them on my initial reactions was to send them right back.  Don\'t get discouraged when first trying them on.  Give them a chance. The knees will thank you.This is a good pair of shoes for people without knee problems for sure.  These make good works shoes  and they really look attractive, too.  I love the way they look, especially the all white.  It\'s a bright true white.  They look so fresh.  They make a nice  dress up gym shoe for me.  I know I\'m glad I found them and I hope this review helps someone else.I purchased the white and black. For whatever reason the black runs a little smaller than the white.  I noticed that is true of Reebok\'s Princess Lite shoe as well.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I love these shoes! After having problems with my feet (specifically a heel spur), I upgraded my footwear for both at work and at the gym. I bought 2 different brands, one of which was these shoes. I wore the other pair to work (where I am on my feet the most) and this pair to the gym. After a few weeks, I bought a second pair so that I could have a pair for work and the gym! This pair was superior to the other brand I bought (I‚Äôm not naming the other brand because I don‚Äôt have beef with them; I just love these Reeboks). My feet are not hurting at all like they were before buying these shoes! Plus they look great too! The quality and value for the price is unmatched in my opinion!The only things I will mention that some may not like, but that don‚Äôt bother me at all, these shoes are a bit hot. They are fully lined, padded leather, which I think is super comfy, but they do get hot. But I have completely gotten use to that now. They are a bit narrow, so if you like a roomy toe box, you should try to find them in a wide version. I typically wear a size 7.5US in sneakers, but I got these in 7US and they fit great.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I bought these tennis for my mom whose feet are a bit wide and they fit perfectly. She felt more comfort since her feet do not suffer to be into a ¬®regular shoe¬® .', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Fantastic shoes. They are still in perfect condition since I only wear them to decent places. I wear my old shoes for just about everything else.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable after I broke them in match anything love them', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very narrow. Don‚Äôt have much stretch, kill my feet not like they used to be.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I loved Reeboks in the 80\'s and wanted to try them again.I ordered a different style from these first, to wear mowing.  I love the way they feel and they will be perfect for yard work.  I ordered a regular size 8 and they fit like a glove.I wanted a slightly different style for just plain walking, etc. so I ordered these.  I had read the other reviews about their being tight, but I completely disregarded them because I had already received the aforementioned pair which fit perfectly.  Also, I figured if these fit a little snug, I would stretch them out over time.  Last, the term "X-wide" left visions of clown shoes in my head.  Big mistake!When the regular size arrived last week, they were VERY tight.  There was no way I could have worn them for any length of time.  I had to send the regular size 8 ones of these back immediately and received the replacement size 8 X-wide ones today.  HUGE improvement!  They feel great, look great and will be perfect for my needs. If you normally wear a narrow size, these shoes will work for you.  Otherwise, order the X-wide!Love my new Reeboks and can\'t wait to hit the ground in them!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Durability is good . Stability in them are great. Feel lightweight and fit to shape well. Color was true and stretchability is by far thumbs up.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': 'Review: Reebok Club C Double Platform SneakersI‚Äôve been wearing the Reebok Club C Double Platform sneakers for a while now, and they‚Äôve definitely become a go-to in my rotation. If you‚Äôre into classic silhouettes with a modern twist, these are a great choice.Style:The platform sole gives the traditional Club C design a fresh, elevated look‚Äîliterally. It adds just the right amount of height without feeling over-the-top. They pair well with everything from joggers and jeans to dresses and skirts, which makes them super versatile for casual or slightly dressed-up looks.Comfort:Surprisingly comfy for a platform sneaker. The cushioning is solid, and the shoe feels stable and supportive, even after a long day on your feet. I wouldn‚Äôt call them ultra-lightweight, but they‚Äôre definitely not clunky either.Fit:They run true to size in my experience. The leather upper is snug at first but breaks in nicely after a few wears. If you have wider feet, you might want to consider going half a size up, especially if you wear thick socks.Quality:Reebok did a great job with the materials‚Äîgood leather, clean stitching, and a durable sole that holds up well. They‚Äôre easy to clean too, which is a bonus if you like that fresh-out-the-box look.Final Verdict:If you‚Äôre looking for a sneaker that balances retro vibes with a modern edge, the Reebok Club C Double Platform is a solid pick. Stylish, comfortable, and versatile‚Äîdefinitely worth it.‚∏ª', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are great.  Look great, comfy and for the sale price i got, a  great deal! review: {'review': 'I‚Äôve noticed a lot of negative reviews on this item and I am here to say ignore them. The ones showing torn up boxes and complaining about it are full of themselves, along with saying their shoes came discolored or used in some way. It‚Äôs a lie, plain and simple. My box came in perfect condition. Also my shoes came in perfect condition. The comfort of these shoes are amazing, the style is just like I remember growing up and walking ability is awesome. The quality of these shoes are great and the fit is a little snug but that‚Äôs just because they are new and need to be ‚Äúbroke in‚Äù, just like any other shoe you would buy. Ease of cleaning is good. Over all, I‚Äôd give these shoes ten stars and I would buy them again and again. Don‚Äôt listen to the haters. Just because they have a box in their picture showing a torn up box doesn‚Äôt mean it came that way and if it did, then it‚Äôs the fault of the mail carrier not the seller. The ones showing pictures of their ‚Äúused discolored shoes‚Äù well, they wore them and then complained about it being the sellers fault. Entitlement is real out in this world. It takes a little common sense to figure out these shoes are wonderful and to not listen to the negative Nancy‚Äôs. I‚Äôm going to buy another pair. These look great and feel great! But them you won‚Äôt be disappointed.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Simple, comfortable, and just a quality shoe overall. They are also fashionable. I use a size 5 or kids 3', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': '', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These were a quick, last minute extra Christmas purchase when I find out Mom's main go to sneaks had amassed more mileage than expected. I\'m going to try replacing the inserts and I think that should be fine but I am reducing my "stars" because a 5-star shoe would have adequate arch support and not require any modifications.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Original Review:I was a little dubious about these because of the wide sole but they offer GREAT stability, particularly for squats. The style does flare out a bit wider at toe and heel so if your a person who steps on your feet it might take a minute to adjust. I‚Äôm more used to my shoe and sole being the same width. With all that being said I love them and am very happy with the quality and style. Cute and comfy, they are a winner!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': 'I absolutely love these shoes! I got the Reebok Nano X4s in white and they go with everything. I wear them almost every day to the gym, they‚Äôre super comfortable, supportive, and still look great with any outfit.One of the best parts? When they get dirty, I just toss them in the wash and they come out looking brand new. No joke, a guy at the gym even asked if I got new shoes, and I was like, ‚ÄúNope! Just washed them!‚ÄùHighly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for cute, durable, and gym-ready sneakers that actually hold up!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'love them! cute and stylish for up and down. also good for the gym. sizing is accurate', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Love the support.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': '', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Disappointed with the Reebok Nano X4.Only wore them 5‚Äì6 times before an eyelet broke‚Äîclearly a defect, not wear and tear. Reached out to customer service and got nothing but policy excuses. Asked for a supervisor, never got a response.As a loyal customer who‚Äôs worn Nanos for years, I expected better. Sadly, it looks like Reebok no longer stands behind the quality of its products. #Reebok #NanoX4 #CustomerServiceFail #CrossFit #FitnessGear', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Talla correcta, el color exacto, recomendable', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I like the look of these shoes and that's pretty much it.\xa0 They are uncomfortable to be in long term and there is something with the heel where my feet don't stay in the shoes.\xa0 I'd say I can really only use these at the gym on arm day.", 'rating': '2.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I bought these shoes to replace my Reebok CrossFit ones, which lasted me for almost seven years. I wore them for CrossFit, spinning lessons, cross-training, and weight lifting, and they were simply great. After a few workouts with these Nano ones, I'd like to share my experience.I'll be honest: I was impressed the first time I wore them for leg day. They have enough room in the toe box for weight lifting, are very sturdy, gave me no blisters, but I did notice my feet didn't feel completely comfortable, no arch support (like the CrossFit ones have), and the fit felt off.After a couple of weeks wearing them, my opinion has shifted. These are supposed to be good for cross-training, but if you are doing mild walking and/or prolonged standing with them, your feet will hurt on the toes and the heels. They are ok for weight lifting, considering the fit is not as great as the CrossFit ones, but definitely not for anything that includes walking. These shoes are NOT an improvement. The fit, the comfort, and the sturdiness are just not there. I remember being able to run and jump with the CrossFit ones, so I guess I'm just disappointed. I wish I had gone with the TYR ones.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'}

I love these and will continue to buy them.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I have wanted these shoes for over a year, but couldn't justify spending the cash. However, when I saw they'd dropped like $20, I went for it. I was nervous that they wouldnt fit my feet given the reviews and even considered buying two sizes/sizing up - I'm glad I didnt. I am a size 8, but sometimes wear a 7.5 in larger shoes i.e. Merrells. In New Balances, I can wear either a 7.5 or 8 usually. I wear an 8 in tevas/old navy flip flops. This shoe is definitely narrow, but I have narrow feet! I actually tried an 8.5 on in person to see if I should size up and let me tell you - I had clown feet. The 8.5 was creepily long on me. So I ordered the size 8 here and they fit perfectly! They're the perfect length for my feet and I actually have a little bit of wiggle room around my ankles so they're easy to slip on and off w/out messing up i.e., crushing the back of the shoe or having to untie them. Longer shoe laces would be nice, but thats something I could get on my own. These shoes don't provide much arch support, but they're comfy for walking around and running errands/being on campus for the day. They do rub a little on the back ankle if you're wearing shorter socks so beware of that - I just wear ankle socks now.This is a super detailed review, but I wanted to actually give some pointers instead of labeling these as good/bad.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I love these sneakers. I highly recommend these shoes.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Lemme first say, I‚Äôm giving 4 stars because for the price, they are a well-made and clean looking, stylish shoe, they‚Äôre just not the shoe for me and potentially not for you:First - as someone else said, they run a half size big, so size 1/2 DOWN. Otherwise the heel slippage will be bad on these (not enough of a heel ‚Äúcup‚Äù to keep them on)Even with my own high arch insoles put in, these shoes are STILL not giving enough support against overpronation. And I don‚Äôt even have a severe case! I‚Äôm starting to get pains reminiscent of shin splints, JUST from walking around with these at work! There are 2 main issues that are causing me to invest in a better shoe:1. Lack of stability - this shoe wasn‚Äôt advertised as a stability shoe, so I‚Äôm not holding it against them. Just letting you know that if you‚Äôre on the fence about these versus a proper stability shoe for your overpronation or arch issues, go for the stability shoe. Even just for casual walking, the support makes a difference.2. Poor ‚Äúflow‚Äù from heel to toe - I think there‚Äôs a proper term for this but I forget. Point is, even when walking (and I‚Äôd imagine it‚Äôd be worse when running), the shoe actually seems to hamper my heel-to-toe movement rather than help it. This is why I bumped down to 4 stars - no matter your foot type, the steps should feel smooth and they don‚Äôt here.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Affordable comfortable', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': '', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'It was time for a new pair of running shoes, and the reviews on these were great. The space for the toes is very short in hight and very narrow.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Way back when there was a transit strike in NYC and professional women started walking to work in sneakers and switching to shoes in the office, these shoes--or ones just like them--were really popular. I started wearing them for the long walk during the strike, and didn't stop. Every few years I would buy an identical new pair to replace ones that were getting shabby. And then I couldn't find them any more, although from time to time  I'd search again. Well, here they are! I have been trying every sneaker--Hoka, On Cloud, cushioned Converse, you name it, I've tried but kept wishing for something less bulky, less crazy looking, more comfortable. These arrived today and they are just as I remember--perfect fit in my usual size, really comfortable, on and on. I'm ordering a couple more because I'm so afraid they'll disappear again. Also trying a high top version, which will be better for hiking. I feel like I'm finally ready to get back to traveling with extremely comfortable all-day walking shoes that could also go off road onto trails--or look ok in a restaurant.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: Reebok Work All-Terrain Work Men's Oxford
customer_say: Customers find these work shoes comfortable, with feet not hurting, and appreciate their high-quality steel toe design and lightweight, breathable construction. The shoes receive positive feedback for their feel, with one customer comparing it to walking on a mattress, and their slip resistance, with good grip and non-slip properties. The fit and durability receive mixed reviews - while some say they fit well, others find them too narrow, and while some report they hold up well, others say they completely fall apart.
review: {'review': "I've been wearing these for 3 years this is the 1st pair I have purchased on Amazon.. Best steel toe shoe I have ever found that doesn't feel like a steel toe....The only complaint I have is I go through a pair every 3 months and I sit behind a desk I just do alot of walking in the warehouse. Good price for not feeling that steel rubbing on my feet I will continue to buy these shoes", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These shoes are awesome. I've worn them for about two weeks now and I am very pleased. I work retail and do a lot of warehousing and I'm on my feet for about 8 hours a day, constantly walking, kicking doors, pushing heavy product across slippery warehouse floors, lifting, crunching boxes, etc.I think I would rate the grip-strength of the tread maybe about a 7 or 8 out of 10. You would probably have to go to an actual boot to do any better.After a full-day each day, my feet are not fatigued or sore with these shoes. They feel like a slightly heavier pair of tennis shoes and I hardly even notice that it has steel toes, but it does!I have not tried jogging in them yet, but so far they feel like another pair of high-quality tennis shoes. One unique thing that I discovered about these shoes the other day, was I had them laced up and needed to take one shoe off. It turns out that the fabric around the ankles has an elastic quality so it stretches so you can take your shoes off without having to untie them.Although, if I had to nit-pick, I would like the laces slightly shorter because the tongue of the shoe is completely fused with the shoes and there's no way to tuck your laces in. This is easy enough to change though.I give these shoes 5 stars!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Non Removable insoles made from memory foam, which fall flat after a few minutes. And I wish it was available in composite toe or soft toe because the shoe is pretty good, very interesting tongue design. More like a slip on shoe but with laces. Will see how long they last.Update 4-17-19: 3 days into wearing the shoes and the outer layer of rubber that's on the fabric is already cracked and peeling off.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Best work boot/shoe I've ever owned, and I've been working/wearing steel toed shoes for 35 plus years.I just hate they discontinued this particular shoe. My work place gives an allowance for buying work shoes but only from 2 or 3 specified retailers and these shoes are discontinued so I bought some on here with my on dollars because I loved them so much.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "It is slip on shoes which is hard to put on due to stiffness. Moreover, it is NOT wide enough and it is too narrow even though I ordered wide.I don't recommend it.", 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "The memory foam insert is very comfortable however it can be removed easily which means at times while wearing it it bunches up under my toes or heal and I have to take it off to adjust it quick. The shoes do look like clown shoes. Large around the toes. They are also very stiff. I couldn't imagine wearing these for outdoor activities such as hiking. Which they seem to be marketed for. These are much better work work use. Very breathable.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Going on six months of 40 hour a week use on concrete floors in a manufacturing facility. I still dig these shoes. They are comfy, though memory foam insole took a bit of getting used to.They are a bit heavy with the steel toe. An aluminum or comp. toe would be a wonderful option. That said, they are still pounds lighter than the Keen safety toed boots I had prior.Great traction in the central NY winter parking lot trek, but mind they are not waterproof and the slush can creep in before getting through the door from the truck.The shoes are holding up very well at this point. I went out of pocket on these and am glad I did. I will buy another pair when these wear out. I'll update the review at that point, but I expect a good two years out them by how they are holding up.I do suggest getting a wide size for toe room, but that holds true with any steel toed shoe/boot, especially if one is prone to ingrown toenails or bunions.Also, I kinda like the fact that I don't wear the same shoes as everyone else in the plant and I get to offer the EHS folks a kick in the shin when they ask me if I have safety toes.. heh", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Almost two years into owning these for Factory work and they're holding up well. Only a small tear on each shoe from the bending of the steel toe. Extremely comfortable and allow you to move quick on your feet, and the fitment is great for a steel toe shoe. Will definitely be buying these again once they finally give out on me.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: adidas Men's Adizero Evo Sl M
customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, lightweight, and appreciate their true-to-size fit, with one customer noting plenty of room in the toebox. The shoes receive positive feedback for their color, with one customer describing the Lucid lemon shade as "unbelievably beautiful." Customers like the cushioning and find them suitable for jogging. The stability receives mixed reviews.
review: {'review': "My new favorite runners! I have 6 pairs of really nice running shoes now that I will alternate between but I think these will get the preference and definitely on race day.The GOOD: The fit is perfect even though that is a bit subjective. They have very good heel support and the toe is great, with good support and springy take off! The toe box is very comfortable on my size 13 normal width (D) feet. I like the reinforced eyelets. Very good traction. The arch support is very nice too. They feel light and lively.The BAD: The shoe strings are crap and will definitely get replaced. The tongue is non-gusseted but has a loop on the tongue that allows the second and third lace to go through it and help control positioning. I prefer a gusseted tongue.These are brand new, I just got them today. Opened the box and went for a quick 5 mile run so can't speak to durability. I'm older so still very pleased with how brand new shoes already feel broken in!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Edit, 8-13-25 Updated review after wearing: After wearing these shoes for longer distances, my feet hurt. The width is good, but the toebox height is not high enough for me, and they rubbed. I must stretch these with my shoe stretcher to make them comfortable around my bunions.In the interest of not misleading anyone: The shoe tag and the Adidas box do NOT identify the shoe as a ‚Äúwide‚Äù size. Also, a web search indicates, "Several reviewers specifically mentioned that the Adizero Evo SL fits well for runners with wider feet. Some even stated it\'s a better fit for wider feet compared to other Adidas models." That description is relative. The original web description was worded differently and it, along with Amazon‚Äôs product page, identifying the sizes as ‚ÄúWide‚Äù were what I\'d trusted and based my purchase on. The web search is misleading when one asks if this specific shoe model comes in ‚Äúwide‚Äù and this plus Amazon‚Äôs product page are wrong! The Adidas website does not have wide sizes either. Buyer beware.In my actual wear experience and going by the shoe tag and box, these shoes are not truly ‚Äúwide,‚Äù and they hurt my feet. I will notify Amazon to change the width to regular or standard, from ‚Äúwide.‚Äù__________Original review: I purchased these in size 6.5 Wide in Men\'s sizing. Amazon was the only carrier of the Wide version at the time. My typical women\'s size is 7 to 7.5 extra wide. I usually need an extra wide width due to two bilateral bunions, which make my feet sensitive with any pressure. My usual shoes are Brooks and New Balance. Runrepeat gave these shoes a high rating and, after reading their research about the toe box width, toe box height, great durability, and the customer reviews from other sites, I ordered these. I dislike spending full price, but this shoe brand and style/type (+ width) have sold quickly. They are my favorite sports shoes, stable, lightweight, and are comfortably cushioned. Worth the full price, imo. (See revised review above.)', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Good. True to size', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This is my 2nd pair. True to size. Super comfy.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Look great, feel great, wonderful for jogging.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excelent', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Descent shoe for faster paces! Horrible stability and atrocious grip especially on turns and trails. Tongue slips terribly and laces are awful quality. Rocker feels nice even with no plate for bouncy, responsive feel. Fit ran true to size for me with plenty of room in the toebox. Can't speak on the longevity as I returned them for a different pair but I would guess the foam would not last very long for heavier runners.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I can't believe how comfortable these were, immediately! the moment i slipped them on, they hugged my feet and didn't let go until...well, i still haven't taken them off yet. eventually i will have to take a shower and get into my bed but i am definitely buying another pair before Adidas decides to discontinue or stop selling these because that's what retailers do to keep demand going. Affordable, worth every penny I paid. the color is unmistakable so when i walk at night i am definitely seen. they are very thin and lightweight material. when they came in the mail today i thought there was going to be only one shoe in there because of how lightweight the package was. too bad winter is coming soon. i live in chicago and i definitely won't be able to wear these in the snow and rain. that is the only downside. other than that, i want these shoes for the rest of my life!!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': 'This is a great looking running/lifestyle shoe, mainly for its silhouette from different views of point.Yes, it does run a bit long, but choosing one‚Äôs regular size would still do it without an issue.The upper seems built in three layers of synthetic materials, rendering a certain degree of richness, while eyelets islands seem to be of real leather, good for some contrast and to touch.The unique feature of this model Avryn, which I appreciate it very much, is the dual foams midsole, i.e. Boost + Bounce, or PU + EVA, each has their own characteristics, PU for good cushioning and longevity while EVA for bouncing. To put them together in a sensible way costs extra for sure, that‚Äôs a good value there.True, it doesn‚Äôt fit as snugly as most other shoes we see, but counting on so many good and unique features of Avryn, it is a good model to have.Mine is the White/Zero Metallic. It has basically four different shades of white, white, cream, beige and chalk white. I love the subtlety it presents.Overall, a great design, thumbs up!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I've had em for a week and half wearing them daily for 8+ hours for work and after work. I like em they don't hurt my feet or none. True to size fit as I wear 11s naturally these feel a slight bigger than 11s but not like 11.5s. gives toe room and comfort. My last pair of Adidas lasted me 2 years for working in so I decided to go that route again for an affordable pair and I'm pretty happy and content with them so far. So for value and money wise it's good. They feel light and not like most tennis shoes. Black makes for easy cleaning and blends with many styles.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The design is stylish, and the shoes feel sturdy, but they are a little bulky. customer_say: Customers praise these tennis shoes for their top-notch quality, classic Adidas style, and good value for money. review: {'review': 'I normally don‚Äôt gush over tennis shoes, but the adidas Grand Court 2.0 just forced me to. From style to comfort to sturdiness, these deliver everything you could want‚Äîand more‚Äîfor the price.‚úÖ Sleek, Classic LookThese deliver an effortlessly clean, old-school tennis style that works in nearly any casual or sporty setting. The iconic 3‚ÄëStripes and crisp white leather pop beautifully. I‚Äôve gotten multiple compliments already‚Äîpeople assume I spent way more.‚úÖ Instant Comfort & SupportNo break-in needed‚Äîthese felt great from day one. The padded collar gives serious ankle support, while the OrthoLite¬Æ sockliner molds perfectly to your foot and helps manage sweat. Even after full days of running and walking, my feet feel fresh and supported.‚úÖ Reliable Build QualityThe synthetic leather upper is durable and wipes clean easily‚Äîno peeling or fraying even after daily wear. The rubber cupsole balances firmness and flexibility, offering traction and durability all week long.‚úÖ Versatile & Easy to StylePerfect for casual Fridays, weekend errands, or hitting the court. I pair mine effortlessly with both jeans and activewear, and they just blend in. Also, despite the name, I find these great for everyday walking too.Bottom Line:Whether you‚Äôre buying these as an entry-level sneaker or supplement to your athletic rotation, the Grand Court 2.0 is an absolute win for style, comfort, and build, all at a great price.Bonus for adidas:If you‚Äôre looking for a detail-oriented reviewer who loves honest feedback and product testing, I‚Äôd be thrilled to help review more from your lineup in exchange for early access or testing units üòÑ.Bottom line: Five stars ‚Äî I‚Äôll definitely be back for more colors and maybe a backup pair.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice. All soft leather, old school style and colors, comfortable and light. Budget friendly pricing and fast delivery.Very pleased with my purchase.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I purchased these shoes for my brother, and he loves them! They fit h8m perfectly and they are comfortable on his feet.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The shoe has great traction. My son loves the unique color and the comfortability of the shoe', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great quality and fit. Very nice sneaker also great price!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are very nice and fit my teenage son well. He loves the style and has plenty of support in them without feeling like they weigh a lot. He loves the simplicity of the black and white colors together, but he thought some of the other colors would be cool too. Overall, these shoes are comfortable and fit well. They also seem to be holding up well. I would buy them again.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These Adidas sneakers are a total game-changer! Super comfortable from the very first step ‚Äî it honestly feels like walking on clouds. The design is clean, stylish, and goes with everything, whether you're dressing up or keeping it casual. I got them because my husband has them and he loves them. However, they only had white shoes in female sizes, so I had to improvise.I am usually a size 8 in female, which means that I am usually a 6 in male size. Which made me buy them in 6. However, because of the very nice, hard outer material of the shoes they did not fit me well, my toes felt constricted. So, I ended up buying a 7 after that and they fit me excellent. They are super comfortable, and they help with the weather, as I live in the PNW and the rain is pretty constant.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': 'Very comfortable and look great. Exact fit to my normal size. I like the aggressive tread. Great on trails.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I like them. Kinda tight fit and I have narrow feet but see for yourself.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I got these Men‚Äôs Adidas hiking shoes for a recent weeklong trip to Boquete in the mountains of Panama. Not only were they great for the hikes we went on but they were perfect for just walking around town in. I got them in a size 6.5 (my usual size in men‚Äôs shoes, I‚Äôm an 8 in women‚Äôs) which were the tiniest bit big but a thicker pair of socks remedied that. I‚Äôm glad I took a chance on them and definitely recommend them to others.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This shoes find my done so perfectly,and comfortably.I recommend buying this item', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "So I went down a rabbit hole to look for the PERFECT everyday sneaker and something that's robust and inexpensive as well. And let me tell you if you can find the right size for this shoe, it's well worth the hassle if the shoe FITS.Fit & Sizing:Now in terms of fit I unfortunately had to try THREE different sizing, to summarize- I'm normally a UK 9 (US9.5), and I saw reviews to size up but it was WAY too big for me, then ordered a size US9.5 which was OKAY, but I did the shove toes to the front of the toe box while seeing how many fingers I can put into the heel.. And it was 2 fingers (supposed to be 1 finger snugly). I tested it out walking for a whole day for about 4 miles walk and I didn't feel any fatigue from that. But the fit just felt a little off, that the heel still felt loose. I could still fit 2 fingers when doing that test. So finally I ordered a size US8.5 and YES it fits, BUT the joint above the toes (Metatarsal area) feels a little bit tight at the moment.I will update this review if it breaks in well and whether I was a lunatic to not stick with my true size. Will break in and update.Breathability:Shoes are fairly breathable. It is by no means a jogging shoe like running shoes but it's not suffocating. I'm hoping that this will be an all season shoe for me and this feels like a good balance  for this fall and hopefully the winter.Color:Ultimate dad shoe vibes- love the 90s classic aesthetic and texture (I got the Cloud White/Charcoal/Putty Grey), I'm happy this will pair with my minimalist outfits and I enjoy the simplicity of this colorway. If you're a uniqlo fan this shoe fits the bill pretty well with a lot of fits.Additional notes/Durability:Do note that I really went in the deep end to discover and research the perfect shoe not just for everyday use but also using this for occasional hikes too- because the sole is lugged (4.5mm) and it should be good for casual, occasional hikes. And also Adidas has a partnership with Continental I can attest from another a pair of Ultra Boost that these soles last a very long time. So it's amazing in terms of value- just behind VIBRAM but the shoes that have that technology tends to be a lot more expensive depending on model, around 100-200usd and above (like Hoka pricing). So I expect this shoe to last a long time.Conclusion:Don't sleep on this model, it's very underrated right now especially if it's on sale. Try it and be wary of the sizing problems. I'd say go for your true size and be prepared to go a size down, and disclaimer that everyone's feet is different.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'very narrow in the toe box. recommend going up half a size. had to return mine', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are rugged and stylish‚Äîgreat for the trails and still nice enough to wear around town. The speed-lace system is quick and secure, and the Lightstrike cushioning makes them super lightweight yet comfortable for long walks. The Continental outsole grips really well on wet or dry surfaces, which is a big plus. Just a note: if you have wide feet, they might feel a little snug at first. Overall, awesome shoes!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

These shoes function as date night and workout options.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': '*Cons about the buying experience (not the shoes themselves)-  I was excited to find these shoes for my husband, highly discounted; but did not realize I was buying shoes that were already worn before. Since he needed the shoes now, I decided to not return them, but just wanted to leave this review to let others know what I experienced. The bottoms feel like they‚Äôd be slippery, but my husband says they‚Äôre really not. The insoles are not as soft as his other pair (different style), but he says they feel like they‚Äôll be more durable!So I‚Äôd definitely leave a 5 star review for the shoes themselves, but 3-star was given simply because they were not new, as described.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these walking shoes comfortable and lightweight, with a great look and decent price. They appreciate the quality, with one customer noting they're perfect for all-day wear. The fit receives mixed feedback, with several customers mentioning they run narrow for wide feet.
review: {'review': 'Was apprehensive about ordering these. I usually order the kaptir 1 or 2 and I ordered the 3 a few months ago. They were much narrower and the sizing was off in comparisons to the 1 and 2. Brooks running shoes started to give me a pain on top of my foot. Similar to a stress fracture. So got the 3 kaptir in the closet and ran and pain went away. I like a roomy toe box when running and these 3 are not that in comparison to 1 and 2. So I ordered half a size bigger in the kaptir 3 and then also ordered my normal size in the kaptir 4 and I‚Äôm very happy with the fit the comfort and the roomy toe box. Would say so far better than the 2. Haven‚Äôt ran with them yet but will. Overall this is a great shoe. Never again will I waste money on brooks. The bad thing is a shoe might feel good when you try them on in the store and then once you run in them and spend time on your feet in them then you find out whether the shoe is great, good or horrible. I do treadmill running and the best success I‚Äôve had with brands is adidas kaptir. New balance several pairs have been horrible, Pegasus 39 have been horrible for running but great walking shoe, numerous other adidas, one time a puma. customer_say: No summary available.
review: {'review': 'I do regular walks for my health, and normally use basketball sneakers because shoes in my size are rare. I wear a 17 US Mens, and that is not often found in other sneakers. Adidas actually made these in big sizes! I found no defects in the construction, or material of the shoes. The fit is very good, the ankle support is not there is you plan on using these for cross training. However when it comes to walking they are great. They are extremely light, I mean lighter than canvas sneakers while at the same time providing a lot more cushion. If you are not used to these types of walking shoes it does take a little bit of time to get used to. It literally feels like you are walking on a memory foam mattress at first. After a couple of days I started to break them in. They feel great on asphalt, concrete, gravel, and even some uneven terrain. The price was reasonable when compared to other walking shoes with similar padding and construction. If you want to take up walking I would recommend this pair.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These shoes fit true to size and have impressively held up over nearly three weeks of wear. They remain as comfortable as the first time I put them on. What's remarkable is that I don't even need to use inserts, which is quite rare for me due to my hubby's flat feet and other foot issues.Additionally, they resist showing dirt... after wearing them in dusty conditions, they wipe clean effortlessly. I am not sure about the lights, as I chose the ones without the lights.Having learned the importance of investing in high~quality shoes for good foot health due to past issues, I can confidently say that these shoes are a fantastic value. I truly love this brand, and these shoes exemplify the quality and comfort that make them worth every penny!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These are good sneakers that fit well and have a great bounce to them.  I don't know how long the bounce will hold up, but it is really nice to use these for walking or just wearing them all day.  The size is just right and they hug the foot well.  The only issue I have is that the rise on the back of the sneaker is just a bit too high for me.  When wearing no-show socks, the back of the sneaker rubs against the back of my foot and starts to get uncomfortable.  I am comparing these to a similar running show I have from Mizuno and I like the other one better due to the better shoelace design and lower rise on the back.  Overall though, this is a very good sneaker.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I got these for my son, meant to be his next shoes after sizing up. He's currently a 5.5 so I got him the 6.5 figuring he'd size into them with growing room. These are smaller feeling on his foot then his 5.5 old shoes. He also says they are narrow and squeeze his foot. He does not have wide feet, and we've not had that problem with shoes before. I do like the look of them on him, very cool on a eleven year old. They have a nice wide heel with good stability which is good since he has some pronation in his feet. Also he doesn't often wear sandals because of his pronation, so occasionally wears sneakers without socks in the summer. These are so scratchy inside that would not be comfortable with these. In the end these feel like a mid-quality shoe, but with good sole and support. The top feels a bit lower quality, and very scratchy. Our main problem is with sizing, running a full side smaller then expected, and a bit narrow.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I‚Äôve got to say I really like Adidas sneakers and gym shoes. So when I saw these walking shoes, the design intrigued me, so I thought I‚Äôd give them a try. I‚Äôm glad I did.They not only fit my size 9 foot like a glove, but the added padding made it feel like I was walking on a cloud. I think they combine great style with comfort at a price that you‚Äôd expect to pay for a good pair of Adidas shoes.My only comment would be that though they fit my feet well, if you have an exceptionally wide foot, they might be too narrow for you.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I picked these up for my teenager.  He\'s about to start a new job where he will be on his feet all day long and a new pair of supportive shoes would certainly help.  He reports that they fit his foot exactly and he loved the style.  He walked around the house in them and he said they felt "good".  (He\'s a man of many words, that one).The laces are long enough and based on how he wears his shoes, these should last him a year or more.  We\'ve never bought Adidas for him before.  We\'ve done New Balance, Asics, and Sketchers.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These running shoes are very comfortable according to my son. They have good cushion and he likes the look of them.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My son really likes these shoes.  They fit him perfect and he says they are really comfortable. I think they look good with any outfit too.  They feature a mesh upper which helps your foot to breathe.  I think the quality is good with a thick rubber sole for support and a good grip. My son wears them everywhere, but the only complaint he has about them is that the tongue of the shoe is shaped weirdly and feels a little different. The tongue slides to the side of his foot. Other than that, I think you get a pretty good shoe for the money.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': "Fantastic shoe...I bought these having never worn Adidas running shoes. I did have an Adidas hiking shoe that was indestructible, but eventually wore out. I have been wearing Nike Pegasus for years. The Pegasus fit and feel is great, especially for a narrow foot. Price had become too costly, like most shoes. So after some time watching and reading reviews, I took a gamble on the Supernova Prima. Only a few days in to wearing, I have zero complaints. They feel like plush toys. Mind you, I walk; very little running, no high mileage, etc. just day to day wearing to work and for exercise.They are lightweight, and roomier than the Pegasus in the forefoot. I should also point out that they probably run a half size bigger. I wear a men's 12D. But I'm keeping these - colder months, room for thicker socks. The semi-gusseted tongue is also great; a soft, thin, pillowtop-esque portion of tongue is unique to this shoe. The upper is soft like a jersey feel. I wish the outsole was more like the waffle of a Nike or even had the Adidas Continental rubber, but not a dealbreaker.I put non-custom orthotics in mine. Heel feels cushiony and ball of foot is the same, bounce like.I'll admit the hyper turquoise accent color is awful. And if you go for the most current model, color selection is terrible. Not sure why Adidas would choose chain gang gray/highlighter and light communist gray as the 2 color options instead of anything else, but they did.If I can update review after 3 months, I can speak to durability. Will be walking in these all summer. Feet happy.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great shoe I am 63 280 pounds and right out of the box. I did a 3 mile jog on the street and the shoe handled like a champ.!!!!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Son muy c√≥modas aunque las ped√≠ talla 11 porque en otras marcas esa es mi talla y me quedaron un poquito grandes pero bueno al final eso no es motivo para no usarlas les sugerir√≠a pedirlas media talla menos ya que vienen algo m√°s grande', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'No', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

product: adidas Men's Terrex Free 2 Low Gtx Hiking
customer_say: Customers find these hiking shoes comfortable, well-made, and durable, with one customer noting they perform well on various terrains. They provide good support, with one review mentioning confidence on loose rocks and uneven surfaces, and offer great grip and traction. While some customers find them true to size, others report they run too big, and customers disagree on the weight.
review: {'review': "I am absolutely delighted with my new Adidas hiking shoes, which I purchased specifically for a recent hiking trip to Estes Park, Colorado. From the moment I laced them up, I knew these shoes were going to be a game-changer, and they certainly proved their worth on the challenging trails.My primary requirements for hiking footwear are comfort and support, and these Adidas shoes delivered outstandingly on both fronts. The cushioning provides excellent comfort, absorbing the impact of each step, while the robust construction offers superior ankle and arch support, which is crucial for long days on the trail. One small note on sizing: I found that the sizing was a bit off, and I actually had to size down to get the perfect fit.I put these shoes through an extensive test, hiking between 8 and 11 miles each day through the rugged and rocky terrain of Estes Park. Despite the demanding conditions, my feet remained comfortable and well-protected. There was no slipping, rubbing, or discomfort, even after many hours of continuous use. The grip on the soles was exceptional, providing confidence on loose rocks and uneven surfaces.These shoes truly stood up to the challenge, proving to be incredibly durable and reliable. They not only protected my feet from the harsh ground but also contributed significantly to my overall enjoyment and stamina during the hikes.Overall, if you're planning a hiking adventure, especially one involving rocky or demanding trails, I cannot recommend these Adidas hiking shoes highly enough. They offer a perfect blend of comfort, support, and durability, making them an indispensable companion for any serious hiker.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Per many other reviews these shoes run really large. I normally wear an eight or an 8 1/2 in hiking and running shoes. The first pair I bought were eights which I thought would be small enough. They were huge. I returned those for a 7 1/2. I have wide feet and even the 7 1/2 is a smidge large. I ran out of time for a trip and kept them instead of trying an even smaller size. I have plenty of room in the toe box. I can‚Äôt imagine these would work for anyone with narrow to maybe even moderately narrow feet. I also don‚Äôt have much arch. I wear Hoka Gaviotas- if you have those you‚Äôll love these.  If you can find the right fit, these are very comfortable right out of the box and a great hiker. I hiked in Costa Rica in muddy and wet dirt and had zero issues. Grip and traction was great. There was no break-in needed-  no blisters or tired feet.  They cleaned up well. ( I do wish manufacturers would stop using white bottoms on hiking shoes. It‚Äôs a given you‚Äôll be in brown dirt- why white?) I also wore these all day traveling and in airports. Seriously comfy shoe.  I wasn‚Äôt a fan of the green color in the 8.5 - they looked a little garish. I wish all manufacturers had more neutral, natural colors.  I went to black in the second pair and much preferred that look albeit they‚Äôre  a little boring. If you have feet like mine shoe shopping can be really frustrating. I went to REI and many other stores before giving up and going to Amazon. (Oddly I didn‚Äôt find Hoka hikers comfortable. Too much arch) I do think it‚Äôs worth trying to find the right size in these because in the end if you have wide flattish feet these are great for trails and even day to day. That‚Äôs why I gave them 5 stars.One note- the rear pull strap is quite high.  While it didn‚Äôt bother me a ton I can see how it might bother others.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These hiking shoes run larger than other brands, see my picture comparing them to several other brands I own that are the same size (size 8.) However, they are so comfy and my feet appreciated the extra room on my hike. My right foot typically can only stand a 45 minute hike before the ball of foot starts to throb and swell throbs. I took these out on a hour and 15 minute hike and only had mild pain. They performed very well on a variety of terrain. No slippage on sand, loose dirt, grass, or compact gravel, even in hills. There was minor slippage on loose rocksthat where about 1"-2" diameter when going downhill. The shoe also seemed to give my weak ankles more support. There was one point where I slipped slightly and felt my ankle wanted to turn, however the shoe prevented it. My old hiking shoes don\'t come up high enough on the ankle and my foot would have turned over for sure. If you\'re someone who has feet that ache and seem to swell when you hike, I would recommend sticking to your normal size. Otherwise you might want to size down. Personally, I\'m glad they run a little big so my toes don\'t press against the shoe, which always seemed to happen when I\'d walk down hills. My feet didn\'t seem to slide around in the extra room like I was worried they would either.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I like and wear a roomier size 8 in my Brooks running shoes but usually do a 7.5 in many other shoes. I bought the 7.5 for these after reading reviews about size. They were too big and I had to send back to get a 7. They are insanely comfortable and a perfect trail shoe when hiking boots are too much but tennis shoes aren‚Äôt quite enough. These are more comfortable than typical trail running shoes and are a bit heavier. They have as good as or better traction and grip than other similar shoes (way more than OnClouds and about the same as Altra). They have a wide toe box and thick sole padding. They‚Äôre a great hiking shoe or for walking off road or in mud and rain, as they‚Äôre waterproof. Love them! They do look a little bulky on, so if that bothers you, you may want to look elsewhere.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The light blue and orange shoes are not water proof . The other options that have Gor Tex labeled on the shoe are . The light blue are comfortable and true to size . I had to return mine due to them not being waterproof.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': 'This is my second pair of Adidas Ultra Boost DNA shoes and I hope it never gets discontinued!All I can say is Adidas really hit the ballpark with this shoe. I‚Äôve never worn a shoe as multifunctional and durable as Ultra boost DNA.‚úÖStylish for casual wearing‚úÖComfortable for traveling‚úÖWalking and running sprintsMy first pair lasted about 2 years. It was the pair of shoes I used to travel, walk, and simply wear for an everyday casual wearing. Just on the walking part alone I put no less than 500 miles.I slip in these when I travel. I can literally wear them for multiple days without worry my feet would eventually start to hurt. Trust me I‚Äôve done 24+ itineraries there‚Äôs no other shoe that can match these in comfort. It looks stylish and slick, they never seem out of place.They are soft but will keep you grounded. If you prone to getting your ankles sprained these shoes are perfect. Both, toe box and heel are wide and will keep your ankles from accidentally twisting one way or another.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Not just a nice looking pair of sneakers, this is very comfortable, lightweight and very breathable. A little narrower than I'm used to for Adidas.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'After one year of use, this is a great shoe. I think it is probably the most comfortable walking shoe out but please for all thats good and holy dont use these as running shoes. They will blister and wear your feet out quick. Knowing that, you will love this shoe.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I've been an ultraboost fan for a decade, and I've owned more than 10 pairs. The all black pair has always been my safe shoe with black jeans for casual looks and they blend in nice for a casual work look too. I bought a pair of the 5x ultraboost about 4 months ago, and within the first month, they were already falling apart. the bottom of the shoe was slowly peeling off, the black around the edge of the base ripped off too, I've never had a pair fall apart so quickly.Fast forward to now, I buy the 1.0 because they're more similarly shaped to ultraboosts I've purchased in the past because I'm going on a long vacation and need great walking shoes. I wore these to a baseball game to break them in and after mostly sitting, my left foot was killing me for a week. I tried loosening them, but no matter what the material under the tongue DRIVES into the top of your foot and hurts so much. That was two weeks ago, and I just told myself I need to break them in... WRONG! They still hurt and my foot is killing me. Money wasted, and now I need to find a new walking shoe because Adidas' quality has completely tanked.", 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These are amazing. They‚Äôre my third pair. I highly recommend these for a comfortable, fashionable, & supportive style shoe.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one noting a significant difference in soreness, and appreciate their support for people with foot pain. review: {'review': "I picked up the Ultraboost 22 mainly for jogging, and they've been fantastic. review: {'review': 'These got good reviews in a running magazine and they were spot on. I‚Äôm a larger guy but these have a great amount of support. Made well and by far the best running shoes I‚Äôve ever owned.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are high quality and fit incredible. I love the feel of the cushioning as I walk and run. It helps propel me into the next stride with the utmost confidence. These shoes have a great style and the fit true to size.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Good shoes, kinda ugly heel but they get more comfy as i walk and i prefer them over my old daily runners.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great shoe, great deal!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The original Ultraboost 1.0 just look far superior to these new revisions. That being said, you can definitely feel the extra lift and comfort these provide. I feel like my strides are light and I get a lot of cushioning. I have walked dozens of miles in a day with these and enjoyed myself at concerts and shows too with no foot ache or cramp to speak of afterwards. Just wish they looked a bit more sleek like the original run, but you get the benefit of comfort and performance for a great daily walker and they\'re priced well enough you can beat on it without feeling bad. I\'d likely pickup another pair just to rotate designs and keep them both looking a bit less beat up overtime. If you are looking for ideal running shoes, these are not bad but you are probably better served with something for even more high-impact that doesn\'t completely "deaden" the floor underneath you with the cushioning while still providing good return for energy spent. In other words, these are light, but not light enough for performance running, but in the excellent sweet spot for daily wear and even easy jogging, basketball, and light sports or long hikes on even terrain (I would recommend more proper trail shoes with better grip for more imbalanced terrain).', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Estas zapatillas las he utilizado y me han parecido muy c√≥modas, se adaptan perfectamente a mi pie. Una de las cosas que me ha gustado mucho ha sido su peso el cual se siente m√°s ligero.Anteriormente notaba que despu√©s del entreno de 10k o 15k, la planta de mis pies quedaban adolorida; Ahora con las ultraboost esa molestia ha desaparecido.Para mis jornadas diarias de 10km son perfectas, c√≥modas y una excelente amortiguaci√≥n lo cual se refleja en confort.Un aspecto a tener en cuenta, es que la zapatilla es bastante ajustada, debes considerar si tu pie tiene un empeine alto y si la planta del pie es ancho; te recomendar√≠a una talla superior a tu  talla normal.  De resto es una zapatilla S√∫per recomendada.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excelente', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Additional: 05/13/24... The shoe is very comfortable and now after several days of walking I very much like the shoe, cept for the difficulty putting it on.The shoe is light, has a great sole for balance, although I do find it a bit hot and I suggest it better if the front area of the foot were vented mesh. The actual small area on the top does not really vent the heat from my feet adequately.At this point, 2 days after receipt, the only issue I see is the shoe is without question the most difficult to put on shoe I have ever owned.There are no finger loops on the heel nor tongue.Without finger loops you are forced to awkwardly spear the front of your foot into the shoe and employ either you fingers (sucks) or in my case a long handled shoe horn to slide your foot into the shoe.More to come as further investigation is allowed.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and true to size, with amazing cushioning and a great look. They are particularly good for walking and exercise, and one customer mentions they're ideal for mowing and yard work. The durability receives mixed feedback - while some find them durable, others report they fell apart within two months. The fit is also mixed, with some finding them nice while others note they're not wide enough.
review: {'review': 'These are my favorite shoes right now. They are comfortable and hold up well throughout the day. I get the men‚Äôs because they seem wider and more supportive than the women‚Äôs.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I've been wearing these shoes since I believe October 2023 (a few days after total hip replacement surgery). Other then being more dirty, they are still just as comfortable with everything in perfect condition more than a year later. I did research on good shoes for after the surgery and what is good to have, and for someone my age it mainly just seemed like having something with cushion and such that you didn't fall was most important.These shoes look great - I chose the black color as they're a bit more muted to suit my personal preference. These are wider with the soles which took a little bit of remeasuring to get used to when walking the first couple times, but then it was an afterthought. The cushioning is amazing! These are super comfortable. I've always been athletic until pretty much COVID, then the hip issue, and I've loved the Adidas brand, so have been perfect!These helped through the initial post-surgery steps, through physical therapy, through regaining my strength, and now with regular daily walking and whatnot.Definitely not waterproof, but perhaps waterproofing spray may help a bit. I live in the PNW so it rains when it's not the other season, but it hasn't bothered me yet.Bottom-line: Well-worth the purchase, definitely great for rehabilitation purposes, great for walking and stability.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "This is my second pair of these shoes. I bought the first pair two years ago to take on a vacation to France and they were so good that this year I bought another pair, for you guessed it, another European vacation. What initially attracted me to these is that they are subtle yet comfortable. Yes, you can wear whatever shoes you want but in Europe, people tend to dress better, and their shoes are less flamboyant but still comfortable for hours and miles of walking. The purple is very subdued, and I have no problem wearing these just about anywhere. They're an ideal travel shoe because they are lightweight, breathable and supportive, all while being a fantastic value for the price. The name Ultrabounce conjures up thoughts of springy marshmallow comfort. I would say that's not entirely accurate. Yes, the shoes are comfortable but they are not crazy soft (like Hoka or some of the other super cushioned options out there)  and I think that's a good thing; they're cushioned enough to be comfortable but supportive enough to take care of your feet. What I also like about them is the way they fit. I have notoriously difficult feet to fit; I have narrow feet with high arches. While many companies are embracing the wider is better, especially in the toebox, these Adidas Ultrabounce runners have a welcomed medium to slightly narrow fit, perfect for me. In terms of size, I wear a size 12 in Nike and Asics; an 11.5 in Brooks and the 11.5 in these fit me perfectly. So why only 4 stars? I'm being picky, the insole is very basic and could do with more arch support; also, and this is a small thing, the laces are really long, they could be a little shorter. I worry that these will be discontinued, which would be a shame since they've become my go-to travel shoe and I bet that most people will appreciate them too. Buy them if you still can!", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Comfy shoe with great look. Im hoping to use these for biking and running. My favorite brand shoe with a prefect appearance.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Men‚Äôs 10.5. Good shoes. Nice durability to fabric on outer shoe. These are a great shoe for someone moving around, crouching, walking, jumping. I did add gel sole inserts for the pair I wear to work due to the intensity and concrete floor surface, but the pair I got in another color fits exactly the same and for casual wear they are perfectly comfortable for everyday use and extended walking. Not to narrow and not too wide. Comfortable toe box area. And good heal lock. Require minimum breaking in.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Muy bueno', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Me encant√≥, muy c√≥modos y la talla es la correcta', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The shoes is very comfortable but the white shoe was as white. Great for comfort but the color was off', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'}

review: {'review': "COZY. PERIOD. These are my second pair you see them overseas in addidas stores and they are definitely a clean look.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My favorite shoes in the world, glad I can still buy them somewhere. review: {'review': 'Made of good quality material.  Good fit for my feet.  Very comfortable to wear.  Nice style and good look.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Do I like them? Hell yeah! This is my third pair of Swift run twos. In case you don't know these are slip-on sneakers. They have laces but they are just to Snug the sneakers up and not really to hold them on your feet per se. In case you have not worn sneakers like this before you may be surprised to find out that the tongue is attached to the shoe so don't let that throw you if you're going to order these. They do fit nicely on the foot as long as you get your regular size so there's nothing to worry about. They're quite comfortable and fit like a dream in my opinion that's why I have three pairs of them now. And the price is certainly reasonable. I didn't pay more than $50 a pair for any of my three pairs of Swift run twos. And actually got one pair for $38 delivered free. So what's not to like? Comfortable attracted to deal with shoes under 50 bucks that I will get at least 3 years out of. I consider that to be a super cool volume shoes that fit good and look great. Highly recommended! One thing though I would say that these would be more suited to a casual shoe than possibly a serious running shoe. Not much of a heel counter here. But if you're looking for a cool shoe to wear with jeans this is the bomb.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The sneakers are of good quality and comfortable. They were delivered a day ahead of schedule. I‚Äôm returning them because they are too big. I listened to some of the reviews saying that they run small. I ordered a half size up instead of going with the Amazon size recommendation. I wear size 11, and ordered 11.5. The 11.5 was too long. So go with your true size for a perfect fit. I‚Äôll be reordering them in size 11.JW', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Comfy but runs a bit small. I usually wear an 11 especially with adidas but this 11 feels tight. I'd order half a size up if I were you", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excelente producto', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I love adidas shoes normally, but the opening to these are tiny. Putting them on takes 10 minutes, hurts your fingers, your feet, and shifts the cushioning around making the shoes all weird. I ended up cutting the tongue section on the sides and taking out the laces just so I didn't have to spend half of my day trying to put these on.", 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'As described comfortable great cushions for feet my son loves them', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I am disabled and really struggled to get these on, but once I did I knew I was keeping them. I considered sending them back because the back of the shoe kept getting stuck under my heel, I almost needed a shoe horn! Finally I goy ahold of the little loop back there and pulled them on........ HEAVEN! These have got to be the most cushy shoes I have ever had, plus they look hella nice. I have had some nice shoes, but these are just... Wow! I have some Adidas Kaptirs as well and they support the heck out of your heels and arches, but these Run 22s are just like walking on a cloud all over. They don't exactly support separate areas, just pad your feet as a whole. I feel like I am walking on clouds! Even after 2 hours of treadmill at the gym, my feet still feel great. If you can catch them on sale, these pups are tite and feel great... just tough to get on.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these sneakers well-made, comfortable, and stylish. The fit and sizing receive mixed feedback - while some say they're true to size, others mention the 8.5 size runs a bit tight at first.
review: {'review': "I love these so far.  First day with them.From what I can tell they are an Adidas entry into the lifestyle shoe trend and borrow styling from 1970's running and track shoes.  I certainly wouldn't run with these, but as a daily wear shoes they kind of speak to, yes, I was a decent if mediocre track runner years ago and I still weekend warrior run into middle age and am doing ok with it (albeit with a separate, dedicated set of shoes).  If you flip these over the soles have circles that to me evoke the sockets that you would screw your metal track spikes into.I tried on the Adidas SL 72 RS, a more true to original lifestyle form of a once popular track shoe.  Those are tighter and maybe fit more like a pair you would lace up to run track with in school. These are a bit looser fitting, so perhaps a bit better for a daily wear.What is present on both is a canvas vinyl type material that is perhaps true to the heritage.  However, some wearers seem to not like how the material does not bend and flex along the more pliable suede overlays.  To me it's just a characteristic, but it's there.  If you're curious about how it may look after you worn the shoes take a look at photos submitted by other reviewers.But me I love these!  Love the fit, the comfort, the vibe.  It's what I was looking for.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great product !!..very comfortable & stylish!!..love Adidas!!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I am a big fan of Adidas and these are great every day sneakers. Might be my fourth or even fifth pair of them always fit great and last a long time once he‚Äôs wear out, I‚Äôll get another pair.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'It‚Äôs ok', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Comfortable, stylish, fun colors and attract a lot of complements. True to size, but felt tight until I loosened the laces a bit.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice and comfortable with a touch of style', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Size 8.5 fit a little tight at first but still fit good love the shoes, great quality. If you have a very wide foot they may be s little tight in the width', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Nice shoes but size is tight on the toe box I have to return it', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'}
