customer_say: Customers find these sandals comfortable, good-looking, and amazing for their price, with good quality and cushioning in the soles. However, the fit receives mixed feedback, with some finding them perfect while others say they run narrow. Moreover, durability is also mixed, with some saying they hold up great while others report them falling apart after few wears. Additionally, the size receives negative feedback, with customers noting they run bigger than expected.
review: {'review': "I remember seeing these as a kid on my friend and some adults and thought to try them, I was a fan of Adidas as I loved the originals sneakers collection and one of my teachers had spoke about how the shoe felt like indoor cleats, I thought to finally try them.A great pair of shoes especially for the money, I probably wore these shoes over a thousand times too, to the point where there were holes and I had to get rid of them a few weeks ago. My first reaction when I got the shoes was that they were very light, at first you kind of have to break them in. They may seem a bit snug and may hurt a little bit. Perhaps it hurted me more than others because I have flat feet. After a week when you break them in, they sort of shape to your feet. It will feel comfortable and you'll feel as light as a feather, the shoes are great for athletics and they are very aesthetically pleasing, more so I liked how the shoe was rather versatile. If I wanted to wear some chinos, or some casual wear it wouldn't look to bad infact it would play the part. what I absolutely loved about these sneakers is how you can simply slip them on, I always hated those sneakers that you had to untie and worry about the shoe getting creases and what not. I however found that after a while, the shoe felt like it was slipping off and that it may have expanded during the time I was wearing, again nothing too big but it felt like it grew about 1/2 over the time I had it.  This became my go to shoe whenever I was leaving, I didn't even dare look at the others as my feet had gone through so much uncomfort when I went back. The shoe can get rather slippery in the winter and on wet areas so you need to be careful there but it's not like they're meant to be used during the winter. One of the things that I disliked about the shoe is how I had to keep on tying the laces several times, perhaps this had to with the laces mainly but I felt like it was the shoe moving from place to place as it started to expand and stretch. During the shoes last dying dies, I start to get holes from the ongoing times I've worn it, I knew it wouldn't last the way I treated it but for $40+ I didn't very much care. I later discovered that the inside of the shoes is composed of mainly some kind of cardboard, kind of surprising how such a comfortable fit could be made from such cheap material.I would recommend these to a friend, perhaps you may not want to wear them as much as I did however if you plan on making them last but it's great and with a price like that. You can't really go wrong. Would I buy them again however, there are many other shoes in the market and I'm willing to try many and see where they take me but I will have flashbacks of all the events that I had with my pair of shoes. I never begun to adore a shoe like that, no matter how much damage and dirt and stretching it went through, it managed and still had an amazing authentic look.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'TL;DR: Great shoes, will mold to fit you like a glove, and last for at least a year of heavy use. Get the Samba Originals if you prefer a short tongue.About me: I\'m on my fourth pair of Samba Classics. In a row. I love this shoe, and I think you will too. That being said, here\'s what I think you need to know:I first started wearing these shoes because I needed something with a flat sole to dance in (I did musicals in high school, and I wore straight through a pair of running shoes), and I fell completely in love with them. I wear them 100% of the time when it isn\'t raining and there isn\'t snow on the ground. I have also worn them for their "intended purpose" - indoor soccer - and find they work great there too.I would DEFINITELY recommend these shoes for serious walking, dancing, or indoor soccer. NOTE WELL: they will mold to your feet as if you were born wearing them, and will change their appearance somewhat once broken in (the leather will look a lot less shiny, and will develop a flatter fit across your foot), in my opinion much for the better. Like all leather shoes, these have a break in period, and I find it\'s less than a week. Once broken in, they feel AWESOME, and last a very long time: my last three pairs lasted between 1 year and 1.5 years each, depending on the amount of walking I did (walking increased when I went to college). They\'re also very comfortable walking / standing shoes. I\'ve never gotten blisters or pains from them.I would NOT recommend these shoes for rain, snow, ice, hiking, or serious running. The flat sole, which makes them great for traction on flat, dry surfaces, falls short on all of these things. Since they are leather, they\'re fairly water resistant, and a coat of water repellent spray will make them very water resistant (and avoid winter salt water stains), but water WILL get in around the tongue, which is not attached at the sides, only at the front.These shoes tend to wear in two places: the interior heel (the back of the inside lining), which will develop holes if you\'re a fan of slipping your shoes on and off (which I don\'t recommend: these are leather, they\'re meant to be tied snug); and the sole, which will gradually wear toward smooth. I find that the sole and the upper wear at about the same rate: i.e. by the time the sole is worn to the point of noticeable slippage on wet surfaces, the shoes themselves look like they\'re ready to be replaced. If you don\'t care about these two factors (or you want a pair of old shoes to work in), they will basically last forever. I still use my first pair for construction, painting, and mowing the lawn. They\'re over four years old and the leather will probably outlast everything else in my life.These shoes are essentially identical to the Samba Originals, the difference being that these have a longer tongue. Some people don\'t like the tongue, which is reminiscent of soccer cleats, but I like it because it makes the shoes pop a bit more, and goes well with long casual pants, with which you can wear the tongue outside of the pants (the tongue is also not uncomfortable with shorts, especially after it gets bent forward a bit by being worn with long pants).', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I got this pair of Adidas on sale, and I love them they are so comfy,  and pair with just about anything. There are a little heavy compared to running shoes not by much. They  look amazing and fit me perfect,  l ware size 10 , what a deal. THANK YOU AMAZON AND ADIDAS...', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Fits perfectly, looks nice, bit tight on the top/bridge, but discomfort goes away after week of wearing. Comfy on beach, at home, pool, any situation. I wear 38 European, but when it comes to Adidas, or Nike I wear 40, dunno why but my size never fits me. Consider to order size and half up if you‚Äôre choosing by your EU size', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Physical Therapist thought they were an excellent choice. Podiatrist thought otherwise. They‚Äôre good in my opinion but quite pricey. For the cost, they ought to be nothing short of perfection.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I typically wear a women‚Äôs size 8 and ordered these in youth 6.5 and they‚Äôre perfect! I get so many compliments on the color combo. They‚Äôre very comfy for all day teaching. They can easily be dressed up or down. I‚Äôve worn them with jeans, shorts and dresses. I found that adding a tiny bit of lotion to the tongue prevents the squeak.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Can't believe all of the compliments I've gotten about these shoes. I use them on a regular basis for work and play. I don't work out in them, but I think they could work fine for a  low milage runner who does not pronate or subinate.I bought these during Eagles playoffs last year, and then bought a red pair for the Phillies regular season this year. Unfortunately, the red is more of a pink so I returned them.Size is standard. I generally wear a size 12 and these are a size 12 and fit perfectly.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I bought these to match my son‚Äôs football team!  Turns out they are actually really comfortable!  Big fan of adidas now!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these trail running shoes comfortable with no blisters and appreciate their durability, with one customer noting they held up through 15K of mud. The shoes offer good grip on gravelly trails and no slipping issues during tours, while also receiving positive feedback for their style and accurate sizing. The arch support receives mixed reviews, with some customers finding it supportive for long days.
review: {'review': 'Why did you pick this product vs others?:I chose these specifically for a Tough Mudder 15K. I needed something lightweight, trail-ready, and supportive enough for hours of running, climbing, and wading through deep mud ‚Äî and they delivered big time.I absolutely adore these shoes. They held up through 15K of mud, water, obstacles, and nonstop movement. I was knee-deep in 2.5 feet of mud for much of the race, and not once did they slip, rub, or make my feet ache. The tread was fantastic for trail grip, and the arch support was just as good as what I get from my Danskos or Brooks ‚Äî which I wear daily at my hospital job where I‚Äôm on my feet for 8+ hours.These didn‚Äôt just survive the course ‚Äî they thrived on it. No blisters, no soreness, and they cleaned up surprisingly well post-race. Highly recommend for anyone doing obstacle races, trail runs, or just needing a solid, supportive shoe for long days.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Really comfortable walking/hiking (simple hiking), shoes. Nice they can be thrown in the washing machine and not fall apart. They dry quickly, very important, grip the ground well, and cleaning the bottoms off isn‚Äôt too bad. The arch support is a little weak, but it‚Äôs difficult to generally fit everyone‚Äôs feet. I‚Äôd say they‚Äôve been a great value for my money as I have walked in them for many miles, and the tread, fabric, and laces are still like new.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'lived these but they ran big. I had to return it', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes seem very tough -they are pretty heavy and stiff - saying that, they are pretty comfortable. We got them for a trip to Mongolia where we didn‚Äôt know what to expect in terms of terrain. These handles everything perfectly. I expected these to sort of break in after over a week of constant use, but they stayed the exact same shape and quality as the day that I got them. They got a little dusty, but they still look brand new.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Comfy, larger toe box so you can wear thick socks if needed. Cute and lightweight. Good support.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Item came previously used. They were repackaged with generic plastic bags and had no tags. They also came with some hair.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I am consistently a size 7M, but I sized down to 6 1/2; they fit perfectly on me. They are comfortable', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'So confortable and nice i love them', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

They feel great for awhile but long walks, like mall shopping or tourist trips are not recommended. After awhile your feet will start to hurt and you can‚Äôt wait to take them off.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I have narrow feet and heels usually have problems with shoes coming loose at the heel and ankle area. I purchased these based on some of the reviews that stated that these shoes ran small/narrow. The problem is that the elastic appearing band at the arch of the shoe is actually not elastic and appears to be more of a cosmetic touch. Even with my narrow feet, I had problems getting my foot into the shoe without a fair amount of effort assisted by a shoe horn. The band is relatively rigid and places a great deal of constriction in the midfoot area and along the inner arch of the foot. Once my foot is in the shoe, this constriction is very obvious and yet the heel/ankle area remain loose. This is a very non-anatomically sized shoe. The length appears to be true to fit, its just this midfoot band that is extremely uncomfortable. Also, the sole of this shoe is very stiff. It is not at all flexible unlike what you would normally expect in a casual slip on shoe. I was very disappointed as I liked the cosmetics of the shoe. Unfortunately, I have to say that this is one of the most uncomfortable shoes that I have ever purchased. I should have heeded the negative reviews that talked about how uncomfortable these shoes are. I just thought that it was because people had purchased the wrong size shoe. However, it is the construction and design of the shoe that makes it ill-fitting and uncomfortable. Perhaps that is why they are discounted so much. I have owned several pair of Adidas shoes (in the past they tended to fit well as they tended to accommodate narrower feet like mine). However, this is the first Adidas shoe style that I could not wear (in the proper 8.5 size) due to extreme discomfort. Again, quit a disappointment as I thought that I could snag a ‚Äúdeal‚Äù as I really liked the sleek and clean look of the shoe. Will definitely be returning after just trying them on for 3-5 minutes.', 'rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "They feel like the modern Vans slip-on.. I'm guessing as durable (haven't had them long), and they cool just a bit cooler tbh.. worth the money for sure", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I got a pair of Adidas Nizza shoes for the same price that were very similar to these...at least it seemed. I just wanted a simple pair of white slip on shoes for sunny summer days. They are white, and slip on, but it gets pretty disappointing after that.The band on the side that is supposed to flex is more of a visual gimmick, which makes walking uncomfortable when it's combined with the shoe's unusual tight width.On the bright side- they'll stay clean for longer because I'll barely wear them. Realistically- I wish I had spent $10 more and gotten basic white shoes that I can wear without pain.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Love em as a casual shoe. They look good and they feel good.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "This shoe has a low top arch.  Did not fit.  I returned it as per Amazon's directions.  After months of calls to customer service to state these shoes were returned.  Amazon custmer service does not understand.  They have now charged me for a pair os shoes I returned.  Horrible customer service.", 'rating': '2.0 out of 5 stars'}

Cross shop and consider Merrell as an alternative.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'My son said these are the most comfortable shoes!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I ordered these Adidas Captor Flow 2.0 sneakers for my 10 year old niece knowing that school will be starting next month and she will want a new pair of sneakers. There are several color combos to order from and I debated about ordering the white with the fluorescent pink and yellow but white sneakers get so dirty and I knew they would be dirty in a week so I opted for the gray with purple combo.These sneakers are a tight knit, breathable mesh and the shoe is in one piece, no tongue, with man made leather eyestays with purple loops and tie laces. There is a high heel tab which makes putting them on a little easier although I have a pair of Adidas shoes with the high tab in the back and I needed to buy heel tab socks to prevent rubbing on the top of my heel, she wear ankle socks so it shouldn‚Äôt be a problem. There is also a heel reinforcement as well as an extra rubber tab at the toes although she is rough on sneakers so I am not sure these will help. The inner sole is their patented Cloudfoam for cushioning and these shoes have a decent arch as well. The sole is white with a touch of purple to match the shoes and it‚Äôs constructed of the typical foam soles you find in most sneakers these days, it feels hollow but it‚Äôs a lightweight synthetic foam rubber.These shoes are nicely constructed and my niece really likes the style of this shoe, it‚Äôs current and she even likes the grey and purple color combo  (she usually almost always picks out pink!). The price point is about average for brand name kids sneakers but these Kaptir Flow 2.0 sneakers are nice quality and my niece said they are super comfortable so the price is a good value. Overall, she gave them two thumbs up!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

Strangely, the tag says the size US 8 is equivalent to size EU/FR 40 (which is actually a 9) and it seems that the true sizing aligns with the EU size that is listed on the tag rather than the US size.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The design and color looked very elegant and stylish to me and I ordered the size reading customer reviews.I usually wear 6.5 but I ordered the size 6.5 (wide ) to keep some extra space and flexibility between my fingers for extra comfort. It has very soft cushioning and soft rubber soul which made the shoe very comfortable to wear.I stood on my foot for hours with great comfort..Worth paying for it..Would recommend everyone to buy.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I don‚Äôt write many reviews, but sometimes you have to. The sizing of these shoes is a joke. I ordered my regular 9.5 size after carefully following Adidas‚Äô guidance: place a piece of paper on the floor against the wall, mark where your big toe hits, and find your size on the chart. Cool.They arrived last week, and they looked and fit like clown shoes. I hate returning items ‚Äî more trucks on the road, more cardboard waste ‚Äî but the shoes looked great, and I needed a new pair. So, I ordered a full size down, even though I‚Äôve never been an 8.5 in my life.They arrived today, and again, they‚Äôre huge! Length, width ‚Äî even the laces are double the length they should be. Adidas really messed up with this one, and it‚Äôs not a cheap shoe either. I gave them 2 stars because they‚Äôre nice-looking, but they‚Äôre completely useless.', 'rating': '2.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I returned these. They seemed too big and clunky looking, but I really wanted the retro look. The white sole stood out too much and was just big.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Son anchos y muy c√≥modos pero me quedaron grandes. A√∫n as√≠ los uso para caminar.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes to be well-made and comfortable, with good cushioning and light weight. They appreciate the support, with one customer noting they feel like they're being propelled forward, and another mentioning they're great for daily training for marathons. The shoes are versatile, working well for both fast and slow running paces.
review: {'review': 'As a midfoot striker, I needed a stiffer trainer with solid energy return. I got exactly that with these, and they survived well past 500 miles through easy runs, tempo workouts, and long runs. They fit the best for tempos and workouts, although the soles may be a tad too stiff for people who prefer a little more cushioning. These also weigh in nice and light; likely getting the newer gens as time goes as a preferred tempo trainer.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excelente producto', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Adidas has done a great job with this shoes! I am floored on the energy return, the overall comfortableness, and overall grip/durability of these shoes! For a non-carbon plated shoes, these definitely feels like they have one. I've done long runs (10 miles or more) in these shoes as well as 5k races, and they are amazing. I used to be a Nike Vaporfly fan, but due to a past injury that keeps flaring up, I couldn't wear them anymore, and so I decided to give these a shot, and boy they felt amazing. Plus, they don't give me that 'hot shoe' foot feel (nor blisters) after my runs unlike my Nike Vaporfly ones. Really happy with these shoes. Only down side though is the sizing. I'm usually a 10 for Adidas (I have their boost, their yeezy, their stans, you name it) but this is the first time I have to size half up, so I got the 10.5 ones, and they fit perfect.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This is a very aggressive shoe for a fast pace.Great cushion and amazing force return.Sizes run a little on the large size (about 1size)', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Me quedaron un poco grandes y son bastantes r√≠gidos pero muy buena calidad de materiales', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Got the men‚Äôs size one size down for female. Great shoes', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Wow. It‚Äôs all I can say to summarize. WHY did no one ever tell me about this shoe? Why is it not top of all these YouTubers lists?I have gone through so many shoes. Lightweight ones, max cushion, racers, and let me tell you if I could start over and have 1 shoe, THIS is it.I didn‚Äôt even notice this shoe on my 8 mile long slow run at 11:00/mile easy pace. It zoomed right on during 4:30/mile pace strides. It handled my 8:00 tempo pace with ease. Everything about this shoe executes without complication. It is simply seamless.I don‚Äôt mean to glaze, I‚Äôm just genuinely so impressed.This is a firmer shoe. If you weigh 110lbs I don‚Äôt know that you‚Äôll like it. As an average 175lb guy, this is money. It has a lot of bounce with the foam and the rods (used instead of a plate). The continental outsole grip is insane and super planted. Very stable as well.The upper is not perfect. I need a runners loop to get a semi decent heel lock down. Not a deal breaker, everything else is 10/10.If someone asked me what shoe do I buy for all of my runs I‚Äôd tell them this. New runner? This. First 5K, 10K or half shoe? This. Long run shoe? This. Daily? You get the idea lol.I‚Äôm about to order like 2 more of these.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'In love with these shoes', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes aesthetically pleasing and appreciate their lightweight design. The fit receives mixed feedback from customers.
review: {'review': 'No era numero perfectoüòÖ', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This is a light and comfortable shoe!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Awesome fit perfect', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The sneaker itself is exactly as you‚Äôd expect, aesthetically speaking. HOWEVER, the INSOLE is unacceptable. How‚Äôre you going to advertise how comfortable your sneakers are but then fail to provide the insert that is assumed to be the source of the advertised comfort?The stitching (for my personal foot) ran under my 4th toe, meaning that my pinky toe technically wasn‚Äôt on the traced insert. The stitching used is obviously good quality, but is usually only seen if you lift the insert of the sneaker. But as stated before, there is no insert (imo) so now I‚Äôm expected to buy an additional product to accommodate what I thought would naturally just be a part of a sneaker to be purchased by me, the consumer. I did not realize that the cloud comfort foam is not meant to be directly felt by my feet, but rather an insert that is not included with the sneakers themselves, and must be purchased individually (that doesn‚Äôt even consider that ‚Äúthe right insert‚Äù might be hard to find for any multitude of reasons $).', 'rating': '2.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The shoes are lightweight and look like the picture. My issue is the inner lining is weird near the toes. It‚Äôs like there is no padding under the toes. Honestly, it feels like these didn‚Äôt pass the quality assurance test to be ‚Äúreal‚Äù adidas.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I don't use these for working out, but they're good for everyday wear.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This is our 2nd pair and both pair have made a popping noise when walking. Look cute and fit like expected but overall disappointing', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I got these shoes for walking, jogging, and working out. I hadn‚Äôt planned to use them for running races or anything intense, but expected them to be more supportive than they are. They showed up without a shoebox, which I found odd, and although I like my workout shoes to be lightweight, these feel like the inside of a shoe, rather than a full shoe (thin, not durable, cheaply made). I can feel the ground under my foot when I walk, and it is no where close to what I would imagine walking on a cloud, like the name would lead you to believe, to be. I‚Äôm wondering if these were actually made by Adidas or if I got scammed as I have never had this poor of quality Adidas in my whole life. Disappointed.', 'rating': '2.0 out of 5 stars'}

Si los recomiendo', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great for wide foot, fits comfortable in love with them.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I recently got these Adidas Astrastar sneakers, and I'm very happy with their blend of style and comfort. I even wore them on a long vacation with a lot of walking, and my feet felt great with no blisters. The shoes are also very lightweight while still offering solid support.The fit is true to size, but I did notice that they are a bit wider in the toe box, which is actually a plus for me. The lace up design allows for a more secure fit. While the toe guard felt a bit stiff at first, it broke in quickly and didn't cause any issues.Overall, these shoes are a perfect balance between comfort, performance, and everyday style.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'They wide and are not too confortable if standing for 1/2 hr. I wanted to love them but not.', 'rating': '2.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I have the White/Silver/Pink version, really love the Adidas women's Astrastar sneaker!It's not recommended to wear new shoes on a trip for the first time but I took these into the city for a few days showing relatives around and even though they were brand spanking new, they were super comfy, no blisters to mention! Very cute, and easily fits with many different outfits. We walked all day long, about 10 hrs each day. I was exhausted but my feet were happy!The outsole has nice curves to it, less impact but not too curvy like some sneakers are today. The little pink accent on the heel seems like a small detail but it makes it soooo cute! The fit was true to size. Good contours on the footbed, insole molds to your foot, I have high arches.  I love them!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Adidas is one of my favorite brands of shoes and clothing. But for some reason, this style, the Astrastar is at least a half size to a full size larger than what I have always worn in an Adidas. I added some pics to compare to another Adidas I have that is also a size women's 9 1/2. So, though it's different for everybody, I would recommend sizing down in this style. All that being said, these shoes are more than worth the money.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'This shoe has very little footbed absorption, the memory foam pad is very thin and there is no arch support, it‚Äôs also very stiff.  The upper part of shoe seems sturdy.  Young adults probably wouldn‚Äôt care about the lack of support/cushion but older adults should avoid it.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, well-made, and appreciate their powder blue color. They consider them good value for money. The fit receives mixed feedback, with some finding them true to size while others say they run big. Customers disagree on the stiffness, with some describing them as very soft while others find them very stiff. Durability also gets mixed reviews.
review: {'review': 'Obsessed with these sneakers. They are light weight and comfy.  They are not stiff and immediately felt like my feet had been "breaking them in" for weeks, just pure toe tapping comfort from the start.  The quality seems good and I am not concerned that these are not "real" adidas, they look legit.  I always take a size 9 women\'s in adidas which I did for these, and they fit great.  When I first put them on, I was concerned for one second that my left big shoe was a tad small, but after wearing them for 10 minutes that issue disappeared.  I got these for $65, which is a good price.  The colors look just like pictured online, and the bubblegum pink with the neon yellow/tennis ball green looks very cool and unique.  I will spray them with suede protector to hopefully keep them clean, because I think these will be very hard to clean if something bad happens.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'They are so comfortable and stylish. I have gotten so many compliments on them. I wear them to run errands because I can keep them in all day and they don‚Äôt hurt. I wear an 81/2 but I bought a 9 because I saw that the shoe is narrow and it fits good. I would say size up if you have a bigger feet but if your feet is smaller you can go with your normal size only because they bend in the front if you get them too big.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Super cute and comfortable.  Comes with two sets of laces.  The pink is a little more neon than it shows online.  I thought it looked more pastel', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These shoes are perfect for everything from sport events to travel days, errands, or casual gatherings. I\'m 5\'5" tall=65 inches, so 56 inches seems ridiculously long.', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Love these shoes! So comfortable and recieved in timely matter. Fit perfectly and love the look.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'So cute bought for teen daughter she loves them holding up great and super cute details', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I have an older foot with a narrow heel, regular arch and a regular width in the toe area. These shoes fit perfectly. I think this shoe is true to size and the fit provided ample toe space which for me increases the comfort and my ability to wear this shoe all day for a lot of walking. I can adjust the fit with the ample laces to accommodate mild swelling or a slightly thicker sock when needed. The padding of the foot bed is engineered for comfort and did not disappoint me. They also provide excellent stability and maneuverability as I can mildly feel contact with the ground. Some say there is not enough cushion in the foot bed but I found them to be a perfect walking shoe with all day comfort. This popular style matches almost any type of casual dress and I even wore them in the gym.  They aren‚Äôt bulky and pack well so they are also a great travel shoe. This is my second pair and my daily ‚Äúgo to‚Äù shoe so I can say after a few years they are durable as well.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Cute shoe. Good quality. Run narrow. Not for wide feet.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, lightweight, and suitable for various activities including walking, running errands, and working out. The shoes receive positive feedback for their simple style and quality, with one customer noting the cloud foam makes them feel weightless. Customers disagree on the fit, with some finding them too small, while opinions on support are divided between those who find them supportive and those who say they don't provide enough support for serious walking. The ease of putting them on is also mixed, with some finding them easy to slip on and off while others say they're difficult to get on.
review: {'review': "I bought these in the white and silver/green (gorgeous color by the way).  I first decided to buy the white to take on my three week trip to Croatia, Paris, Amsterdam.  I wasn't sure how the white would hold up without getting really dirty.  But non-the-less, I decided they felt so VERY comfortable, it was worth taking them.First, they were absolutely fantastic to walk in ALL day (7-12 miles of walking per day, as you do on European vacations).  I did NOT have to break them in, in any way whatsoever.  They were comfortable from the start (and let me add I have a small bunion, from my years of high heels, that apparently loved them too).  Oh, and occasionally I'd add a comfort pad if I knew it'd be a long day on my feet; but quite honestly, they're cushy soft anyway and found it was not necessary.  My feet were never sore at any time or even by the end of a long walking day; amazing!Second.  They did get a little dirty, and even more so at home from constant wear (love them so much).  I have thrown them in a snug garment bag multiple different times, tossed them in the washing machine on a cold water wash and they wash up beautifully without any damage or breakdown to the shoes - but air dry them.Third.  They are so fashionable.  They not only feel great but they look fantastic with everything you wear.  I've had so many unexpected compliments on them.  As I mentioned before, I also bought the silver/green pair.  They're gorgeous.  What a great color!So overall, I am SUPER happy with the style, fit, durability and comfort of these shoes.  I'd give them 100 stars if I could.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'One of the most comfortable shoes. The colors were spot on as the pictures.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I absolutely love these adidas! I had the previous model of these shoes, that is very similar. They have made a few minor changes on this model. The ankle area is a slightly different shape and the front of the shoe seems to have a little added structure. Overall it‚Äôs very similar to the previous model but does look a tiny bit different and more updated. I do like this model better! I am a big fan of adidas cloudfoam. I love that you can tie them once and slip them on and off. Obviously they are super comfortable, hence the name cloudfoam. I have washed my previous model in the washing machine (air dry) and they have always come out fine. I use them for everyday and also walking my dog for exercise. I have one pair for exercise and one pair for casual wear with jeans and leggings. They are super cute and easily go with everything due to the neutral colors offered. They look feminine and stylish. The previous model of this shoe I have in size 7.5 and this model I have in a size 8. I noticed that people weren‚Äôt saying this shoe runs as large as the previous model did, so that‚Äôs why I ordered my normal size 8. I‚Äôm glad I did, they fit perfectly. I would recommend these for everyday or for walking/exercise. Personally I would not recommend these for long distance running because I think this is more of a low impact walking shoe in my opinion. Maybe this would be fine for running for some, but back when I was running (I just walk now due to an injury) I would‚Äôve picked a shoe with a thicker sole and more shock impact protection. Everyone is different. I have tried to run in these and they weren‚Äôt as good as my Nike revolution 5 running shoe. They weren‚Äôt terrible for running though, there‚Äôs just better choices imo! Overall these shoes are great! I would imagine this would be a great shoe if you are on your feet all day.  Side note, to all you moms out there who live in leggings like me (lol) these look super cute paired with leggings!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I‚Äôve bought these shoes so many times‚Äîthey‚Äôre my go-to! They‚Äôre perfect for daily walks and indoor training. I‚Äôm not a big runner, so I can‚Äôt speak to how they‚Äôd hold up for serious running, but I imagine they might wear out too quickly if used for that.For my purposes, they‚Äôre great. I wear them every day for walks, and they usually last me about 4‚Äì5 months before the soles start to wear down and they begin to look a little dirty. That said, even after that point, I still keep using them‚Äîthey‚Äôre that comfortable.They go with everything, feel super lightweight, and are easy to slip on and off. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for an everyday sneaker for walking, errands, or light workouts!', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable and provides great support', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I love these shoes! I‚Äôm partial to Adidas anyway but these are especially great. I wore them on my trip to Italy where we walked 58 miles in 2 weeks on cobblestone streets. Great support (I have very high arches), comfortable with no break in time, very lightweight and simple style to work with nearly any outfit. Buy these, you won‚Äôt regret it.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Seem like knockoffs/counterfeit.These run incredibly small (literally needed to size up by 2 sizes.) they feel very cheap compared to traditional ‚Äúrunning shoes‚Äù and I would definitely not wear these to workout as they provide zero stability or structure. They are fine for everyday shoes/travel etc. Definitely overpriced in my opinion for how thin and cheap they feel.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Wife loves the cloudfoams. Puts numerous hours a day in on her feet. Has been through 2 pair and both have lasted longer than expected. Worth the money. And she loves the comfort. Fits true to size. Lightweight.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one mentioning they can wear them all day without pain, and appreciate their great quality, nice colors, and good value for money. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some find them roomy around the toes, others note they run very narrow. The support and durability also get mixed reviews, with some praising the arch support while others find it lacking, and while some say they hold up well to elements, others report issues with laces ripping through holes.
review: {'review': "Love, Love my Adidas sneakers! I broke a few toes 2 years ago and since then the toe area is too tight and hurts to walk, and I have very narrow feet so finding shoes are hard....most shoes that said wide toe box, the shoe itself was wide also. My daughter mentioned she wears Adidas and they are pretty roomy in the toe area. I read the reviews and someone else had mention this. So I bought a pair and they are like a dream on my feet! This pair is my second pair. I am able to walk long distances, stand on my feet in one place for hours, and ride my bike without hurting. Durable and Great Support all over. I purchased black and pink which are perfect for where I work as they wipe off easily. I haven't washed them yet, but I feel like they would withstand a trip in the washer. Only issue I have with them is where the tongue attaches to the area at the top of the laces (closest to the toes), I have to shove my finger in to smooth it out before tying or it's uncomfortable. Otherwise, these are my go to shoes going forward!", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'These are my favorite shoes. Love the fit, the color and comfort. I have used for walking and the gym.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'So I ordered these on August 27th 2024, and it is now June 19th 2025, and they have finally started breaking down and causing problems for my feet. I wore them almost every day, and as a college student, there can be a lot of walking all over campus. review: {'review': 'These adidas Puremotion Adapt sneakers have been a win for me. Super lightweight, easy slip-on style, and surprisingly supportive for everyday wear. The color combo looks even better in person‚Äîclean with just the right pop of orange. They do run a touch snug at first but break in nicely after a couple of wears. Perfect for chasing my toddlers around or casual outings where I want comfort without sacrificing style.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I‚Äôve been wearing these for a week during my everyday light cardio, and I like them! The color is so pretty! But the best part for me is that the bottom is not too soft, so I can actually feel my feet are on a solid surface and keep my balance.I‚Äôm usually a 6.5, but according to the size guide, I need to size down, so I ordered a 6 and they fit perfectly.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I was skeptical about how well these sneakers were going to fit. I‚Äôm very particular about how sneakers fit me (because I get blisters very easily). When I first put them on, I felt they were a little snug around the sides. I walked around in them when I took my kids for a walk, then took them off for the day. However, the next day, I slipped them on, and BAM, they fit like a glove! For my high arch they provide enough support. Even with no-show socks on, the rim of the shoe has yet to give me blisters. They feel snug enough where if I run I don‚Äôt feel like they will come off, but not so snug where they are uncomfortable. I believe they are designed for a more ‚Äúcustom feel‚Äù, thus why they may feel snug or tight initially. For my size 7 foot, they fit nicely. I do not run, so I cannot comment on how practical they are as a running shoe. But as a mom of two kids under 5, I can vouch for their comfort as an every day sneaker.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Great shoes. Adidas have always been comfortable and easy on my feet and back. Great for being on your feet a lot. My only problem is both are the same size. But the newer ones fit smaller than the others did when I first bought them. You can tell put in a lot of work on the first pairü§£ As I said, Great shoes for being on your feet a lot and doesn't make my feet and back hurt as much as other shoes. Will definitely be getting more of course. But might size up a little on the next pair. The newer ones are starting to stretch out a little more so they aren't as tight as they were previously but still just a little too tight for my liking.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "This shoe is lightweight, comfortable, supportive, and stylish. I get tons of compliments. I will definitely be buying more. No more bulky, lace up sneakers for me.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Excellent value. They feel light weight and supportive. That being said, I bought them to bartend in and even after breaking them in, my feet are SCREAMING by the end of an 8 hour shift. The worst part is I have very expensive custom insoles I planned on putting in them, but the memory foam insole the shoe comes with is sewn in and cannot be removed. So these are cute but don't buy if you plan on being on your feet all day!", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The most comfortable shoes.. La verdad s√∫per recomendable!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I liked these shoes, so I ordered them going by the reviews thinking they would help me work a comfortable 10-hour shift but was sadly mistaken. Tried wearing them without an insole, and with two separate insoles with no look. The shoelaces are extremely too short for one, they rubbed the sides of my feet so badly that by the time I got home I had to elevate my feet cuz I could barely walk. I loosened the shoelaces hoping to give my foot more room but no matter how loose I made the shoelaces I was still left in extreme pain. Normally I do not wear a wide shoe, which is why I did not order a wide. Honestly I'm not even sure a wide would have fit me comfortably because the material up top is not very flexible at all. I even tried to wear them for two or three days before wearing them to work to break them in and it didn't help at all. After wearing them for one week, I'd had enough and decided to send them back. So if anyone does a job on their feet for 10 hours and does a lot of moving from left to right these are not the shoes for you. Unless you are a sucker for pain the only part of your foot that will not hurt is the heel of your foot. There's no proper arch support and not enough padding around the toes and ball of the feet, let alone toe room for an active person. I will be finding something else. review: {'review': '', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I purchased these shoes for my daughter. Should last her for quite a while.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Recently had twins and my old Nikes were feeling tight size 8.5 so I ordered these in a 9. These are great for trail running and although I originally did not care for the color scheme,‚Ä¶. These shoes feel like a dream and it made upFor not having any cute girl colors! Size 9 fits perfect in these. These are lightweight but feel like you‚Äôre being supported by a pillow cloud beneath your feet with all the support they have. I feel lighter. I love them.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "For the most part these are great shoes. Quality is what you would expect from Adidas. In my opinion, that's great quality. The sole is very comfortable with lots of cushion and arch support. I think they will be great for hiking. I do not like hiking boots and prefer trail runners. These have a good mesh amount to keep your feet cool but enough solid area to keep them dry if you are dealing with minimal amounts of water. The heel is a bit bulky but provides a lot of extra support. I love the bright orange color. I always try to get bright colors for hiking gear just in case I need to be seen. The only complaint I have is that they are tad narrow. I have a narrow foot, and these are snug on me. It's not an uncomfortable amount though. They will also stretch more as I wear them in. Length wise they are true to size. I wear a 7 and these have the perfect amount of room between the tip of the shoe and the tip of my big toe. If I went a half size bigger for width they would be too long. I have another pair of Adidas I wear to the gym that I had to go half a size smaller (Adidas Swift Run). review: {'review': "LOVE these sneakers. Love Adidas products...well made, neutral balance, for those new to Ultra boost training shoes the opening is typically snug to insert the foot. I like this and I like how this shoe opening hugs the ankle. Took them out of the box and went on a 3 mile walk...super comfortable and I'm very happy with my purchase. I recommend these shoes.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'The main critique folks have of these shoes is that it is hard to get them on.  These folks seem never to have heard of shoe horns.  Makes it quick and easy!  But quite difficult without one, because of the stretchy sock that helps keep your foot in place during long runs.  This shoe is most known for its comfort, and ability to give help in forward propulsion when your heel hits the ground.  The effect is not as pronounced as some Nikes, that also have a higher differential between heel height and front of shoe.  For folks accustomed to Zero naked feet flat shoes, these can be too much heellThese wash beautifully in the washing machine.  But don‚Äôt put them in the dryer.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I bought these adidas Ultraboost 1.0 sneakers specifically for a multi-day Disneyland trip, and let me just say: these shoes understood the assignment.From rope drop to fireworks, these babies carried me through 25,000 steps a day with zero blisters, zero aching arches, and zero regrets. I usually have to rotate shoes or sneak in a pair of sandals mid-day, but not this time. These Ultraboosts were light, breathable, and so ridiculously cushioned that I started referring to them as my ‚Äúwalking clouds.‚Äù I‚Äôm not even kidding.The Grey/White/Blue color combo is even better in person, stylish enough to match all my park outfits but subtle enough that they didn‚Äôt scream ‚Äúnew shoes at a theme park.‚Äù They‚Äôre sleek, cute, and made me feel like I was walking on memory foam wrapped in marshmallows.Fit-wise, they were perfect right out of the box. I didn‚Äôt even have to break them in (which is a Disneyland miracle). I wear a size 9 and found them true to size with just enough wiggle room for swelling after 12 hours on my feet.Bonus: they didn‚Äôt stain or scuff easily, even after a churro mishap and a surprise splash from Pirates of the Caribbean. Clean-up was easy, and they still look brand new.If you‚Äôre headed to the parks or just need something comfy for all-day errands, buy these. Your feet will thank you. Mine are still applauding.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable, somewhat difficult to get over the heel but fits well once you get it.I don‚Äôt know if this is just the pair I got, but it has some weird material around the edges on the sole. Still really like them!', 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Feels and looks great on. I will try them out at the Chris Brown concert. I wear a 7.5 but I ordered an 8.5 and they fit great.these run small I knew it from reading the reviews. I have fat feet right now but I'd recommend you ordering one size up if you have wide feet. If I had gotten the 7.5 the shoe would fit to a T no extra room none at all. I have the pink and turquoise like these from Adidas outlet. They were so small I had to get those in 8.5 as well last year I haven't worn them yet. Order half size up not whole size they stretch out amd losses. Up after wearing", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Great school shoe!  These survived the entire school year without any holes or major damage.  Huge win in my book!  My daughter liked them so much we just got a 2nd pair for her everyday sneakers.  Cute, comfy and fit true to size.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'They run a lot more narrow than usual.', 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "These are absolutely horrible. I have no idea how they get such awesome reviews from people who legit bought them and wear them regularly. Are they cute? Sure. But omg they hurt so bad. First thing I did was try them on in the house and they squeaked but I figured, eh maybe that will stop. Thankfully once there was some dirt on them, it did. They also felt a bit snug around the top of my foot but I figured eh, maybe that will loosen over time because obviously loosening up the ties does nothing on a shoe with a built in tongue. They were comfortable in all the other ways, but it did not loosen. I wore these on a trip to Las Vegas and the tops of my feet hurt SO bad by the end of day 2 of walking around. I wore sandals off and on for the rest of the trip and absolutely dreaded putting them back on for the airplane ride home. That's when I noticed my feet were legit BRUISED on top, from the weird pressure under the laces on my foot. There is no way to fix it and if it happens to you, just know that it won't loosen. You will hate these shoes that are so comfortable in every other way.I even went so far as to googling this issue, where I landed on the many Reddit threads full of other people wondering what in the world is going on with these shoes. I don't think it's just me. I have pretty small feet and I do not have high arches at all. Buy these at your own risk.", 'rating': '2.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and supportive, with great arch support and no foot aches or blisters. They appreciate the shoes' quality, appearance, and value for money, with one customer noting they're excellent for both daily runs and longer distances. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some say they fit great, others find them too tight for average feet.
review: {'review': "Key FeaturesBoost Midsole: Provides exceptional energy return and cushioning.Primeknit Upper: Offers a snug, sock-like fit for maximum comfort.Stretchweb Outsole: Adapts to the runner's stride for a smooth ride.Torsion System: Ensures stability and flexibility during runs.Eco-Friendly: Made with Primeblue, a high-performance recycled material.ProsComfort: The Boost midsole delivers superior cushioning and energy return.Fit: Primeknit upper offers a flexible, snug fit.Stability: Torsion system enhances stability and support.Durability: High-quality materials ensure long-lasting performance.Eco-Conscious: Made with sustainable materials.ConsPrice: Higher price point compared to other running shoes.Weight: Slightly heavier than some ultra-light running shoes.Break-In Period: May require a few runs to fully break in.Personal ExperienceThe Adidas Women's Ultraboost 22 has proven to be an excellent choice for both daily runs and longer distances. The Boost midsole provides outstanding cushioning, making each step feel energized and comfortable. The Primeknit upper fits like a glove, reducing the risk of blisters and providing excellent breathability.The shoe's stability is impressive, thanks to the Torsion system, which supports the foot without compromising flexibility. The Stretchweb outsole adapts well to my stride, offering a smooth and responsive ride.While the shoes are slightly heavier than some other running models, the comfort and support they provide outweigh this minor drawback. The eco-friendly aspect is a bonus, aligning with my values of sustainability.ConclusionThe Adidas Women's Ultraboost 22 Running Shoe is a top-tier choice for runners seeking comfort, support, and performance. Despite its higher price and slight weight, the benefits of superior cushioning, stability, and eco-conscious design make it a worthwhile investment for serious runners.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I live ultraboost and will always buy them these are very comfy', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': '', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'So cute and fit perfect.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "Most of the people have a problem with how these fit. HOWEVER, you have to wear them more than once to break them in. Once you do, they are amazing. It took me 4 wears with this pair and after that, I am in comfort for an entire 10 hour day on my feet. With every pro there is a con:Biggest con is actually the white bottom layer of the shoe. The material is weak and scuffs and gets dirty VERY quickly. This part cannot really be cleaned or it tears the material. By my 2nd wear there was a random part scuffed off on the side of the shoe and I have no clue how which means I didn't run into anything. This tells me just how weak the material is.", 'rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I love these shoes so much!  When I first got them I thought I'd have to return them.  They were tight at the top of my foot and it hurt a lot.  I decided to try stretching them because I was going on a trip and thought these would be the easiest shoes to incorporate into a biz/casual wardrobe (and they were).  It took about two weeks of intermittent wear to really feel good in them.  I ended up taking them on the trip and they were so comfortable.  Before getting these I was getting cortisone injections in my feet due to many issues I was having.  Happy to say that since using these regularly, I haven't had any injections.  They provide the right support.  I've also purchased 2 more pairs and am shopping for a fourth :). The only thing I would say that isn't ideal is that when walking in rain, these kick rain onto the top of your toes and they are knit, so your toes will get a bit wet.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I love, love, love these adidas ultra boost heat ready running shoes.  They are super light, excellent cushioning for both balls of feet and heels. Excellent grip and traction. They have great arch support too! This is my second pair and I‚Äôd recommend to anyone needing a great running shoe!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': "I feel like the shoe would have been comfortable as it felt like it would be padded in all the right places and give arch support AND it looks nice. I can't actually say that I was comfortable as I couldn't get my foot all the way inside the shoe. The sock like opening just didn't stretch enough for my high arches and I could not get my foot inside before circulation started to become an issue. If you have high arches I would not recommend them, but if you don't have problems getting your feet into these ridiculous sock opening shoes that also tie, don't frustrate yourself.", 'rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars'}

customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, good-looking, and among the best walking shoes ever, appreciating their lightweight design. The fit and ease of putting them on receive mixed feedback - while some say they run true to size and are easy to slip on, others find them too narrow and hard to put on. The arch support and cushioning also get mixed reviews, with some praising the great arch support while others note there's not enough cushioning.
review: {'review': "These adidas Cloudfoam Pure sneakers have been perfect for everyday wear, offering impressive comfort thanks to the Cloudfoam cushioning that really does feel like walking on clouds. The clean, minimalist design works well with everything from workout gear to casual jeans and dresses, making them incredibly versatile for daily activities. I appreciate that they're lightweight and breathable, keeping my feet comfortable during long days of walking or standing without feeling heavy or clunky. The fit runs true to size with good arch support, and they've held up well to regular use without showing excessive wear or losing their shape. While they're not designed for serious athletic activities, they excel as comfortable lifestyle sneakers that provide the perfect balance of style, comfort, and affordability - definitely a solid choice for anyone looking for reliable everyday footwear from a trusted brand.", 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'I absolutely love these tennis shoes!! customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, well-made, and true to size, with one customer noting the cushioning has a "gel" padding feel. They receive positive feedback for their style, fit, and value, and customers appreciate their traction, with one mentioning they can walk in them all day. Customers disagree on whether the shoes run true to size.
review: {'review': 'So I ordered these shoes back in late May because I needed new shoes for walking and own numerous pairs of Adidas sneakers. Well these caught my eye and were on sale for under $40 so obviously I bought them! Well when they arrived I tried them on and they literally looked like I was ready for the circus because they were so big. I wear a size 7 to a 7.5 in my fully enclosed shoes. Since I planned to wear thicker socks and a killer sale price I ordered a 7.5. Well these have to be a men‚Äôs size because they were so big but comfortable. Well I went to order a smaller size and was shocked that they were double the cost. So I returned them and ordered two other styles in 3 different sizes, only to keep one pair in a size 7. I still wanted these but at the $40 price point, so I watched and waited. While waiting, returning other pairs, and reading ALL reviews I had a better idea of the size that would probably work. Obviously the size chart wasn‚Äôt accurate and didn‚Äôt help the first time. Finally after after 2 months the price dropped and I ordered the replacement pair in a size 6.5. I tried them on and they are still a little big even with thick socks on but not bad enough for another return. A size 6 would be perfect with toe wiggle room but these will work. They are extremely padded especially around the Achilles tendon and ankle portion. The cushion almost has a ‚Äúgel‚Äù padding feel and surrounds the outer part of the foot. So my other pairs of Adidas sneakers range from a 5 to a 7! This brand doesn‚Äôt seem to be consistent with size but are worth it when you find your fit. These are noticeably heavier on then most sneakers but that is do to the really thick shock absorbing sole and the padding. However it‚Äôs not heavy enough for me to give up the comfort. I have clubbed toes on my left foot and this shoe doesn‚Äôt bother me. So in conclusion I went from a 7.5 down to a 6.5 and could‚Äôve easily worn a 6! So I would suggest sizing down at least a half size down minimal. I expect they‚Äôll last me at least a year or more easily with this being used as a primary daily shoe. So be prepared for a possible return or wearing thicker socks. I hope this helps and good luck with your purchase!', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'True to size. Comfortable fit. Feels like walking on a cloud lots of cushion.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'Very comfortable like walking on clouds, great price.', 'rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars'} {'review': 'When I write reviews I like to be thorough so as to help people truly make an informed decision, so, here goes: The shoe is GREAT looking in person, the white color scheme I chose goes with everything, which is important to a person like me who always needs to match. The comfort of the shoe is 5 stars, it\'s like working out on a cloud, and I don\'t say that lightly. The shoe hits 5 stars for everything BUT..the sizing. It\'s never easy going through sizing discrepancy reviews because there\'s never enough detail or comparison, I\'m gonna give you some. The size 10 shoe, is going for $26, 2 weeks ago, I ordered the 9.5 and it was on sale for $39. Now 9.5 is up & the size 9, only the size 10 is for $26 because the sizing is so off I\'ll bet they are stuck with a bunch of returns and regular inventory for that size. I got the 9.5 cheaper than it is now and I think the price went up because normal size 10 wearers grew aware of this so went for the next size down, and the one after that, driving the price up, which is my only issue with this product or seller. Shoes should be the same price across the board like they\'ve always been but consumers are now having to pay more for the sellers not being detailed enough in their product as to write a product description that would aide consumers in choosing the right size and lowering returns & exchanges. I am normally between a 9.5 & 10 shoe size. For heels it\'s usually a 10, with the rare shoe still being too small. For a tennis shoe it\'s usually a 9.5 as a 10 is usually too big, except for the rare occasion it\'s just right. To give you an idea of my foot: I am 5\'9, 130lbs, I am built long, bony, & muscular but my hands & feet don\'t have an ounce of fattie tissue on them & they don\'t swell. When a shoe fits, ot fits, when it doesn\'t, it doesnt. This shoe surprised the heck out of me because I don\'t remember the last time a size 9.5 sneaker felt like a 10.5. I can get away with the 9.5 because I\'ve put a shoe insert in & I wear thick socks & the laces tie up very securely, which is another plus. My workouts are going just fine save for the stairmaster. I hate dealing with exchanges & returns so if I can make it work then I will, so thankfully, I could make due-but, I want others to know why the price discrepancy differences and what shoe size may work. If you are built bony like me but also have gunboats for feet, I would say go a full size down. Even me going to my usual 9.5, my lowest size, was barely doable, only so because I\'ve got a good thick insole insert. If you have thicker feet, I\'d say go half a size down because with this shoe it\'s not the width of the shoe that\'s the problem, the shoe cinches up & loosens great, it\'s the length of the shoe that\'s inaccurate. I still recommend this shoe, but I am a gym rat & go through sneakers like crazy so I\'ll get a new pair when I run through these, that\'s how much I love them.
